loans.name: François

texts.fr: François est un homme de 33 ans, célibataire et sans enfant. il vend des chaussures dans une place de la ville depuis 2 ans.il sollicite ce crédit pour renforcer son stock de marchandises en achetant des chaussures friperie. les bénéfices générés de cette vente vont lui permettre d'agrandir son activité et son capital d'une part et de construire un logement pour lui.
texts.en: François is a single 33-year-old man with no children. He has sold shoes in a location in the city for two years. He has requested a loan to increase his stock of merchandise by buying second-hand shoes. The income from the sale of these shoes will allow him to expand his business and his capital. It will also help build him a home.

loans.use: to buy more shoes.

loans.name: Uvas Group

texts.en:
The “Uvas” (grapes) Trust Bank is from a community in Quetzaltenango, Guatemala and is composed of ten women. They are starting their fourth loan cycle with Friendship Bridge. Their average age is forty and each has an average of three children. The ladies are engaged in various businesses including the sale of new and used clothing, shoes, tortillas, produce and snacks. Some own small retail storefronts.

The Trust Bank enjoys meeting together once each month. They make payments on their loan. They also receive valuable edcational training on various topics like family planning, economics, savings as well as the rights of children. They are able to implement what they learn into their lives which helps them create different patterns in their own lives as well as in their families.

Carmen is a 50-years-old member of “Uvas” who has benefited from her loans. Several years ago, she and her family began to manufacture and sell various types of shoes. Currently, she needs more capital for the business and so she is requesting a loan with Friendship Bridge. She will use the funds to increase her working capital and purchase materials for shoes. In this way, she will be able to meet the needs of her customers instead of stopping production. In addition, Carmen will be able to sell shoes in two nearby markets each week. She is pleased that her business can continue to generate income in order to maintain her household expenses. She tells us that both she and her husband can provide a higher standard of living to their entire family.
 
The ten micro-entrepreneurs of the “Uvas” Trust Bank are grateful for the loans that they have received through KIVA and Friendship Bridge. They are looking forward to a brighter future not only for themselves and their families but also for their community as well.

loans.use: to purchase materials to make shoes.

loans.name: Victor

texts.es:
Victor se dedica a la cría de ganado vacuno para la producción de leche la cual vende a una de las Plantas Industrializadoras de Leche de La Paz. Victor vive con su familia en su domicilio propio ubicado en la comunidad de Huayrocondo, del Sector  Batallas de La provincia Los Andes del Departamento de La Paz a una hora y media de distancia  de la ciudad de La Paz; cuenta con  varias cabezas de ganado de raza mejorada las cuales requieren mejor cuidado alimenticio
.
El crédito requiere para comprar forraje y alimento balanceado para su ganado, este será un mejor alimento para que su producción mejore y se incremente.

El sueño de Victor  es incrementar sus cabezas de ganado, y convertirse en uno de los máximos productores del sector.

Es la cuarta vez que solicita crédito junto a IMPRO y la segunda  vez con KIVA.
texts.en:
Victor makes a living raising cattle. He sells milk from his cows to an industrial plant named Leche de la Paz. Victor lives with his family in a house he owns that is located in the community of Huayrocondo, in the Batallas sector of the province Los Andes, in the department of La Paz. He lives about an hour-and-a-half away from the city of La Paz. Victor owns various cows of superior breeds that require more nutritional care.

He needs this loan to buy fodder and balanced feed for his cattle. This better food will help improve the quality and quantity of milk that his cows produce. 

Victor's dream is to get more cows and become one of the biggest producers in his sector. 

This is Victor's fourth loan from IMPRO bank and his second through Kiva.

loans.use: to buy fodder and balanced feed for his cows. That way they will produce better-quality milk.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy manure and fertilizers for her coffee crops.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: with website development, purchasing inventory and advertising her online hair product shop

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine is happy for the loans she has received through Milango. Her business is running well, and she looks forward to increasing the operations in her business. Christine has established a good network of customers and at times sells fresh bananas to her neighbours. 

She is applying for a loan of 63,850 Kenya shillings to purchase salon products such as cosmetics. The extra income will help in her children's education.

loans.use: to purchase salon products such as cosmetics.

loans.name: Juanita

texts.es:
Juanita   se dedica a la cría de ganado vacuno para la producción de leche la cual vende a una de las Plantas Industrializadoras de Leche de La Paz. Juanita vive en casa propia junto a sus hijos y su esposo el cual se dedica también a realizar trabajos de albañilería en su comunidad, su casa se encuentra ubicada en la comunidad de Chojasivi, del Sector Tambillo de La provincia Los Andes del Departamento de La Paz a tres horas  de distancia  de la ciudad de La Paz; cuenta con  cabezas de ganado de raza mejorada las cuales requieren mayor cuidado dada las condiciones climatológicas del sector
.
El crédito lo requiere para comprar material de construcción: cemento, ladrillos, calamina  etc. Así podrá  refaccionar el establo para ganado, por lo tanto mejorar su producción, conservando la buena salud de sus vacas.

El sueño de Juanita y su familia, es incrementar sus cabezas de ganado, precautelando la buena salud de ellos.

Es la primera vez que solicita crédito junto a IMPRO y la primera    vez con KIVA.
texts.en:
Juanita makes a living raising cattle in order to sell their milk to an industrial plant named Leche de la Paz. She lives with her husband and children in a house they own that is located in the community of Chojasivi, in the sector of Tambillo, in the province Los Andes, in the department of La Paz. She lives about three hours away from the city of La Paz.

Juanita owns cows of a very good breed that require careful attention, given the weather typical of this region. She is requesting this loan in order to buy construction materials: cement, bricks, corrugated iron, etc. With these, she will be able to repair the stable for her cows. This will keep her cows healthier and improve their milk production. 

Juanita and her family hope to acquire more cows in the future.

This is Juanita's first loan with IMPRO and with Kiva.

loans.use: to buy cement, bricks, and corrugated iron to repair the stable for her dairy cows.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy chicks and feeds.

loans.name: Munira

texts.en:
Munira is a resident of Kilifi, Kenya. She is a married mother of two children who attend school. She runs a clothes shop which has been operating for two years. Besides this, she also sells the clothes through hawking.  

Munira was introduced to Milango by her friends and joined to access credit. She is applying for a loan of 41,850 Kenya shillings to purchase new clothes for sale.

Munira believes the income from this loan will help her educate her children and is focused on owning a whole-sale shop despite the challenge of bad debts.

loans.use: to purchase new clothes to sell.

loans.name: Ruben

texts.es:
Ruben es casado y tiene cinco hijos dos varones y tres mujeres que están en etapa escolar, vive en la casa propia donde cuenta con un ambiente y se encuentra el dormitorio con  cocina, no cuenta con  baño, la  habitación es de adobe y el piso de tierra, la casa se encuentra ubicada en la zona Mecapaca, Sector Palomar.
Actualmente trabaja en el cultivo de hortalizas, y la esposa también trabaja en el cultivo  y limpiando las chacras, sus productos los comercializa por la misma zona donde vive  y en la ciudad de La Paz. Ruben también se dedica a la venta de material de construcción, tiene una tienda que está ubicada en la misma zona del Palomar;  el lugar de trabajo  donde produce hortalizas es un lugar lleno de tierra y polvo, ellos trabajan todos los días de la semana, ambos  colaboran en el pago de los servicios, comida y vestimenta, y educación de sus hijos.
El crédito lo requiere para Invertir en semilla mejorada y tener mejor producción de hortalizas, para que se vendan más rápido y a buen precio. 
El sueño de Ruben es poder contar con capital de trabajo, y herramientas que le facilita a mejorar su producción y así  mejorar su calidad de vida.
Es la primera vez que solicita crédito junto a IMPRO Y KIVA.
texts.en:
Ruben is married and has five children, two boys and three girls, all of whom attend school. He lives in his own house with a yard; it also has a bedroom and kitchen but no bathroom. The house is made of adobe with earth floors. It is located in the Mecapaca zone, Palomar sector.

Ruben currently grows vegetables as does his wife who also weeds the fields. The produce is sold in the same area where they live as well as in the town of La Paz.  Ruben also sells construction materials. He has a store located in the Palomar area. The place where he grows vegetables is full of earth and dust. Ruben and his wife work every day of the week and pay for services, food, clothing, and their children’s education jointly.

The loan Ruben is seeking will be used to buy improved seeds so he can grow better vegetables, sell them more quickly, and for better prices.

His dream is to have some working capital and tools that help him improve production so that he can have a better quality of life. This is the first time he has asked IMPRO and Kiva for a loan.

loans.use: buy better seeds to improve the quality of the vegetables he grows and thus increase his income

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence lives in Kongowea area of Coast Province, Kenya. She is married and has five children, four of whom are in school. She owns a tailoring business which she has been operating for 23 years. She also runs a mobile money transfer shop.

Florence learnt about Milango from friends who invited her to the group. She joined with the aim of accessing credit to improve her business operations. Her main challenges are customers not paying on time and finding customers.

Florence is applying for a loan of 14,196.40 Kenyan shillings to buy clothes materials and a sewing machine. Her extra income from the loan will be added to her savings to meet her future needs. Her dream is to be the leading tailor in her area and also to set up more mobile money transfer shops.

loans.use: To buy clothes materials and a sewing machine.

loans.name: Brenda

texts.en:
Brenda is a resident of Likoni, Kenya. She is a charcoal seller and has been doing this business for one year. Besides this, Brenda also keeps and sells poultry.

Brenda was introduced to Milango by her friends and is asking for a loan of 74,450 Kenyan shillings to purchase a new stock of charcoal and fuel wood for sale. Despite the challenge of the high cost of transportation, Brenda believes the business has a future. She looks forward to owning a wholesale shop in the future.

loans.use: To buy new stock of charcoal and fuel wood for sale.

loans.name: Lizardo Francisco

texts.es:
Lizardo es un hombre de 33 años, es soltero, vive en la ciudad de Pucallpa, el es una persona muy amable, trabajador y entusiasta, que tiene un gran deseo de superación; lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos y por la necesidad que tuvo de trabajar desde muy joven, Lizardo no pudo estudiar la carrera profesional de Gastronomía que deseaba, pero gracias a su habilidad y al apoyo de su madre, Lizardo aprendió a cocinar diversos platos típicos de su ciudad.
Por iniciativa propia, con mucho empeño y dedicación, Lizardo trabaja como cocinero en un restaurante de su ciudad, adicionalmente en las mañanas trabaja brindando servicios de transporte, ya que maneja una mototaxi, Lizardo trabaja todos los días por un aproximado de 10 horas y cree que le va bien por su buena sazón y por el trato amable que brinda a los demás.
Lizardo se encuentra muy agradeció con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar el mejoramiento de su vivienda, Lizardo comprará calaminas, madera, clavos y cubrirá los gastos de mano de obra, de esta manera Lizardo y su familia podrán contar con mayor seguridad y bienestar, así pues él seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr sy gran sueño de tener su propio restaurante.
texts.en:
Lizardo is a 33-year-old, single man who lives in the city of Pucallpa. He is very kind, hardworking, and enthusiastic person who dreams of excelling. Unfortunately, due to scarce financial resources, Lizardo had to begin working at a very young age and was not able to study Culinary Arts like he wanted to. However, thanks to his natural talent and the support of his mother, Lizardo learned to cook many different regional dishes from his city. 

By his own intiative and with much determination and dedication, Lizardo works as a chef in a restaurant in the city. He also works as a taxi driver in the mornings before cooking. Lizardo works about 10 hours a day and believes that his success thus far is due to his skill in the kitchen and the kind way he treats others. 

Lizardo is very grateful to Kiva lenders for the support this loan gives him. It will help him to do some repairs on his home. Lizardo will buy corrugated iron, wood, nails and will pay the wages of the workers doing the repairs. Lizardo hopes that the security from these repairs will protect his family's well-being. 

He plans to continue working hard toward his dream of opening his own restaurant.

loans.use: to improve his home.

loans.name: Ana Maria

texts.es:
ANA MARIA se dedica a la producción de quesos de leche de vaca, que los comercializa en distintas ferias de la ciudad de La Paz; el esposo trabaja en la policía. La familia vive en la comunidad Achica Bajo, Provincia Ingavi del departamento de La Paz.

El crédito lo requiere para comprar de maquinaria “ordeñadora”, misma que le ayudará para optimizar el tiempo en el ordeño de la leche y poder contar con un producto de mayor calidad y saludable.

 Ana Maria tiene el sueño de poder convertirse en una de las mayores productoras de queso de su área y mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Ana María makes a living producing cheese from cow's milk, which she sells in various markets in the city of La Paz.  Her husband works for the police.  Her family lives in the community of Achica Bajo in Ingavi Province in the department of La Paz.

She needs the loan to buy milking equipment that will help her optimize the time for milking as well as be able to have a higher-quality and healthier product.

Ana María's dream is to be able to become one of the largest cheese producers in her area and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a milking machine

loans.name: Ivan

texts.en:
Ivan is married. He has two children who are 17 and 20 years old. Ivan has his own business. 

Ivan has been selling different household goods for a long time. He was a part owner of the business before. But then he decided to start a new one.  The most popular products that Ivan sells are varnishes and paints. Ivan is a hardworking and careful person. He wants to provide higher education to his children.

Ivan is asking for a loan of 24,000 UAH to buy products for the season such as paints, spikes, varnishes and others.

loans.use: to buy products for the season like paints, spikes, varnishes

loans.name: Bienvinido

texts.en: Bienvinido is a 53-year-old married man from Talibon, Bohol. He has three children. The oldest child is 22, while the youngest is 19. He provides motorcycle transport services. He transports customers from one place to another. He has been offering motorcycle services for almost 20 years. In order to continue his motorcycle transport services to his customers, Bienvinido requested a loan of 20,000 PHP to buy motorcycle parts and new tires. This will enable him to accommodate his customers quickly and without delay. In the future, Bienvinido would like to expand his motorcycle services to support his family and to improve his livelihood.

loans.use: to buy motorcycle spare parts and new tires

loans.name: Bernardo

texts.en:
Bernardo, a 41-year-old married man from Talibon, Bohol, has three children ranging in age from 15 to 5 years. For 12 years now, Bernardo has been operating a sari-sari (variety) store that sells items including noodles, canned goods, seasonings, biscuits and beverages. It is the family's sole source of income.

Bernardo has requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to buy additional soft drinks. In the future, he would like to expand his business to better support his family and send his children to school.

loans.use: to buy additional soft drinks.

loans.name: Mher

texts.en:
Mher is still engaged in farming and animal breeding. His last loan from Kiva helped him to increase the number of his cows and pigs. During the last year, Mher has sold a lot of beef, pork, cheese and eggs. He received a good profit and enlarged his agricultural business. Part of this profit he used to buy special tools for milking the cows, which is shown in his profile photo. It helps him milk cows faster and more effectively. With another part of his profit, Mher paid off his Kiva loan ahead of schedule.
 
Mher’s wife and mother grow wheat, oats, grapes, fruits and vegetables on their plot of land. They work hard day and night to overcome some economical difficulties in their life.
 
Apart from agriculture, Mher has found a new job in Ijevan city where he works in a construction company as a worker. Mher accumulates his salary from his construction occupation in order to build a new barn for his animals. This is his big dream and as he confessed, he will do his best to reach that dream as soon as possible. 

Mher asks for his second loan from Kiva lenders to buy eight young piglets (farrows), fodder for his animals and to organize seeding in his plot of land.

loans.use: To buy eight young piglets (farrows), fodder for his animals and to organize seeding in his plot of land

loans.name: Osvaldo

texts.es:
Osvaldo se dedica a la cría de ganado vacuno para la producción de leche la cual vende a una de las Plantas Industrializadoras de Leche de La Paz.  El vive con  su esposa y su hija pequeña, en su casa propia ubicada en la comunidad de Tahari, del Sector Achacachi de La provincia Omasuyos del Departamento de La Paz a dos horas y media  de distancia  de la ciudad de La Paz; Osvaldo cuenta con  algunas cabezas de ganado de raza mejorada las cuales requieren mejor cuidado dada las condiciones climatológicas del sector.

El crédito lo requiere para comprar material de construcción: cemento, ladrillos, etc. Así podrá  refaccionar el establo para ganado, por lo tanto mejorar su producción, conservando la buena salud de sus vacas.

El sueño de Osvaldo  es incrementar sus cabezas de ganado, precautelando la buena salud de ellos.

Es la primera vez que solicita crédito junto a IMPRO y la primera  vez con KIVA.
texts.en:
Osvaldo makes a living raising cattle to produce milk, which he sells at one of the industrial milk plants in La Paz.  He lives with his wife and young daughter in his own house in the community of Tahari in the Achacachi area of Omasuyos Province in the department of La Paz, about two-and-a-half hours from the city of La Paz.

Osvaldo has some head of improved-breed cattle that require better care, given the area climate conditions.  He needs the loan to buy construction material--cement, bricks, etc.--so he can repair the livestock stable and improve his production while preserving the cows' good health.

Osvaldo's dream is to increase his head of cattle and ensure their good health.

This is the first time he has requested a loan from IMPRO and the first time from Kiva.

loans.use: to buy cement and bricks to repair his cow stable

loans.name: Vides Hugo

texts.es:
Vides es un hombre de 38 años, vive en la ciudad de Ica con su esposa y sus dos hijos, a quienes ama y son su principal razón en la vida, el es una persona muy amable, trabajador y entusiasta, que junto con su esposa dedican todos sus esfuerzos por sacar adelante a su familia; lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos y por la necesidad que tuvo de trabajar desde muy joven, Vides no pudo estudiar una carrera profesional, en sus ratos libres el gusta relajarse escuchando música y en algunas ocasiones cocina un riquísima Carapulcra con Sopa Seca para compartir con su familia.
Por iniciativa propia, con mucho empeño y dedicación, Vides trabaja como ayudante en un negocio de monturas de caballo, el se dedica a la confección y tejido de monturas y puede hacerlo por un aproximado de 11 horas, Vides cree que le va bien por su buen desempeño y por el trato amable que brinda a los demás.
Vides se encuentra muy agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar el mejoramiento de su vivienda, ya que desea hacer el tarrajeo, pintado y puesta de piso de gran parte de su hogar, de esta manera el y su familia podrán contar con mayor seguridad y bienestar, así pues Vides seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de tener su propio negocio.
texts.en:
Vides is a 38-year-old man who lives in the city of Ica with his wife and two children, whom he loves very much. Vides' family is his biggest motivation in life. He is a very kind, hardworking, and enthusiastic man who, along with his wife, dedicates himself completely to helping his family get ahead. Unfortunately, due to scarce financial resources, Vides had to begin working at a young age and he was not able to study a professional field. 

In his free time, Vides likes to relax and listen to music. On special occasions, he likes to make the delicious Carapulcra con Sopa Seca (a typical Peruvian dish) to share with his family. 

By his own initiative and with much determination and dedication, Vides works as an assistant for a company that produces horse saddles. Vides works making and weaving saddles. Sometimes he works 11-hour days. Vides believes that his success thus far is due to his work ethic and the kind way he treats others. 

He is very grateful to Kiva lenders for the support this loan offers him as he improves his house. Vides hopes to do some painting and lay flooring on a large portion of his home and other repairs. This will provide a safer place for his family and improve their well-being. 

Vides will continue working hard to achieve his dream of opening his own business.

loans.use: to improve his home.

loans.name: Susanna

texts.en:
Susanna lives with her 13-year-old daughter in Tsovagyugh village, which is in the Sevan area. More than six years ago, Susanna was divorced. She   raises her daughter without her ex-husband’s support. Susanna has a higher education in the field of economy and audit. Since 1989, Susana has worked as an accountant in Sevan city
.
As her salary is not so high, Susanna decided to run her own farm. With her daughter, Susanna engaged in farming and animal breeding. She has a plot of land near her house and raises fruits and vegetables that she sells in food markets in Sevan city. Near her house, Susanna has a big animal barn and keeps five cows and bulls, pigs and chickens. Throughout the year, she sells dairy products, beef and pork. The main income from farming she receives from her animal breeding.

Susanna says that she is very happy that she is able to solve her little family's needs and care for her school-aged daughter herself. 

Susanna asks from Kiva lenders a loan of 800.000 Armenian drams to buy two young bulls, fodder for her animals and seed for land cultivation.

loans.use: To buy two young bulls, fodder for her animals and seed for land cultivation

loans.name: Gantumur

texts.en:
Mrs. Gantumur, 45 years old, lives with her son in Kherlen, a town of eastern Mongolia. The family resides in their old house, on a plot of land. She has been working as an equipment operator at a building company since 2006. Until 2012 her employment was part time, and in 2013 she became employed as a full time staff member, increasing her salary and covering food and other, work-associated, costs.

The house that Gantumur and her son live in has deteriorated over the years, and it needs some serious repairs. So she is requesting a loan of 3,000,000 MNT, which she will use to purchase building and insulation materials, such as planks, bricks, concrete, fiberglass and foam. Using these materials, she herself can repair and insulate her house, thus creating a comfortable and warm place. The renovated house will enable the family to burn less coal, emit less smoke, and thereby contribute to the efforts against air pollution. The borrower is a hardworking individual, who wants to see her son live well and happily.

loans.use: to purchase building and insulation materials for repairing the old house

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more local foodstuff for resale

loans.name: Maria Santos

texts.es:
Doña María es una mujer de 33 años de edad luchadora, emprendedora y con muchos deseos de superarse y de salir adelante a pesar de las dificultades que existen en nuestro país. Ella es casada y de su matrimonio tiene 5 hijos los cuales la mayor esta por graduarse en este año de técnico en computación, la que le sigue solo curso hasta el 3 grado, los otros dos que le siguen están en la primaria cursando diferentes grados de educación y el ultimo esta pequeño. Ella tiene un grado de educación primaria no completado el cual curso hasta el 3 grado de educación y no pudo seguir estudiando debido a que sus padres eran de escasos recursos económicos y no pudieron apoyarla. Fueron ellos los que le enseñaron la actividad del cultivo de café y hoy en día lo practica con su esposo y agradecen a DIOS por el terreno que hoy cultivan ya que es propio gracias a una herencia que dieron los papas de su esposo el cual está ubicado a 50 metros de su casa de habitación. Por lo tanto esto les permite y les da la facilidad para dar el mantenimiento necesario a su cultivo de café.

Hoy en día Ana solicita ayuda para la compra de abono y fertilizantes para su cultivo de café por medio del cual podrá obtener una cosecha sana y la podrá aprovechar al 100%.

Sus sueños son de poder ver sus cultivos como los mejores de la zona ya que por medio de esto ella podrá recibir mejores ingresos por la venta y la calidad de su producto para facilitarle a sus hijos la educación, el pan de cada día y otras necesidades que a diario de presentan.
texts.en:
33-year old Sra. María is hardworking and entrepreneurial. She is very keen to get on in life despite the difficulties that exist in the country. She is married and has five children; her eldest daughter will graduate this year as a computer technician, her second oldest only stayed in school to grade 3, the next two are in primary school, and the youngest is too small to go to school. María herself did not complete primary education; she only attended up to grade 3. She couldn’t continue her studies as her parents were poor and couldn’t support her.

It was her parents who taught her how to grow coffee, and today she and her husband earn their living this way. They are grateful to God for the land that they cultivate since it is their own, thanks to her husband’s parents who gave it to them. The land is located 50 metres from their house so it is easy for them to look after it.

Today María is seeking a loan to buy manure and fertilizer for the coffee plants so that she will be able to have a successful and healthy crop of coffee beans. 

María’s dream is to see her crop as the best in the area so that she can receive more income from it. Selling quality beans will help her pay for her children’s education, daily food, and the other necessities of life.

loans.use: buy manure and fertilizer for her coffee plants

loans.name: Thuy

texts.en:
Thuy was born in 1979. She has two children who are learning at secondary school. Her husband is a driver. His income is about 5,000,000 dong (VND) per month. Thuy is a laborer. She makes 5,000,000 VND a month from her work. Her family’s total earnings are about 10,000,000 VND per month.
 
Thuy has participated in SEDA's credit program since 2004. In the last cycle, she borrowed 9,810,000 VND, and she repaid the loan on time. In this loan cycle, she would like to borrow 9,810,000 VND again. She will use the loan to plant peach's flower trees. Her dream is to save money for building a new house.

loans.use: to plant peach’s flower trees.

loans.name: Maria Celia

texts.es: Doña Maria de 45 años de edad vive con su hijo en casa propia tiene una pequeña tienda donde vende articulos de perimera necesidad como: huevos, frijoles, fideos, etc. tambien shampoos, rinso, jabones etc. con las ventas que realiza logra sacar adelante a su hijo y cubrir algunos gastos de su hogar. Doña Maria quiere acrecentar su negocio pero no tiene suficiente capital para poder realizarlo por eso solicita un credito que le permita poder comprar todo lo necesaria para surtir su tienda como granos basicos, aceite, shampoos, jabones, detergentes entre otras cosas para obtener mejores ganancias y tener una mejor estabilidad economica.
texts.en:
Doña Maria is 45 years old and lives in her own house, in which she has small store. She sells basic items such as eggs, beans, noodles, as well as shampoos, soap, etc. With her profits from the store, Maria helps her son get ahead and pays her household expenses. 

Maria wishes to expand her business but she does not have enough capital to do so. That is why she is requesting this loan. It will allow her to buy all the items she needs to stock her store such as basic grocery items, oil, shampoos, soaps, detergents and other items. This will help her increase her earnings and stabilize her financial situation.

loans.use: to buy basic grocery items, shampoos, lotions, creams, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to free up funds and secure future projects

loans.name: Marta Esperanza

texts.es:
Doña Marta es una mujer de 42 años de edad madre soltera de 3 hijos de los cuales 2 de ellos son hijos de crianza, luchadora, emprendedora y con muchos deseos de superarse y de salir adelante.  A pesar de las dificultades que existen en nuestro país. Ella se ha dedicado al cultivo de café desde muy pequeña ya que fueron sus padres los que le enseñaron dicha actividad como lo es: Limpieza, poda, Corte, Etc. Ella tiene un grado de educación primaria no completado cursado hasta el 2 grado de educación y no pudo continuar ya que sus padres eran de escasos recursos económicos y no pudieron apoyarle. Sus cultivos están ubicados a una distancia de 500 metros de distancia de su casa de habitación al cual se traslada a pie diariamente. La única ayuda que ella recibe es de parte de sus familia para que su cultivo este sano y protegido de plagas. Ella también tiene un pequeño vivero de café el cual está empezando a preparar para su venta posterior mente.

Hoy en día ella solicita ayuda para la compra de abono y fertilizantes para su cultivo de café por medio del cual podrá obtener una mejor cosecha de manera sana, limpia la cual podrá aprovechar al 100%.

Sus sueños son poder ver sus cultivos como los mejores de la zona ya que por medio de esto ella podrá recibir mejores ingresos por la venta y la calidad de su producto para facilitarle a sus hijos la educación, el pan de cada día y otras necesidades que a diario de presentan.
texts.en:
42-year old Sra. Marta is the single mother of three children, two of whom are foster children. She is hardworking and entrepreneurial with a great desire to get ahead in life in spite of the difficulties that exist in the country. She has grown coffee since she was a young girl; her parents taught her how to weed the fields, prune, cut etc. Marta did not complete primary school as she only attended up to grade 2. Her parents were poor and couldn’t support her. Her fields are located 500 metres from her house and she walks there daily.

The only help that Marta receives is from her family; they help her keep the crops healthy and safe from disease. She also has a small nursery where she grows coffee plants that will soon be for sale.

Today Marta is seeking a loan to buy manure and fertilizer so that she will be able to have a successful and healthy crop of coffee beans. 

Her dream is to see her crop as the best in the area so that she can receive more income from it. Selling quality beans will help her pay for her children’s education, daily food, and the other necessities of life.

loans.use: buy manure and fertilizer for her coffee plants

loans.name: Khachik

texts.en:
Khachik is 50 years old and lives with his wife in Tsovagyugh village, which is in the Sevan area. Khachik’s only son is in his military service. Khachik graduated from Armenian Agrarian University in the agronomy department. Since 1999, Khachik has worked in his village municipality as a staff secretary. In parallel, Khachik engaged in agricultural work in his village. Khachik has cows, sheep and bulls. His wife helps him to sell meat and dairy products from their animal breeding in Sevan markets. They have a plot of land near their house and grow vegetables like tomatoes, potatoes and peppers.

As Khachik said that the main income he receives is from his farming and animal breeding, he decided to enlarge his breeding stock. He needs a loan of 550.000 Armenian drams to buy a purebred cow and fodder for his animals. This deal will help him to add milking cows and receive a good profit.

loans.use: To buy a purebred cow and fodder for his animals

loans.name: Nhuan

texts.en:
Nhuan was born in 1974. She has two sons who are studying at high school and secondary school. Her husband has been sick for years.

Nhuan is a barber. Her income is about 4,000,000 VND. She has done this job for three years. Her family’s total earnings are about 4,000,000 VND per month. 
She has participated in SEDA's credit program since 2003. In the last cycle, she borrowed 7,630,000 VND and repaid the loan on time. In this loan cycle, she would like to borrow 8,938,000 VND to buy barber tools and equipment to do her job. She always wants to have more money to expand her barber shop.

loans.use: to buy barber tools and equipment to do her job.

loans.name: Huyen

texts.en:
Huyen was born in 1984. She has two children, who are still little. Her husband is a laborer. His income is about 4,000,000 Vietnamese Dong (VND) per month. Huyen has a barber shop. She earns 5,000,000 VND a month. Her family’s total earnings are about 9,000,000 VND per month.

Huyen has participated in SEDA's credit program since 2010. In the last loan cycle, she borrowed 8,066,000 VND and repaid the loan on time. In this loan cycle, she would like to borrow 9,374,000 VND. She will use it to buy more barber tools, tables and chairs, for her barber shop.

loans.use: to buy more barber tools, tables and chairs, for her barber shop.

loans.name: Warlito

texts.en: Warlito is married to Laura, and they have been blessed with seven children.  He has been working as a farmer for 20 years. To further his farming business, he would like to borrow some additional capital, in the amount of PHP 35,000. He will use the loan to buy fertilizer and seedlings for his corn production. He is determined to work hard to provide for his family, and hopes that Kiva lenders, through ASKI, will grant his request.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seedlings

loans.name: Willy

texts.es:
Willy  tiene tres hijos, un varón que está en etapa de lactancia y dos hijos que están en etapa escolar; vive en la casa propia donde cuenta con un ambiente y se encuentra el dormitorio y la cocina, baño, la  habitación es de adobe y el piso de tierra, la casa se encuentra ubicada en la zona de Coripata Sector de Choro grande Yungas de la ciudad de La Paz.
Actualmente trabaja en el  cultivo de hortalizas, flor y fruto,  la esposa también trabaja en el cultivo  y limpiando las chacras; sus productos los comercializa por la misma zona donde vive  y en la ciudad de La Paz.  El lugar de trabajo es un lugar lleno de tierra y polvo, ellos trabajan todos los días de la semana, ambos  colaboran en el pago de los servicios, comida y vestimenta, y educación de sus hijos.
El crédito lo requiere para Invertir en semilla mejorada y tener mejor producción, más limpia y atractiva para su venta. 
El sueño de Willy es poder refaccionar la casa en donde vive con toda su familia y contar con movilidad propia y así poder mejorar sus ingresos y su calidad de vida.
Es la primera vez que solicita crédito junto a IMPRO Y KIVA.
texts.en:
Willy has three children: a baby boy who is still breastfeeding and two children who are school-aged. He lives in his own house, which is cozy and has a bedroom, kitchen and bathroom. The room is made of adobe and the floor of earth. His house is located in the Coripata Municipality of Choro Grande, in the Nor Yungas Province in the La Paz Department.

Willy currently works growing vegetables, flowers and fruit. His wife also works on the cultivation and cleans the fields for new planting. They sell their products in the same area where they live and also in the city of La Paz. Their plot of land is full of soil and dust. Willy and his wife work together every day of the week to pay for household expenses, food, clothing and the education of their children.

They are requesting a loan to buy hybrid seed to improve their products and make them cleaner and more attractive for sale. Willy’s dream is to be able to refurbish his family’s home and to have his own vehicle so he could improve his family’s income and their quality of life. This is the first time that Willy has requested a loan through IMPRO and Kiva.

loans.use: to buy hybrid seeds of agricultural products in order to improve the quality of his crops and increase his family’s income.

loans.name: Gregory

texts.en:
Pinnacle Power Wash is a conscientious “green” business that specializes in power washing commercial and residential properties without damaging the environment with toxic wastes.

Gregory, owner of Pinnacle, was at a standstill when his eight-year old business was not bringing in the cash flow he once had.  As a single father, he started the business to support himself and his two children. 

Pinnacle Power Wash cleans residential and commercial properties while protecting the environment from toxic wastes.  Pinnacle utilizes specially designed surface cleaning equipment, which fully contains and recaptures contaminants while simultaneously filtering and recycling wash water.  The surface is left clean and dry, and contaminants are removed as opposed to re-distributed.  To accomplish this process, the water temperature is raised to 200 degrees, which helps loosen grease, dirt, gum and many other stains.  

A friend recommended Gregory to Accion Texas Inc. in Austin and he was able to obtain a loan to purchase the hot water high-pressure cleaner that improved his business.  His business continues to grow and protect the environment.  You can visit Gregory’s website at www.ppwtx.com

loans.use: to purchase a hot water high-pressure cleaner

loans.name: Nhuong

texts.en:
Nhuong was born in 1962. She has two grown children, who are laborers. Her husband has a landscape tree shop and earns about 5,000,000 Vietnamese Dong (VND) per month. Nhuong is a farmer. Her income is about 3,000,000 VND. She has done this work for 25 years. Her family’s total earnings are about 8,000,000 VND per month.

She has participated in SEDA's credit program since 2003. In the last loan cycle, she borrowed 8,502,000 VND and repaid the loan on time. In this loan cycle, she would like to borrow 9,810,000 VND. She will use the loan to buy more seeds with which to plant peach’s flower trees.

loans.use: to buy more seeds to plant peach’s flower trees.

loans.name: Wilma

texts.es: La Sra. Wilma sigue con la actividad de la venta de cosméticos y joyas, cuenta que le fue bien con el anterior crédito ya que lo utilizo en la compra de cosméticos por mayor que se encuentra en promoción, cuenta que le fue bien  creció en su actividad e incremento su clientela, y por ende sus ingresos económicos, en esta ocasión solicito el crédito para la compra de cosméticos por mayor para seguir incrementando su capital de trabajo, se siente feliz y agradecida por esta nueva oportunidad que le brindan.
texts.en:
Wilma continues in her business of selling cosmetics and jewelry. She says that the previous loan has worked out well since she used it to buy cosmetics in bulk at a discount. She says that her business has grown and her clientele has increased, and as a result, her economic income has increased as well. 

At this time, she is requesting a loan to purchase cosmetics in bulk to continue increasing her working capital. She feels happy and grateful for this new opportunity that she is being given.

loans.use: to purchase cosmetics in bulk.

loans.name: Cheryla

texts.en: Cheryla is a 27-year-old married woman from Talibon, Bohol. She has five children. The oldest child is 10 years old and the youngest is 1 years old. She is engaged in fishing. She sells fish, seashells, crabs and shrimp. She has been into fishing for six years. His husband is a fisherman. She is the one selling her husband's catch to earn a living. To be able to survive her fishing activity, Cheryla requested a loan of 6,000 PHP to buy fishing net, epoxy (an adhesive), and paint to increase the volume of catch and increase her sales.  In the future, Cheryla would like to invest in another business to be able to uplift their livelihood status and, at the same time, send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy fishing net, epoxy (an adhesive),and paint

loans.name: Elna

texts.en:
Elna is a 46-year-old married woman from the town of San Miguel, Bohol. She is engaged in buying and selling bananas to the market. Her husband works as a farmer.

Elna is asking for a loan to buy more bananas to sell. Through this, she will be able to improve her business as well as her income. In the future, Elna hopes to expand her business and make it a success. Furthermore, she wants to save money for the schooling of her son.

loans.use: to buy more bananas to sell

loans.name: Racheal

texts.en:
Racheal lives in the Mariakani area of Coast Province, Kenya. She is married and has one child. Racheal owns a pharmacy which she has been operating for three years.

Racheal learnt about Milango from friends who invited her to the group. She joined with the aim of accessing credit to improve her business operations. Her main challenges are price fluctuations and inflation.

Racheal is applying for a loan of 31,450 Kenyan shillings to buy drugs, syringes, etc. Her dream is to see her business grow and be a major supplier of drugs in the area.

loans.use: To buy drugs, syringes, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy additional pigs and feed for them

loans.name: Elsa

texts.en:
Elsa is 44 years old, married, and has six children. She lives in Calamba, Misamis Occidental. She owns and operates a transportation service to earn a living. She has been in her business for over five years and earns 5,000 PHP every month.

She joined GDMPC to gain access to financing for her transportation service. And now she has requested a loan of 10,000 PHP. She will use it to purchase spare parts and tires. Her hope and dream is to have a better future.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts and tires

loans.name: Dorothy

texts.en:
Dorothy is a 35-year-old, married woman. She has six children, whose ages range from 2 to 14 years. She describes herself as a risk taker and a patient person. She operates a farm, where she grows maize to sell and also keeps dairy cattle. She has been involved in this business for 10 years. Her business is located in an area with many customers, and her customers are primarily local and commercial.

She says that her biggest business challenge is a shortage of stock. She will use the KES 30,000 loan to add to her stock of maize. Her business goal is to be a commercial trader, within five years. This is her second loan with SMEP DTM. She repaid her previous loan successfully.

loans.use: to add to her stock of maize available for sale

loans.name: Helen

texts.en: Helen is from the village of Zamora in Alicia, Isabela.  She is 51 years old and is married with three children. To earn a living, Helen engaged herself in the farming business.  Aside from this, she is engaged in selling fish in their village. The fish comes from their fishpond, which is being managed by her husband.  To increase her sales and profit, she is now borrowing a loan of PHP 23,000 to buy more fish and feed.  She hopes that she can have the opportunity to be part of the program to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy more fish and feed for them

loans.name: May Jane

texts.en:
May Jane works hard to support her family. May Jane is married and has a fishing business in the Philippines.

May Jane requested a PHP 15000 loan through NWTF to buy fishing net and other fishing needs for her business.

May Jane has been in this business for two years now.

In the future, May Jane would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fishing net and other fishing needs for her business

loans.name: Antonia

texts.es:
La clienta Antonia vive en Guayaquil. Empezó su tienda hace 15 años, en su vivienda que era de caña con un capital pequeño. Poco a poco fue mejorando su negocio y su vivienda. Ella realiza su trabajo en su tienda todos los días en ocasiones con ayuda de sus hijos.

La dificultad que ella tiene en su negocio es la delincuencia que hay en ese sector. Es soltera, tiene dos hijos mayores de edad.

Con el préstamo quiere comprar arroz aceite y azúcar para mejorar los víveres de su tienda y ofrecer mas productos a sus clientes. Su sueño es seguir creciendo en su negocio.
texts.en:
Antonia lives in Guayaquil.  She started her store with a little capital 15 years ago in her thatch house.  Little by little she was improving her business and her house.  She works in her store every day.  Sometimes her children help her.   

The difficulty that she has in her business is the crime in her area.  She is single, and she has two grown children.

She wants to use the loan to buy rice, cooking oil, and sugar in order to improve her store’s supplies and to offer more products to her customers.

Her dream is to continue growing in her business.

loans.use: to buy rice, cooking oil, and sugar.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to stock her business.

loans.name: Anecita

texts.en:
Anecita is a 52-year-old married woman and a mother of five children from Trinidad, Bohol. She has been engaged in the clothing and fashion accessory sales business for more than five years now.
 
Anecita is asking for a loan to buy more clothes and fashion accessories. Through thisloan, she will be able to sell more and augment her profit and sales. In the future, Anecita hopes to make her business a success.

loans.use: to buy more clothes and fashion accessories

loans.name: Rio

texts.en: Rio is a responsible father, who aims to become successful in life in order to support his family and give his children a better life. He is 38 years old and has three, school-aged children. A lack of capital made him seek a loan from Kiva lenders, through ASKI, to be used in his hog-raising business.  He would like to borrow additional capital of PHP 14,000. He will use the loan to buy feed, vitamins, piglets, and materials needed to improve their pig pen. He is hoping that he will be able to make his business viable and profitable, through this financial assistance.

loans.use: to buy feed, vitamins, piglets to raise, and materials needed to improve the pig pen

loans.name: Tufajon

texts.ru: Туфачон очень веселая и жизнерадостная женщина. Она всю жизнь проработала на ферме по производству породистого скота. За этот период работы она  приобрела большой опыт по откорму коров и быка. И в течении 20 лет она с мужем занимаются откормом скота, так как знают все тонкости выращивания и уходом за скотом. Ее муж работает в одной из фирме охранником, но получаемая заработная плата хватает только на жизнь. Поэтому Туфачон каждую утро доит корову и отвозит молоко в город на продажу. В настоящий момент продаваемое молочные продукт не достаточны для других целей Туфачон, поэтому она хочет получить кредит для покупки еще коровы и бычка, что продавать молоко и иметь дополнительный доход. А бычка через 3 месяца планирует продать и на полученные средства провести ремонт дома, так как ее дом немного нуждается в ремонте. Она очень надеется на поддержку от Арванд, и осуществить свою мечту.
texts.en: Tufajon is a very happy and energetic woman.  All her life she has worked on a farm with cattle.  Because of this, she has gained much experience fattening cows and bulls.  For 20 years, she and her husband have worked fattening cattle because they know the ins and outs of caring for livestock.  Her husband works as a security guard at a local farm but his salary isn't enough to live on.  So each morning, Tufajon milks her cow and takes the milk to the city to sell.  At the moment, this additional income is not enough for Tufajon's goals so she wants to take out of a loan  to buy a more cattle to increase her income.  She plans to use the money from selling the cattle to make repairs to her home since it needs it.  She relies on Arvand's support to realize her dream.

loans.use: to buy a cow

loans.name: Edison

texts.en: Edison is grateful for the previous loan he received through Milango. It helped him complete the construction of his house. Edison would like to improve the grocery business which he set up some time back. He is therefore asking for a loan of 41,850 Kenyan shillings to buy retail food stock of fruits and vegetables for sale. He looks forward to increased income which can help him construct other rental houses.

loans.use: To buy retail food stock of fruits and vegetables for sale.

loans.name: At's Group

texts.en:
At was born in 1962. She has a son who is a plastics worker. She is widow. At is a farmer. Her income is about 2,000,000 VND. She has done this job for 20 years. Her family’s total earnings are about 3,000,000 VND per month. 

She has participated in SEDA's credit program since 2003. In the last cycle, she borrowed 7,194,000 VND and repaid the loan on time. In this loan cycle, she would like to borrow 7,194,000 VND to buy peach seeds to plant flower trees. She always wants to save money to build her house.

The other member who is part of At's group is Huyen, 29 years old. She wants to borrow 6,322,000 VND to plant peach trees.

loans.use: to buy peach seeds to plant flower trees.

loans.name: Emerito

texts.en:
Emerito is a 43-year-old, married man, from Bien Unido, Bohol. He has three children. The eldest is 22, while the youngest is 15 years old. Emerito engages in a food vending business. He sells snack foods to the nearby community. He has been selling snack foods for almost 10 years, now.

He requested a loan of 21,000 PHP, which he will use to buy ingredients, like skim milk powder, white sugar and flour. Making and selling snack foods from these ingredients is the family's source of income. In the future, Emerito would like to expand his business, to improve their standard of living. He also wants to continue his children's education.

loans.use: to buy skim milk powder, white sugar and flour

loans.name: Eusebio

texts.es:
Eusebio  se dedica a la cría de ganado vacuno para la producción de leche la cual vende a una de las Plantas Industrializadoras de Leche. El vive con su esposa y sus hijos, en su casa propia ubicada en la comunidad de Suñasivi, del Sector Warisata de La provincia Omasuyos del Departamento de La Paz a tres horas  de distancia  de la ciudad de La Paz cuenta con  algunas cabezas de ganado de raza mejorada las cuales requieren mejor cuidado dada las condiciones climatológicas del sector.

El crédito lo requiere para comprar material de construcción: cemento, ladrillos, etc. Así podrá  refaccionar el establo para ganado, por lo tanto mejorar su producción, conservando la buena salud de sus vacas.

El sueño de Eusebio, es incrementar sus cabezas de ganado, precautelando la buena salud de ellos.

Es la tercera vez que solicita crédito junto a IMPRO y la primera    vez con KIVA.
texts.en:
Eusebio raises cattle to produce milk which he sells to milk plants.  He lives with his wife in a home of his own, located in the Warisata sector of the Omasuyos province within the La Paz department, three hours from the city of La Paz.  He has some heads of cattle of better stock which require more care given the climatic conditions in the sector. 

He needs this loan to buy building materials such as cement, bricks, etc.  In this way he can upgrade his stable and therefore have better production and keep up the health of his cows.

Eusebio's dream is to increase his number of cows, keeping their good health in mind.

This will be his third loan through IMPRO and his first through Kiva.

loans.use: to fix up his stable.

loans.name: Ma. Anabelle

texts.en:
Ma. Anabelle is a 37-year-old, married woman. She has three children and lives in Trinidad, Bohol. She has been operating a sari-sari (or variety store) business, for more than three years. This is the source of her income. Her husband is a farmer.

Ma. Anabelle is asking for a loan to buy more stock to resell at her store, like canned goods, seasonings, noodles, rice, cooking ingredients, soda and other beverages, soap and toiletries. Through this loan, Ma. Anabelle will be able to improve her business and augment her sales and income. In the future, Ma. Anabelle hopes to expand her business and to save money for the schooling of her children.

loans.use: to buy more stock to resell at her store, like canned goods, seasonings, noodles, soap and toiletries.

loans.name: Duncan

texts.en:
Duncan lives in the Mariakani area of Coast Province, Kenya. He is married and has one school-going child. He owns a retail shop, a business which has been running for ten years, and employs one other person. In this business, he sells retail stock; e.g., rice, sugar, flour, cooking oil, etc. Duncan also runs transport, video show and phone charging businesses.

Duncan learnt about Milango from friends who invited him to the group. He joined with the aim of accessing credit to improve his business operations. His main challenges are the high cost of products. 

Duncan is applying for a loan of 83,500 Kenyan shillings to buy retail stock like sugar, flour, etc. The extra income from the loan will be added to his savings to improve the living standards of his family.

loans.use: To buy retail stock like sugar, flour, etc.

loans.name: Miriam

texts.en:
Miriam was born in 1980, at Kashenyi Village. Her parents were peasants. She studied up to secondary school level and then joined an institution, for a nursing course. She is married and has two children, who attend school. She started her business in 2007, with her meager savings. She has since decided to join UGAFODE Microfinance Limited (MDI) for financial assistance, to enable her to expand her business and get more customers.

Miriam took this loan in order to buy more drugs, to serve the available market. She thanks UGAFODE Microfinance Limited (MDI) for the financial assistance extended to her, which has enabled her to expand her business and increase her income. She encourages UGAFODE to continue supporting low-income earners, so they can improve their standards of living.

loans.use: to buy drugs to stock her pharmacy

loans.name: Nicolas Agapito

texts.es:
El cliente Nicolas vive en Guayaquil. Empezó  porque necesitaba el dinero para sustentar los gastos de su familia. Comenzó alquilando una tricimoto para poder trasportar a las personas y ganar $ 0.25 por carrera. Poco a poco mejoro sus ingresos y con el tiempo se compro una tricimoto, en la actualidad trabaja solo todo el día.

La dificultad que tiene en su labor es la delincuencia que hay en los sectores por donde él hace los recorridos. Esta actualmente con su pareja en unión libre ella es ama de casa, tiene 2 hijos los cuales están en escuela fiscal.

Con el préstamo quiere comprar llantas y metal para arreglar los aros. Su sueño es comprar otra tricimoto y tenerla en una cooperativa.
texts.en:
Nicolas lives in Guayaquil.  He started because he needed the money to pay for the family’s expenses.  He started by renting a ‘tricimoto’ [motorbike with a cart in back for passengers] in order to be able to transport people and to earn $0.25 for ride.  He improved his income little by little.  In time he bought a tricimoto, and he currently works by himself all day.

The difficulty that he has in his work is the crime that is in the areas where he works.

He is currently in a common-law marriage, and his wife is a housewife.  He has two children, and they attend public school.

He wants to use the loan to buy tires and metal to fix the rims.  His dream is to buy another tricimoto and to have it in a cooperative.

loans.use: to buy tires and metal to fix the rims on his motorcycle.

loans.name: Victor

texts.es: Víctor, un hombre emprendedor , tiene 58  años de edad, es casado y vive con su esposa actualmente, el solicito un préstamo con el anhelo de  comprar mercadería para surtir el negocio un poco mejor, la única delimitación que este caballero tiene es la falta de dinero  para continuar creciendo, ya que de esta actividad económica dependen para poder salir adelante, por lo que él hace una solicitud  de  crédito , y es el primer  préstamo que ha  recibido de FUDECOSUR. El no registra otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja……
texts.en: Victor is an enterprising man.  He's 58 years old, married, and lives with his wife.  He is asking for a loan so he can buy merchandise to stock his business a bit better.  The only limit that this gentlemen has is a lack of capital with which to continue growing his business.  They depend on this business in order to get ahead, so he is asking for a loan.  This will be his first loan through FUDECOSUR and they provided the loan easily with a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to stock his business.

loans.name: Hen

texts.en:
Hen, 44, lives in a rural village of Battambang province’s Bovel district, in Cambodia. He is married and has eight children, five of whom are still attending school. For the last 13 years, he has been growing corn and cassava, earning about 30,000 KHR per day to meet the family’s needs.

Hen has been a member of Kiva partner VisionFund for three cycles already and he completely repaid the previous loan, which he used wisely and successfully to improve his family’s livelihood. Now requesting another loan with VisionFund of KHR 4,000,000, he wants to use this loan to buy pesticides, fertilizers and seeds for his farmland. He hopes to get more crops from his corn as well as his cassava growing so as to sell it for a good price to better his family’s condition and keep his children in school.

loans.use: To buy pesticides, fertilizers and seeds for his farmland

loans.name: Ndanu

texts.en: Ndanu is a resident of Mombasa, Kenya. She is a single mother of three school-going children and runs a shop selling charcoal that has been in operation for the last four years. She has also invested in a transport business. She was introduced to Milango by her friends and is asking for a loan of 6,200 Kenyan shillings to purchase a solar panel.

loans.use: To purchase a solar panel.

loans.name: Som's Group

texts.en: Som, a 52 year-old local farmer from Pursat Province,  is married and has five children. Four of her children are still in school and a reaming is helping the family’s business, rice cropping. The two hectares of rice she cultivates has returned her about 22,600 KHR per day. This is the first loan for Som with VisionFund, a Kiva partner. She is in a group of two as the leader. She and her co-borrower are seeking 1,000,000 KHR each. Som will spend her loan portion to buy buffalo to support her farmland. She hopes this purchase will relieve her financial burden in hiring others to plow her farmland and help her to make a good income.

loans.use: To buy buffalo to support her farmland

loans.name: George

texts.en: George is a responsible father, who aims to uplift his family's standard of living and provide them a better life. He is 32 years old and has three children. He plans to grow more vegetables and root crops to sell, but he has limited capital. For this reason, he is asking for additional capital of PHP 10,000 from Kiva lenders, through ASKI. He will use the loan to buy fertilizers and pesticides, and to pay the labor cost incurred for land preparation and planting. Through his patience and hard work, he believes that he will be able to expand his farming business and increase his profits.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pesticides, and to pay the labor cost incurred for land preparation and planting

loans.name: Norma

texts.es: Norma de 28 años de edad esta casada con Cesar y tiene un hijo de 7 años respectivamente.Vive en la casa de sus padres quienes la apoyan desde siempre por ser su única hija mujer.Se dedica a la producción de cacao orgánico en un terreno agrícola de 3 hectáreas el cual compró con ayuda de Cesar.El cacao orgánico es un producto de mucha demanda en su zona siendo motivo para que contrate en ocasiones trabajadores del lugar para así agilizar las labores para el mantenimiento de sus plantaciones como es el retiro de maleza, aplicación de abono orgánico y cosecha. Considera que el traslado de los sacos con granos secos de cacao es lo más complicado ya que las vías de acceso a su terreno agricola está constituida por carreteras estrechas incrementándose el costo total de transporte.Tiene como objetivo construir su vivienda para independizarse junto a su joven y pequeña familia.Este es su primer préstamo otorgado por Kiva y agradece la oportunidad que le brindan porque es necesario contar con capital de trabajo para un mejor desempeño laboral.En está oportunidad requiere de 1,000  soles para completar la compra de un terreno donde espera iniciar la construcción de su vivienda a largo plazo.
texts.en:
Norma, 28, is married to Cesar, and they have a seven-year-old son. They live in her parents' house. Her parents have always helped her out because she is their only daughter. 

Norma grows organic cacao on three hectares of land, which she purchased with Cesar's help. There is a lot of demand for organic cacao in the area, and they often hire local workers to help them with chores to maintain the plants such as pulling weeds, spreading organic manure, and harvesting. Moving sacks of dried cacao seed is difficult because the access roads to her field are very narrow, which increases transportation costs.

Her goal is to build a house for her child and family so that they can live independently. This is her first loan with Kiva, and she is thankful for the chance to have the needed working capital to do her work better. She needs 1,000 soles to buy the land where she expects to start building her house over time.

loans.use: to buy land for a house.

loans.name: Ma. Emma

texts.en: Ma. Emma earns a living primarily by owning and operating her sari-sari (or variety store) business. She has done this work for more than three years now, in her place in Trinidad, Bohol. She is a married woman and a mother of four children. Ma. Emma is also engaged in a hog-raising business. She is asking for a loan to buy piglets to raise. In the future, she hopes to make her business a success, and sustainable.

loans.use: to buy piglets

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is 49 years old and married with eight children, four of whom are in school. Jocelyn works very hard to provide for them.

Jocelyn runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy more stocks to sell like noodles, shampoo, canned goods, etc.

Jocelyn has been in this business for six years. 

In the future, Jocelyn would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stocks to sell like noodles, shampoo, canned goods, etc

loans.name: Antonitta

texts.en: Antonitta is a 28-year-old married woman and a mother of two young children from San Miguel, Bohol. She is engaged in retailing dry goods like clothing and fashion wear accessories. Antonitta is asking for a loan to buy more stocks to sell like slippers, shirts, tees, dresses, fashion accessories and other items. Through this loan, she will be able to augment her stock and sell more to her customers, thus augmenting her sales and income.

loans.use: to buy more stocks to sell like slippers, shirts, tees, dresses, fashion accessories and other items

loans.name: Faisal

texts.en: Faisal is a hardworking and kind man. He is a 52 year old who lives in Sana`a, Yemen. He is married with six children. Faisal's family live happily together, but they are poor. He is an employee in the water & environment ministry. He lives in a rented house and his salary is less than what he needs to cover household expenses and pay for rent. He intends to buy furniture and home appliances to use for the house but he doesn`t have enough money to buy what he needs. So, he is asking for a loan of 450,000 YER from AMB to buy furniture and home appliances. This loan will help this good man to make his family happy. He hopes to improve the family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy furniture and home appliances.

loans.name: Msilimu

texts.en:
Msilimu is married and has seven kids, who attend school. He owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. His greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees for the family.

For the past three years, he has operated a meat goat business. In addition, he operates a poultry farming business, which provides him another source of income. He sells to restaurant operators and his neighbours. His major challenge is the high cost of transportation to his place of operation.

He wants to add the KES 20,000 loan amount to his savings and use it to purchase more goats, for later resale. He decided to join Yehu to access loans, to boost his business and improve his living standard.

loans.use: to purchase more goats for later resale.

loans.name: Corazon

texts.en: Corazon is a 44-year-old married woman from Talibon, Bohol. She has seven children. The youngest is 5 and the oldest is 18. She owns and operates a retail store. She sells basic commodities like rice, condiments, beverages, soaps and dry goods. Her husband works as a private driver. With his meager income, he cannot sustain the family's daily expenses. Corazon requested a loan of 10,000 PHP to buy rice, soft drinks and other stocks to supply the needs of her customers and avoid shortages. In the future, Corazon would like to expand her business to support her family and to finance the studies of her children for their bright future.

loans.use: to buy rice, soft drinks and other stocks

loans.name: Leoniza

texts.en:
Leoniza is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a buying and selling rice business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 11,000 through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of rice to sell for her buying and selling rice business.

Leoniza has been in this business for five years. Leoniza earns more income from her general store and from buying and selling charcoal.

Leoniza has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of rice to sell

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is married and has nine kids who attend school. He owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. His greatest monthly expense is food and school fees for the family.

For the past ten years, he has operated a goat meat business. His potential customers are butcher operators. In addition, he also operates a crop farming business which is another source of income. His major challenges are high costs of transportation to his place of operation.

With the 30,000 KES, he wants to purchase nine goats for meat resale. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business and improve his living standards.

loans.use: to purchase nine goats for meat resale.

loans.name: Estrella

texts.en: Estrella is a 48-year-old married woman and mother of ten children from San Miguel, Bohol in the Philippines. She sells vegetables and cooking seasonings to the people in her community. Estrella is asking for a loan to buy more vegetables and seasonings, like ginger, garlic, pepper and others. Through this loan, she will be able to improve her business and augment her income. In the future, Estrella hopes to expand her business and make it a success.

loans.use: to buy more vegetable and seasonings like ginger, garlic, and pepper.

loans.name: Heng

texts.en:
Heng, 61, is a widowed mother of six children. She lives in a rural village of the Bovel district, Cambodia. Out of her six children, she has one child who is still dependent on her and still in school. To support her family, Heng has been growing cassava and corn for 13 years. The current business earns her about 46,000 KHR per day. 

Heng is requesting her first loan from Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. She is requesting a loan of 1,500,000 KHR. She will use part of the loan to buy cassava and corn seeds for her cultivated land, and will use another part of it to pay for laborers. Heng hopes to increase her crop yields and sell them for a good price, to make a better living.

loans.use: to buy cassava and corn seeds for her cultivated land, and to pay for laborers

loans.name: Min

texts.en: Min was granted a loan last May 2012. She used it to purchase building materials for housing construction. She paid off the loan completely with the income she has earned from her agricultural business. After this loan, Min is pursuing her next Kiva loan to use for the wedding of her daughter. Traditional weddings in Cambodia have a lot of special ceremonies and other events, which will incur more expenses for the couple’s family. The actual wedding ceremony of Cambodians take place continuously for three days and three nights. Since there are a lot of factors to be considered at present like time, money, etc. Cambodian weddings are completed in one single day instead of three. Still, some parts of the country arrange the party for three days. The expenses will be a concern for Min’s family, which is why she is taking a loan of KHR 2,000,000 to cover the costs of the wedding. She hopes that Kiva lenders will continue to lend her a helping hand. She is very grateful and confident she will pay back the loan in full again.

loans.use: to cover the costs of the wedding.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en: Jocelyn is a married woman and a mother of four grown children from Bohol, a province in the Philippines. She operates a sari-sari or variety store for a living. She sells various goods like sardines and other canned goods, soap, shampoo and other things. This is the source of her income. Her husband works as a fisherman. Jocelyn is asking for a loan to buy more stock to sell like rice, soda and beverages, soap and toiletries, seasonings, and cooking ingredients. Jocelyn is hopeful that this loan will help her improve her business and way of living.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell

loans.name: Yobana

texts.es:
Yobana tiene 29 años de edad, es soltera y tiene una casa construida a base de madera donde vive junto a su hija de 12 años.Desde hace 5 años atiende en su tienda de comestibles siendo su principal fuente de ingreso.
Anteriormente se dedicaba a la venta de comida en una feria local logrando gracias a ello reunir dinero para dejar de lado la preparación de comidas e iniciar su actual negocio con el objetivo de estar siempre en casa con su pequeña hija.Con ayuda de sus familiares habilitó un ambiente en su hogar con vista a la calle y adquirió poca mercadería a manera de prueba pero sus ganas de salir adelante permitieron que su negocio prospere de a pocos.Hace un tiempo se vio obligada a cerrar su negocio por motivos de salud pero actualmente se encuentra abierto al público consumidor.Se caracteriza por ser una persona muy alegre y esto le permite tener clientes constantes a quienes vende víveres de primera necesidad así como diversos productos con mayor consumo donde figuran los cereales, enlatados y bebidas heladas que tiene buena demanda por ser una zona tropical.Este es su segundo préstamo y esta contenta por el apoyo financiero recibido.Requiere de 1,000 soles para comprar porductos comestibles tales como sacos de arroz, sacos de azúcar, fideos, verduras , entre otros.
texts.en:
Yobana is 29 and single. She live in her wooden house with her 12-year-old daughter. Five years ago, she opened a small grocery store, and this is her main income source. Previously, she sold food at a local fair. She was able to save enough money from this to stop making food and to open her current business so that she could be at home with her young daughter.

Her relatives helped her set up a space in her house facing the street and buy some merchandise to test the business. With her desire to get ahead, the business slowly prospered.  A while back, she had to close the business due to health issues, but now it is open to the public. Yobana is a very happy person, which attracts regular customers, to whom she sells basic items and a range of other products: grains, canned goods, and frozen beverages in demand in this tropical climate.

This is her second loan cycle, and she is happy for the funding she has received. She needs 1,000 soles to buy food products such as rice, sacks of sugar, noodles, and vegetables.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, milk, and other merchandise.

loans.name: Elvira

texts.en: Elvira runs a sari-sari or a small convenience store in her place in Trinidad, Bohol. She is a married woman and has two children. Elvira needs a loan for her store. Elvira is asking for a loan to buy more stocks to sell in her store like canned goods, candies, sugar, noodles, soda and beverages. With this loan, she will be able to improve her business and make it a success.

loans.use: to buy more stocks to sell in her store like canned goods, candies, sugar, noodles, soda and beverages

loans.name: John

texts.en: John is applying for his second business loan, after having repaid his first loan successfully. He is still running his business as a shoe seller. His monthly income is now KES 22,000. He has applied for another loan, which he plans to use to purchase more shoes to stock his business and supply to his customers.

loans.use: to purchase more shoes to resell to customers

loans.name: Ha

texts.en:
Ha was born in 1978. She has a son and a daughter who are learning at secondary school and primary school. Her husband and she have an electronic store to earn a living. He earns about 5,000,000 VND per month. Ha’s income is about 5,000,000 VND. She has done this job for 3 years. Her family’s total earnings are about 10,000,000 VND per month. 

She has participated in SEDA's credit program since 2005. In the last cycle, she borrowed 8,938,000 VND and repaid the loan on time. In this loan cycle, she would like to borrow 10,246,000 VND to sell more electronic equipment. She always wants to raise her children up well and has more money to business.

loans.use: to buy more electronics equipment to sell.

loans.name: Wilma

texts.en:
Wilma is married to a farmer and has two children who are attending school.  With her determination to help her husband in sustaining their children's needs in school, Wilma engaged herself in a retailing business where she sells a variety of commodities in the market.  

Wilma also cooks and sells some food for additional income.  She is working hard to earn enough profit for their family and for their children.  She wishes to borrow an additional PHP 25,000 to buy diapers, powdered milk, soft drinks and other basic commodities to sell. She hopes to expand the business through her profits and determination.

loans.use: to buy diapers, powdered milk and soft drinks to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy maintenance supplies.

loans.name: Srey

texts.en:
Srey is 39 years old and married. She has four children, all of whom are dependent on her and still in school. They live in a wooden house in the Kam Rieng district of Battambang province. The main source of her family’s income is cassava growing. She has been in this business for almost eight years. With the current business, she can earn about 35,000 KHR per day.

This is the first loan for Srey with VisionFund. Now she is asking for a loan of 2,500,000 KHR, which she will use to buy fertilizer and pesticides for her farmland. She hopes to increase her crop yield and sell the crop for a good price, so as to better her living conditions.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and pesticides for her farmland

loans.name: Nhat

texts.en:
Nhat was born in 1968. She has a son who is a worker. Her husband and she have divorced. She is a tailor. Her income is about 4,000,000 VND. She has done this job for 15 years. Her family’s total earnings are about 4,000,000 VND per month. 

She has participated in SEDA's credit program since 2005. In the last cycle, she borrowed 9,810,000 VND and repaid the loan on time. In this loan cycle, she would like to borrow 9,810,000 VND to buy tailoring tools, cloth and sewing supplies to do her job. She always wants to buy more sewing machines and hire employees to expand her tailor store.

loans.use: to buy tailoring tools, cloth and sewing supplies to do her job.

loans.name: George

texts.en:
George is a male Ugandan, aged 29 years and married to Allen; they have three children ages seven, five and two. Two of the children attend school. He has no other dependents due to the high cost of living.

George deals in cassava produce. He has been in this business since 2008. He works 6 days a week and 12 hours a day. The business is located in Ruteete town where his clients come from. The business was started because he was inspired by his father. He also sells maize and beans to earn some additional income.

George wants a loan of 1,000,000 UGX to buy more produce for his business and also help him finish the construction of his house. He is challenged by the weather and price fluctuation of the maize, beans and cassava. He is hard-working and honest.

loans.use: to finish construction of his house.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en: Evelyn is 44 years old and from Talibon, Bohol. She has a 19-year-old daughter. She engages in farming.
