She grows green onions (young onions with a long slender green stalk, leaves, a small bulb and often eaten raw in salads). Aside from growing onions, Evelyn also grows rice. She has been farming rice for 15 years. She requested a loan of 14,000 PHP to buy fertilizers, pesticides and rice seedlings. In the future, Evelyn would like to expand her business to be able to finance the studies of her child.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, pesticides and rice seedlings.

loans.name: Chaka

texts.en:
Chaka is a married man, and he has six kids who attend school. He owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. His greatest monthly expenses are school fees for the children and food for the family.

For the past ten years, he has operated a meat goat business to earn a living. His potential customers are butchers and his fellow villagers. In addition, he operates a poultry farming business, which provides him another source of income. His major challenge is the high cost of transportation to his place of operation.

With the KES 50,000 loan, he wants to purchase five goats and a weighing machine. He decided to join Yehu to access loans, to boost his business and improve his living standard.

loans.use: to purchase five goats and a weighing machine

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is a farmer from Ndunyu Njeru. His previous loan helped enable him to plant and harvest his crops, in good time.

He has applied for his second loan from KADET LTD, after having repaid his previous loan on time. He will use the new loan to buy fertilizer for his farm. He hopes to introduce various new crop varieties with the anticipated profit. He hopes to expand his farm in the near future, and to improve his family's living standard.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for his farm.

loans.name: Phoey's Group

texts.en:
Phoey, 45, is married and lives with her husband and three children in a village of the Srey Snom district of Siem Reap Province. One of her three children is a dependent and still in school. She and her husband are rice farmers. She has been in the rice farming business for 25 years, earning about 20,000 KHR per day to feed her family. 

Phoey just joined VisionFund this cycle. Now, she is leading her group of four to ask for a loan. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy fertilizer for her farmland. With this loan, she hopes to increase her crop yields and earn more income to better her family’s living condition.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her farmland.

location.town: Siem Reap Province, Srey Snom district

loans.name: Resilene

texts.en: Resilene is 26 years old and married, but they do not have a child yet.  She manages a hog raising business to support her husband in providing for their daily needs. Despite financial difficulty, they strive to become successful and financially stable in the future. Resilene wants to improve her hog-raising business in order to earn a higher income. To fulfill this, she is asking for a loan of 31,000 PHP from the Kiva lenders through ASKI to buy feeds, vitamins and additional piglets to raise. She is hoping that her loan will help a lot in making the business grow and profitable in the future.

loans.use: to buy feeds, vitamins and additional piglets to raise.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy grocery stock, e.g., maize, beans, rice and cooking fat.

loans.name: Ley's Group

texts.en:
Ley is a 35-year-old mother of three children, and all of them are still dependent on her and in school. She lives with her family in a rural village of the Moungkul Borey district, Banteay Meanchey province. Ley and her husband earn a living by farming rice and planting vegetables, such as eggplant, cucumbers and cabbage, as the main sources of their family’s income. They have been in this business for almost 25 years, earning about 15,000 KHR per day.

Ley has been with VisionFund for four loan cycles, while her fellow borrowing group member is just with VisionFund for this cycle. Ley successfully paid back the past loans, which have helped her to improve her livelihood. Now she is leading her group of two, to apply for a new loan. She will use her portion to buy cement, bricks, a latrine pan, and other materials for building a proper latrine. Ley hopes that this loan will enable her family to have a clean latrine for daily use, so as to have a more healthy standard of living.

loans.use: To buy cement, bricks, a latrine pan, and other materials for building a latrine

location.town: Banteay Meanchey Province, Mongkul Borey District

loans.name: Glem Americo

texts.es: El señor Glem, como todo Nicaragüense desea salir adelante junto a su familia, que la conforman su esposa y dos pequeños hijos quienes estudian, Glem continua con la venta de tacos y ahora también hace pizzas negocio con el que se ayuda para sus diferentes gastos, este segundo crédito que solicita es para comprar materia prima como harina, queso, ingredientes, tortilla, carne, repollo para continuar con la venta para el sustento familiar.
texts.en:
Glem, like all Nicaraguans, wishes to get ahead with his family.  His family is comprised of his wife and two small children, who go to school.

Glem continues to sell tacos.  Now he also makes pizzas.  His business helps him with their different expenses.

This is his second loan.  He is requesting the loan to buy raw material like flour, cheese, ingredients, tortillas, meat, and cabbage in order to continue his sales to support his family.

loans.use: to buy flour, cheese, ingredients, tortillas, meat, and cabbage.

loans.name: Jose Omar

texts.es: jose de 36 años de edad, es muy amable y trabajador, vive junto con su hijo y su esposa. El trabaja muy duro en su propia parcela en la que actualmente ha sembrado maíz y frijol, sus productos son de muy buena calidad y la parcela está ubicada en una zona de fácil acceso lo que es muy bueno para él porque le beneficia que sus clientes puedan llegar inmediatamente hasta el lugar.  jose solicita un préstamo a INTEGRAL para contar con el dinero necesario e invertir en la compra de insumos agrícolas como controles de plaga y fertilizantes, para iniciar la siembra cuanto antes. jose ansía aumentar sus ventas para poder percibir mayores ganancias y darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Friendly, hardworking Jose is 36 and lives with his son and wife. He works hard on his own land, where he grows corn and beans. His crops are high quality, and the land is located in an easily accessed area, which is good because his customers can easily reach it. 

Jose has applied to INTEGRAL for a loan to buy needed agricultural supplies to control disease and to fertilize so that he can begin planting as soon as possible. He is anxious to increase sales and earn more income to give his family a better life.

loans.use: to buy manure, seed, fertilizer, etc

loans.name: Joshua

texts.en:
Joshua lives in the Mombasa area of Coast province, Kenya. He is married and has three children, all of whom attend school. He owns a transport business, which he has been operating for six years. He offers transport service to the residents of Mombasa. He is also a scrap metal dealer.

He learned about Milango through a friend who invited him to the group. He joined with an aim of accessing credit, to improve his business operations. The challenge he is facing is inflation.

Joshua is applying for a loan of 21,100 Kenyan shillings (KES). He will use it to buy two tons of scrap metal for resale. The extra income from the loan will be added to his savings, to improve the living standard of his family. His plan for the future is to buy another motorcycle.

loans.use: To buy two tons of scrap metal for resale.

loans.name: Shiela

texts.en:
Sheila is 36 years old and married. She is from Seti, Jimenez. She has two grown children, who have helped her in taking care of their cassava. They have been raising cassava for five years and earn about 5,000 PHP a month.

This year, Sheila joined GDMPC. She has requested a loan of 8,000 PHP from GDMPC, which she will use to purchase fertilizer and pay for weeding costs. She hopes for a bountiful harvest and hopes to expand her cultivated area.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and pay for weeding costs

loans.name: Fatima Del Rosario

texts.es: La señora Fatima habita en el municipio de Masaya junto a su esposo, el trabaja como conductor independiente el cual le apoyo con los gastos del hogar, ella cultiva Yuca y  granos basicos como Maiz, Frjoles. actualmete  necesita restaurar una  manzana de yuca para aprovechar la entra del invierno y obtener mejores cosecha y mas ingresos, con este nuevo financiamiento comprara, Madera de Yuca, Fertilizantes, Triple, Urea, Completo y pagara  la mano de Obra de los trabajadores, Agradece el apoyo que Afodenic y Fondos Kiva le han brindado en estos 5 ciclos que lleva trabajando.
texts.en: Fatima lives in the city of Masaya with her husband, who is an independent driver and helps pay the household expenses. She grows yuca and basic crops like corn and beans. She needs to prepare a manzana of yuca so that she take advantage of the winter season, have a better harvest, and increase her income. She will use the new loan to buy yuca wood, fertilizer, Triple, urea, and Complete and to pay laborers. She thanks Afodenic and Kiva for the five precious loans they have given her.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies.

loans.name: Miguel

texts.es: Miguel tiene 20 años , es soltero y vive en la casa de sus padres quienes lo apoyan por ser un joven honesto y trabajador.Se dedica a la producción de cacao y café orgánico en el terreno agrícola de sus padres donde viene apoyando desde hace 3 años.Considera que ser joven es la edad adecuada para escoger un rumbo laboral e iniciar a trabajar buscando estabilidad económica.Actualmente sus padres decidieron asignarle responsabilidades y por ser un joven muy trabajador en busca de una independencia económica planean otorgarle un terreno agrícola de media hectárea para la producción de cacao orgánico , considera que este producto es una buena fuente de inversión siempre en cuando se aplique un trabajo adecuado .Uno de sus principales objetivos a largo plazo es la adquisicion de un terreno y cumplir con el sueño de la casa propia , el cual es vital para formar una sólida familia según comenta.Es la primera vez que recibe un préstamo y que mejor que viene por parte de Kiva además  se compromete en cumplir puntualmente con sus cuotas y a seguir trabajando con la motivación que lo caracteriza. Requiere en esta ocasión 1,000 nuevos soles para iniciar su labor  con la compra de abono orgánico para sus terrenos de cultivo.
texts.en:
Miguel, 20, is single and lives in his parents' house.  They support him because he's an honest and hardworking young man.

He makes a living growing cacao and organic coffee on his parents' land, where he has been helping for three years.  He thinks that being young is the right age for choosing a work path and starting to work for economic stability.  Currently his parents decided to give him responsibilities and because he's a hardworking young man in search of financial independence they plan to give him a half-hectare plot of agricultural land to grow organic cacao.  He thinks this product is a good source of investment as long as you work enough.

One of his main long-term goals is to acquire a plot of land and achieve his dream of having his own house, which he says is vital for having a strong family.

This is the first time he has received a loan and it's best that it come through Kiva.  He also promises to make his payments punctually and to continue working with his characteristic motivation.

Currently he needs 1,000 nuevos soles [PEN] to start his work by buying organic soil amendments for his crops.

loans.use: to buy organic soil amendments

loans.name: Orlando

texts.es: Don Orlando es un hombre muy responsable con sus obligaciones de hogar, ya que siempre se ha caracterizado por brindarle lo mejor a su familia. Actualmente vive junto a su esposa, se dedica a ser agricultor siembra cafe, con las ganancias que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar los gastos de su hogar. Orlando desea incrementar sus ventas y por eso a solicitado un crédito el cual le permita comprar: abonos, fertilizantes, herbicidas asi como muestra la fotografia entre otras cosas , para seguir llevando el pan de cada dia a su hogar.
texts.en:
Orlando is very responsible in fulfilling his household obligations. He always has tried to offer his family the best. He lives with his wife. 

He grows coffee, and, with the profits from sales, he is able to pay household expenses. Orlando wants to increase sales. He has applied for a loan to buy manure, fertilizer, and weed killer, as shown in the photo, so that he can continue to support his household.

loans.use: to buy manure, fertilizer, weed killer, etc

loans.name: Art's Group

texts.en:
Art, aged 28 years old, is widowed and has four kids. She lived with her husband in a rural village of the Bovel district of Battambang province, Cambodia. Two of her kids are still in school. She earns a living by planting cassava and corn. Having been in this business for three years, she can earn about 16,000 KHR per day from the current business and manages to save about 8,000 KHR each day after offsetting expenses.

Art’s group consists of two members who live in the same area. She is a first-cycle client with VisionFund. Now leading this group to apply for a loan, Art will use her portion to buy fertilizers, pesticides, and seeds for her farmland. She hopes to make more income from her growing business so as to make a better living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, pesticides, and seeds for her farmland

loans.name: Prima

texts.en:
Prima is a farmer from the town of San Miguel, Bohol. She has been in the farming business for more than 17 years now. This is the main source of her income. She helped her husband in tilling their lands.

Prima is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer and pesticides for the farm. Through this loan, she will be able to improve her business and make it a success.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticides for her farm

loans.name: Catalina

texts.es: Catalina de 60 años de edad vive con su esposo en casa propia y desde hace 30 años que se dedican a la agricultura la cual es su principal fuente de ingresos siembra maiz y el frijol con las ganancias que obtiene logra solventar los gastos de su hogar, Doña Catalina a decidido solicitar un crédito a INTEGRALpara la compra de abonos, fertilizantes, herbisidas, semillas, etc.  ya que solo de esta forma puede continuar su proceso de cultivo y obtener una cosecha abundante que le permita seguir llevando el pan de cada día a su hogar.
texts.en:
Catalina is 60 and lives with her husband in their own house. For 30 years, she has been a farmer. Her main source of income is growing corn and beans. She is able to pay household expenses with her earnings. 

Catalina decided to apply to INTEGRAL for a loan to buy manure, fertilizer, weed killer, seed, and more. This is her only way to continue planting and have a good harvest that will let her support her family.

loans.use: to buy manure, pesticide, fertilizer, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more stock of torches, wallets, combs, sweets, etc. for selling

loans.name: Jalia

texts.en:
Jalia lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with four children, all of whom attend school. She is also looking after two sisters.

Jalia has been selling secondhand clothing from the market at retail for seven years, working seven days a week. She generates additional income from poultry farming.

She has requested a loan of UGX 2,000,000 from MCDT- SACCO to be able to purchase more bales of dresses, jackets, and blouses for adults for selling. Her business challenges include seasonality and transportation. Her dreams are to grow her business to the wholesale level, to see her children through to university, and also to build her own house.  

Jalia joined MCDT-SACCO because of timely loans. She lives in a rented house without access to both electricity and piped water. Her major monthly expenses include school fees, transport, and rent.

loans.use: to buy more dresses, blouses, and jackets to sell

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en: Stephen is 45 years old and married with 3 children. He lives in Clarin, Misamis Occidental. He owns and operates a retail business in the local community to earn a living. He has been in this business for over 4 years and earns 8,000 PHP every month. He has joined with GDMPC since the year 2010 and now he has requested a loan of 15,000 PHP to purchase additional products to sell. He hope and dream is to improves his living situation.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Cesar

texts.es: Cesar de 34 años de edad vive en casa propia con su hermana y su madre, él se dedica al cultivo de maíz y maicillo desde hace varios años y eso le ha dado la experiencia necesaria para asistir sus cultivos, sus cosechas las comercializa en los mercados de granos basicos con las ganancias que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar los gastos de su hogar. Cesar solicita un credito para poder comprar los insumos necesarios como fertilizantes , herbicidas, abonos, entre otras cosas asi como muestra la fotografia para tener buenas cosechas y asi el pueda obtener mejores ganancias para darle a su familia una mejor estabilidad económica
texts.en:
César, 34, lives in his own house with his sister and his mother.

He has made a living for several years growing corn and sorghum, which has given him the experience he needs to take care of his crops.  He sells his harvests in the grain markets.  He's able to pay his household expenses with the profits he earns from his sales.

César's requesting a loan to be able to buy the necessary inputs, such as fertilizer, herbicide, soil amendments, and other things, as shown in the photograph, so he'll have good harvests, earn better profits, and give his family greater economic stability.

loans.use: to buy soil amendments, fertilizer, pesticide, etc.

loans.name: Milagros

texts.en:
This is Milagros, 49, a resident of Malibay, Pasay, Philippines. She is married to Sergio, a driver, and is a mother to their children. Together she and her husband manage their household while operating their business. They are working hard to provide income for their everyday needs.

Milagros sells clothing, footwear, undergarments, cosmetics and other products through popular direct sales brands like Avon, Fuller Life, Natasha, Boardwalk, Marikina Shoe Exchange, and others. A customer's order is bought in cash by the dealer and then given to the customer with a one-month-to-pay credit. The dealer’s prices are lower than those in the catalog. 

Milagros' regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 2000 PHP in sales every week. To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a 10,000 PHP loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy additional supplies and merchandise like shampoo, cologne, deodorant, perfume, soap, fabric softener, undergarments and other products. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her inventory.  

Milagros dreams to be successful in her business so that she may be able help her family financially. She hopes that her whole family will be closer to God. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business in weekly meetings, where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for additional merchandise, like clothing, footwear, undergarments, and cosmetics.

loans.name: Maiy's Group

texts.en:
Living in a rural village of the Mougkul Borey district of Banteay Meanchey province, Maiy is a 48-year-old mother of one child. She and her husband earn a living by farming rice and planting cassava as the main source of their family’s income. They have been in this business for almost 29 years, earning about 25,000 KHR per day.

Maiy’s group consists of two members who live in the same village. She is an eighth-cycle client with VisionFund and she successfully paid back the past loans, which have helped her improve her livelihood. Now she is leading her group member to seek a new loan. As the leader, Maiy is going to use her portion to buy fertilizer for her farmland. She hopes to grow more healthy crops and earn more income to make a better living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her farmland

location.town: Banteay Meanchey Province, Mongkul Borey District

loans.name: Kelly

texts.es: Kelly de 22 años de edad, vive con su cónyuge en la ciudad de Cartagena de Indias, donde se dedica a la comercialización de artículos varios como armarios muebles y también ofrece variedades femeninas que vende de contado desde las 8 de la mañana hasta las 5 de la tarde.  Sus principales clientes son mujeres, jóvenes y niños del barrio. La miscelánea de Kelly ha crecido poco a poco peo su expectativa de aumentar su cobertura de clientes para ampliarlos e superior a sus posibilidades de hacerlo con su propio capital. Esta es la razón por la cual acude a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará muebles de madera armarios y variedades, para hacer una exhibición que impacte a su clientela, en el mes mas comercial del año, a propósito de la celebración del día de las madres. Su meta mas  adelante es terminar su especialización para lograr  ser exitosa y tener un futuro prometedor.
texts.en:
Kelly, 22, lives with her husband in the city of Cartagena de Indias, where she sells merchandise such as wardrobe closets and items that appeal to women. She sells for cash form 8 AM until 5 PM. Her main customers are women, teenagers, and children from the neighborhood. Kelly's store has grown little by little; however, her desire to increase her clientele can not be achieved with her own capital. 

So she has applied for her first Kiva loan, through Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, to buy wood furniture, wardrobe closets, and other items so that she can have a tremendous presentation to offer her customers during the busiest month of the year, which includes Mother's Day. Her long-term goal is to finish her studies so that she can have a bright, successful future.

loans.use: to buy wood furniture, wardrobe closets, and other items.

loans.name: Judith

texts.en:
Judith is 31 years old and lives in Banglay, Tangub City, Missamis Occidental, Philippines. She is married with 2 children. 

To earn a living, Judith has a business selling snack foods. She earns about PHP 5,600 each month doing this type of work. Judith has a requested a loan of PHP 12,000 to buy food ingredients for the snack-vending business.

Judith has been a member of PMPC for 1 year. In the future, Judith would like to improve her family's living conditions by using the profits of the business.

loans.use: to buy food ingredients for her snack-vending business

loans.name: Leonila

texts.en: Leonila is a fish vendor from the town of Trinidad, Bohol. Leonila has engaged in the fishing business for more than ten years now. Leonila is asking for a loan to buy more fish to sell in the market. Through this, she will be able to improve her sales and eventually her income. In the future, Leonila dreams of a sustainable life.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell in the market.

loans.name: William

texts.en:
William has a metal shop in Nakuru and was able to buy more stock of scrap metal through his previous loan.

He has applied for his second loan from KADET to enable him buy a weighing machine after paying his previous loan successfully. He plans to put up another scrap metal store with the anticipated profits.

He hopes to buy a second pick-up in the near future.

loans.use: to buy a secondhand weighing machine for his metal shop

loans.name: Patricio

texts.en: Patricio is 46 years old, married, and has two school-aged children. He is a farmer who is raising his family in a rural community. He cultivates their farmland by planting vegetables, fruits, and root crops for selling. He plans to expand his vegetable production to ensure a higher production. Due to inadequate capital, he is asking for an additional loan of PHP 10,000 to buy the needed seeds, fertilizer, and herbicides to sustain his crop production. He believes that with the financial assistance of KIVA lenders through ASKI, it will enable him to improve his farming business. He hopes that he will have a good harvest and profit for his family.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers, and herbicides needed in vegetable production

loans.name: Rebeca

texts.en:
Rebeca is married and has four children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has electricity, but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past four years, Rebeca has owned a food stall business where neighbours and town dwellers are her customers. She faces the major challenge of fluctuations in the number of clients, hence perishing of goods, leading to losses.

With the KES 35,000, she wants to purchase stock of goods like sugar, rice, maize, wheat flour, cooking fat. She dreams of expanding the business into a modern café.

loans.use: to purchase stock of goods like sugar, rice, maize, wheat flour, and cooking fat for her food stall

loans.name: Gertrudes

texts.en: Gertrudes is a 44-year-old married woman from Talibon, Bohol, the Philippines. She has three children. The oldest child is 17 while the youngest is 12. She owns and manage a retail store, where she sells items like noodles, canned goods, biscuits, sugar, cooking oil and soaps. Her husband farms. She requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to buy additional merchandise like beverages, soft drinks, canned goods and shampoos. In the future, Gertrudes would like to expand her business to support her family  as well as to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy additional merchandise like beverages, soft drinks, canned goods and shampoo.

loans.name: Cristita

texts.en: Cristita is a 43-year-old married woman from Getafe, Bohol. She has two children. The oldest child is 15 while the youngest is 6. She engages in fishing. Aside from fishing, Cristita is in the buy and sell business. She buys and sells fish in the nearby community. She has been in the fishing business for six years now. She requested a loan of 20,000 PHP to buy fishing materials like fish net and various fish for resale to attract more customers. In the future, Cristita would like to expand her business to support her family and to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy fishing materials like fish net and various fish for resale.

loans.name: Israel

texts.es: Don Israel vive con su esposa y su hijo en casa propia, el se dedica a la agricultura y ganaderia desde hace varios, siembra maiz y maicillo con las ganancias que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar los gastos de su hogar, Don Israel esta solicitando un credito para poder comprar abonos, semillas, fertilizantes, etc. para sus cosechas y tambien para comprar vitaminas y ganado de reparto y asi el pueda obtener mejores ganancias y darle a su familia una mejor vida.
texts.en: Israel lives with his wife and son in the home he owns. He has worked in agriculture and cattle ranching for several years. He plants corn and sorghum. With the earnings he obtains from his sales he is able to pay for his household expenses. Israel is asking for a loan to be able to buy manure, seeds, fertilizers, etc. for his crops. He will also buy vitamins for cattle so he can make more profits and give his family a better life.

loans.use: to buy manure, seeds, fertilizers and vitamins for his cattle.

loans.name: Sheila

texts.en:
Sheila, a 25-year-old married mother of four children ranging in age from eight months to nine years, describes herself as ambitious. For five years now she has been operating a retail store where she sells sugar, rice, maize flour and other items. Sheila's business is located in an area with many people, and her primary customers are local residents. Poor roads over which she must transport her stock are her biggest business challenge.

Sheila will use this Kes 20,000 loan to add stocks of sugar, maize flour, rice and other items. Her business goal is to have a stable business within five years, and she will use her profits to buy a motorbike to transport her goods and pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to add stocks of sugar, maize flour, rice and other items.

loans.name: Carla Del Socorro

texts.es:
La señora  Carla del Socorro se dedica a su actividad de venta de comida en uno de los mercados de chinandega desde hace 20 años.
 comenzó como ayudante  de cocina en el comedor de su mamá, posteriormente la señora decidió poner su propio negocio  con capital ahorrado decidió poner su negocio, la señora es madre soltera tiene una hija esta en edad escolar en  secundaria por la que se esfuerza  por salir adelante y sueña con que sea una profesional brindado sus practicas pre-profesionales.

 la señora vende de lunes a domingo  desde las siete de la mañana hasta las cuatro de la tarde, solicita un financiamiento para comprar granos básicos por quintales, ingredientes para la elaboración de sus comidas que realiza a diario.
texts.en: Carla del Socorro has worked selling food in one of the markets of Chinadega for twenty years. She began as a kitchen assistant in her mother's restaurant. Later, she decided to start her own business with capital she saved. Carla is a single mother. She has a daughter who is in middle school, for whom she works to get ahead. She dreams that her daughter will become a professional based on her pre professional work. Carla sells food from Monday to Sunday between 7am and 4pm. She is seeking a loan to buy basic grains by the bushel and ingredients for the creation of the food she makes each day.

loans.use: to buy merchandise, basic grains, oil, and ingredients.

loans.name: Sumac Maky Group

texts.es:
La socia Nely pertenece al banco comunal SUMAC MAKY,el banco se encuentra ubicado en el distrito de Cusco,provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia continua dedicandose a la venta de artesania ,la socia cuenta con un pequeño taller donde elabora su mercaderia como chompas de alpaca entre otros,la socia lleva años en este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada dia a su negocio ,la socia es una persona responsable siendo de esta forma que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
(La socia Nely está levantando la mano en la fotografía).

La socia solicito el credito para la compra de lana de alpaca para su negocio.
Los otros socios se dedican a la venta de artesania,venta de cosmeticos,tejidos a croche,cuidado de niños,nutricionistas,cocina.
La socia se siente agradecida por el credito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
This member's name is Nely. She belongs to the SUMAC MAKY communal bank. It is located in the district of Cuzco, province and department of Cuzco.  

Nely continues to work selling artisanal crafts. She has a small workshop where she makes her merchandise, such as alpaca sweaters and more. She has been in this business for years and it is going well for her, thanks to the hard work she puts into it every day. She is a responsible person and that is how she gets her family ahead. Nely is the member who is raising her hand in the photo.

She has asked for the loan to buy alpaca wool for her business. The other members work selling artisanal crafts, cosmetics, crochet knittings, as nutritionists, and cooking. Nely is grateful for the loan she has been given and is committed to making her payments on time.

loans.use: to buy alpaca wool for her business.

loans.name: Janalyn

texts.en: Janalyn is a 25-year-old married woman living in Calamba Misamis Occidental, Philippines. Janalyn owns and manages a transportation service to earn a living, and she's been operating the business for ten years. Each month, she earns 6,000 PHP doing this type of service. She requested a loan of 15,000 PHP to purchase spare parts for better services. In 2010, she joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. In the future, Janalyn wants to make improvements to her house and improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts.

loans.name: Sem

texts.en: Sem is 50 years old and married with 5 children. He lives in Clarin, Misamis Occidental, in the Philippines. He owns and operates a motorcycle transport business to earn a living. He has been in his business for over seven years and earns 4,000 PHP every month. He has joined GDMPC in 2012, and now he has requested a loan of 6,500 PHP to purchase spare motorcycle parts so he can provide better service. His hope and dream is to get his children through school.

loans.use: to purchase spare motorcycle parts to provide better service.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to add to her stock of rice, beans and maize

loans.name: Artemio

texts.en:
Artemio is a 40-year-old married man with two children living in Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. Artemio is operating a service based business providing transportation services to local community members to earn a living. He has been doing this for one year, and every month he earns 5,000 PHP from this work. He has requested a loan of 20,000 PHP to repair his existing vehicle for better service.

Artemio has been a member of GDMPC for a year. In the future, Artemio hopes to support his children to finish their studies and to gain twice the amount of income from his business.

loans.use: to repair his existing vehicle.

loans.name: Batsaikhan

texts.en: Mr. Batsaikhan, 45 years old, lives with his wife and three daughters in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. The family is currently residing in his brother's apartment temporarily because he hasn't finished his house renovation. He has been leading construction teams to perform various building work on contract with building companies or individuals since 2006, has accumulated a vast amount of experience in executing his work and is considered to be the best by his clients. Before this job, he had been rendering taxi services to the local people using his automobile for some time. He is requesting a loan of 3,500,000 MNT to launch a block making factory. He will use this money for the necessary equipment and land. It is expected that he will generate more income from this factory and improve his family's living standard. The borrower is a very hardworking individual who works day and night as well as a caring father and husband for his daughters and wife, respectively.

loans.use: to launch a block making factory by purchasing equipment and land.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy construction materials.

loans.name: Tomasa

texts.en:
Tomasa is 41 years old and is married to Virgilio. They are happy to be blessed with two children who are attending school. Tomasa’s husband is a farmer, and also a carpenter. Tomasa has run a sari-sari store (general store) in their village for almost 15 years. She is proud that some of their household expenses are covered by her profit from the business.

Tomasa wants to see her children holding degrees and working as professionals one day. She thinks that by extending the products she sells, she will have enough income to sustain her children's allowances for expenses. Thus, she is asking for a loan of 20,000 PHP to buy drinks, condiments, and bread to sell. She hopes that her children become professionals someday.

loans.use: to buy drinks, condiments, and bread to sell.

loans.name: Franklin

texts.en: Franklin is now looking to increase his inventory and take out a third loan! With this loan he will purchase solar desk lamps, improved cookstoves and small solar home systems. Franklin has set up a store outside his home to sell his products but has also had great success marketing door-to-door.

loans.use: to purchase stock for a clean energy business.

loans.name: Tsogjavkhlan

texts.en: Mrs. Tsogjavkhlan, 45 years old, lives with her only son in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. The family resides in their own house on a plot of land. She has been working as a manager at a private business entity for some time, and during her free time, she renders taxi services to the local people using her own automobile. Her son gets a state pension because his father passed away so early. This year, her son is graduating from high school and will continue to study in university. Using her previous loan, she has made renovations and installed insulation in her house. This time, she is requesting a loan of 4,500,000 MNT to expand her house. House expansion will further reduce heat loss and provide more space for her family when her son gets married. Heat loss will reduce the usage of coal and will contribute to the efforts against air pollution. The borrower is a very hard-working individual who wants her son to get very good education, find a job and marry a good woman.

loans.use: to expand her house.

loans.name: Jose

texts.en: Jose is a simple farmer. Through hard work and strong determination, Jose believes that he will be able to improve their status of living and give his children a better life. They are currently living in a rural community planting and harvesting vegetables and root crops for sale. He wants to expand his business, and for him to do this, he would like to borrow additional capital of PHP 10,000 from KIVA lenders through ASKI. He will use the loan to buy seeds, fertilizers and insecticides needed in vegetable production. He is hoping that with their support, he can finally improve his farming business.

loans.use: to buy seed, fertilizers and insecticides needed in vegetable production

loans.name: Elsa

texts.en: Elsa is 48 years old, separated with 3 children. She lives in Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She owns and operates an agriculture operation to earn a living. She has been in her business for over 7 years and earns 10,000 PHP every month. She joined GDMPC in 2007, and now she has requested a loan of 14,000 PHP to purchase fertilizer, such as manure. Her hopes and dreams are to have a better future.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer, such as manure

loans.name: Dorette

texts.fr: Dorette est une femme de 33 ans, célibataire et mère de 2 enfants . elle a ouvert un mini kiosque dans un quartier de la ville qu'elle gère depuis 06 ansoù elle vend des crédits de communication. Elle sollicite ce crédit pour acheter des crédits de communications en gros (MTN, ORANGE, CAMTEL) afin d'augmenter son stock de crédit. Ce qui permettra de réaliser un bénéfice non seulement pour augmenter son capital et activité et de satisfaire la clientèle. elle voudrait ainsi avec ces derniers pouvoir subvenir au besoin de sa famille et les siens
texts.en:
Dorette is a 33-year-old single woman and the mother of two children.  She has opened a mini-kiosk in one of her city's neighborhoods, and she has been managing it for six years.  She sells telephone credits.

She is requesting this loan to buy bulk quantities of phone credits (from MTN, Orange, Camtel) in order to increase her stock of credit.  This will allow her to make a profit which will not only increase her capital and boost her business, but also allow her to satisfy the needs of her customers.

Her goal is to use her profits to take care of her own needs as well as those of her family.

loans.use: to buy phone credit.

loans.name: Monina

texts.en: Monina is 53 years old and married with four children. She is from Poblacion, Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur. Monina buys and sells ready-to-wear dresses and other clothes. She had been in this business for 34 years and earns 18,000 PHP a month. Monina joined GDMPC in 2007. Monina is requesting a loan of 35,000 PHP to buy more ready-to-wear clothes to sell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to buy more ready-to-wear clothes to sell.

loans.name: Juline

texts.en: Juline has already taken out three loans to launch her clean energy retail business. She is selling her EarthSpark clean energy products on a rent-to-own basis in her community. After renting out the entire inventory she bought with her last loan and still has customers calling her with more orders. She is taking out a fourth loan to help meet the demand in her community for a source of renewable energy that will allow customers save money while helping the environment.

loans.use: to purchase inventory for a clean energy retail business.

loans.name: Altise

texts.en: Altise started out her business with EarthSpark clean energy products by selling solar light bulbs on a rent to own basis in her community. Her business has since expanded and she has now added solar desk lamps and charcoal efficient stoves to her product line. She is taking out another loan to be able to add to her stock.

loans.use: to purchase stock for a clean energy business.

loans.name: Lecene

texts.en: Lecene started selling EarthSpark clean energy products a few months ago, integrating these products into his existing business. In addition to selling EarthSpark products, he also sells hand-made crafts such as earrings and woven purses. He travels around town on a bicycle with all his stock with him. He is looking to increase his inventory.

loans.use: to purchase stock for a clean energy business.

loans.name: Sear's Group

texts.en:
Sear is 33 years old and married. He lives with his wife and two children in a rural area of the Moungkul Borey District of Banteay Meanchey Province. One of his children is still in school. He is a paid construction worker while his wife has been supplementing the family’s income by making baskets for carrying or storing things. Having been in this business for several years, together they can earn about 25,000 KHR per day.

Sear’s group is composed of two members who live in the same village, and he is in his first microloan with VisionFund. Now he is leading the group to request a loan. Sear, who is the leader, will use his portion to buy bamboo for producing baskets and will also use some of it to buy school materials for his child’s education. He hopes that this loan will enable him to increase his income to keep his child in school and also fulfill his dream to buy piglets to raise for additional income.

loans.use: To buy bamboo for producing baskets

location.town: Banteay Meanchey Province, Mongkul Borey District

loans.name: Mao's Group

texts.en:
Originally from a rural village of Banteay Meanchey province’s Moungkul Borey district, Mao is a 54-year-old mother of five children, one of whom is dependent on her and still in school. She has raised pigs and worked as a paid worker for eight years. Together, Mao and her husband can earn about 30,000 KHR per day from the current business and can manage to save about 15,000 KHR each day.

Mao has been with VisionFund for five cycles and has fully paid back the past loans while the other members have completed from two to four cycles. The past loans have helped Mao to better support her family. Now she and her group members are applying for a loan. She will use her portion to buy pig feed for nourishing her pigs and use part of it to spend on building a piggery. She hopes to fatten her pigs so as to increase her family’s income and keep her child in school.

loans.use: To buy pig feed

location.town: Banteay Meanchey Province, Mongkul Borey District

loans.name: Firdavs

texts.ru: Фирдавс молодой парень в возрасте 22 лет. Он не женат и живет со своими родителями. Фирдавс с детство занимается торговлей. Сначала он продавал только  парфюмерии  а сейчас он ещё  занимается продажей пищевых продуктов. В обороте у Фирдавса имеется около 9000 долларов США. В основном он продает в оптом . Его отец работает в России, а мать домохозяйка. Чтобы помочь  своим родителям Фирдавс самостоятельно занимается своим бизнесом и чтобы в дальнейшем развивать свой бизнес он хочет получит кредит в размере 2300 долларов США сроком на 18  месяцев.
texts.en: Firdavs is a young man, age 22.  He is not married and lives with his parents.  Since his childhood, he has worked in trade.  In the beginning, he only sold perfumes, and now he sells food products.  His turnover is around 9,000 USD.  Mostly he sells in bulk.  His father works in Russia and his mother is a homemaker.  In order to help his parents, Firdavs runs his own business and in order to expand this business, he wants to take out a loan of 2,300 USD to be repaid over 18 months.

loans.use: for the purchase of foodstuffs

loans.name: Conchita

texts.en:
Conchita is 64 years old and lives in San Apolinario, Tangub City, Misamis Occidental. She is married with two children. 

Conchita has a shop that selling groceries and other retail goods. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan amount of Php. 14,000  to buy goods for the grocery retail store.

Conchita has been a member of PMPC for three years.  In the future, Conchita hopes to improve her living conditions by using the profits of the business.

loans.use: to buy goods for her grocery retail store

location.town: Tangub - San Apolinario, Tangub City, Misamis Occi

loans.name: Roen's Group

texts.en:
Living in a rural area located in the Moungkul Borey District, where crop farming is a common way to make a living, Roen, 62, is a widowed mother of three children. The sources of her family’s income are from rice farming and producing coops for sale. Sometimes, she works for others for a fee. She has been engaged in this business for 31 years. She can earn about 25,000 KHR per day to feed her family.

Roen’s group consists of two members who have been with VisionFund for four cycles. The past loans have helped Roen to better support her family as well as her children’s education. Now she is leading her group to ask for a loan. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy fertilizer for her farmland, and she will also use some of it to buy bamboo for making coops. She hopes this loan will help her to earn more income for her family so as to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for her farmland

location.town: Banteay Meanchey Province, Mongkul Borey District

loans.name: Yem

texts.en:
Yem is a resident living in Prey Chor district, which is a public gathering area and a central district surrounded by other Kompong Cham districts. The region is located in an area of high agricultural prevalence; it is very fertile and close to her home. Yem has been in farming for years and has gained valueable experience, which allows her to have better yields in each harvest season. Aside from farming, Yem can make additional income by selling steamed sweet corn from her old bike, generating approximately KHR 10,000 each day.

Yem wants to build a room on the ground floor to keep the personal belongings of her family, yet she doesn’t have enough money to buy some materials for the construction. That is why she is now taking out a loan through HKL as her first Kiva loan. Through this loan, she believes that she will be able to make better living conditions for her family.

loans.use: to buy some materials to build a room.

loans.name: Emaran Desire

texts.fr: Emaran est un homme de 48 ans, marié et père de 3 enfants. il vend des vivres secs dans un marché de la ville depuis 7 ans où il vend plantains, pistaches, maïs, macabo. Dynamique, il sollicite ce crédit pour renforcer son stock de marchandises en achetant 8 régime de plantains, 5 filets de pistaches, maïs, couscous, ignames, njansang, macabo  afin de diversifier son activité et d'augmenter son chiffre d'affaires et ses profits.les bénéfices générés vont lui permettre agrandir son point de vente et de relever le niveau de vie de sa famille (nutrition, éducation, santé)
texts.en:
Emaran is 48 years old, married, and the father of three children.  He has been selling dry goods at a market located in his city, for the past seven years.  He sells plantains, pistachos, maize and macabo.

He is a dynamic seller, and he is requesting this loan to boost his stock of merchandise.  He will use his loan to buy eight bunches of bananas, five nets of pistachos, some maize, couscous, yams, njasang seeds and macabo.  This will allow him to diversify his activity and to boost his turnover and profits.

Emaran will use his profits to increase the size of his outlet and to improve his family's standard of living (nutrition, education, healthcare).

loans.use: to buy eight bunches of bananas, five nets of pistachos, some maize, couscous, yams, njasang seeds and macabo.

loans.name: Saroern

texts.en:
A citizen from a rural village of Kampong Cham province’s Ou Reang Ov district, Saroern is aged 52 years and married. She has five children to take care of, and three of them are dependents and still in school. To feed her family, she has worked hard as a rice farmer who has been growing rice and cassava for 32 years. The current business earns her about 30,000 KHR per day.

Saroern is a first-cycle client with VisionFund. Now she is applying for a loan. With this loan, she is going to buy cassava seeds for her farmland and use a portion of it to spend on labor fees. She hopes to grow healthy rice and cassava to increase her family’s income and so as to make a living better.

loans.use: To buy cassava seeds for her farmland

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ou Reang Ov district

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to increase her capital and buy a large quantity of rice for resale, in order to make more money.

loans.name: Sokun

texts.en:
Sokun is 37 years old and lives with her family members in a rural village located in the Tbaung Khmum District of Kampong Cham Province. She is married with three children, all of whom are dependents and still in school. To support the family, Sokun and her husband have been growing cassava and rice, and sometimes they work for others for a fee. The current business earns them about 24,000 KHR per day, and they manage to save about 10,000 KHR each day for their future needs. 

Sokun has been a member of VisionFund for three cycles already. She fully paid back the past loans, which have improved her family’s living condition, and now she is confident to make their living better. Now, she is applying for another loan of 2,000,000 KHR to buy materials for construction of a decent house, and she will use some of it to buy fertilizer for her cassava growing. She hopes this loan will help her to have a warm house to live in and also hopes to have a timely cassava planting.

loans.use: To buy materials for construction of a decent house

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Romualdo

texts.en:
Romualdo is a fisherman from the town of Bien Unido, Bohol. He is a married man and a father of four young children. Fishing is the source of his income.

Romualdo is asking for a loan to buy a new boat engine. Through this loan, he will be able to improve his catch, thereby providing him with more fish to sell in the market. In the future, Romualdo hopes of becoming successful in his venture.

loans.use: to buy a new boat engine

loans.name: Eudosia

texts.es:
Eudosia tiene 33 años de edad y esta casada con Abraham con quien tiene 2 hijos juntos viven en una casa alquilada. Eudosia se dedica a la producción de cacao orgánico junto a su esposo en un terreno agrícola de 4 hectáreas que adquirió desde hace 10 años.El principal problema que afronto al inicio de su labor fue que no contaba con capital suficiente para la renovación de plantaciones desfasadas con plantas de almácigo  para el cual es necesario contratar a personal de una cooperativa local y evaluar la calidad sus terrenos cultivados.
Contrata constantemente a trabajadores del lugar para facilitar  las labores como son el retiro de maleza y cosecha.Tiene como meta adquirir un terreno para la construcción de su casa y dejar las viviendas alquiladas.Es su segundo crédito otorgado por Kiva y está agradecida por la oportunidad financiera que recibe , además se compromete a seguir puntualmente con el pago de sus cuotas.Con el monto solicitado de 1,500 soles desea comprar una refrigeradora para guardar sus cultivo , además mejorará su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Eudosia is 33 years old, married to Abraham, and has two children.  They all live together in a rented house.  Eudosia raises organic cacao with her husband, on 4 hectares of farmland that she acquired 10 years ago.  The main problem she faces is that she doesn't have enough capital to renew her crops with new plants, for which she needs to hire people from a local co-op and evaluate the quality of her farmland.

She constantly hires local workers to help with the weeding and harvest.  Her goal is to acquire land on which to build a home and leave the rented house.  This will be her second loan through Kiva and she is grateful for this opportunity.  She is also committed to being on time with her payments.  She will use the 1,500 PEN from this loan to buy a cooler to store her crops and also make some home improvements.

loans.use: to buy a cooler.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en: Fatuma is a very hardworking woman.  She appreciates the previous Kiva loan which helped her to expand her business.  She is requesting another loan of 50,000 KES to buy seven gallons of petrol to add to her stock, as her customers are increasing in number each day.  She thanks Yehu and Kiva.

loans.use: to buy seven gallons of petrol.

loans.name: Cindy

texts.en:
Cindy is a resident of Mombasa, Kenya. She is a married mother of two children. She runs a clothes shop, which has been operating for five years.  

She was introduced to Milango by her friends and joined to access credit. She is applying for a loan of 21,100 Kenya shillings to purchase new clothes for sale, e.g., handbags, shoes, trousers, shirts, etc.

Cindy believes the income from this loan will help her educate her children. She is focused on owning a wholesale shop despite the challenge of the high cost of stocks from the suppliers, which makes most of her items beyond the reach of the public.

loans.use: To purchase new clothes for sale, e.g. handbags, shoes, trousers, shirts, etc.

loans.name: Norm

texts.en:
Norm is originally from a rural village of the Kampong Cham province’s Prey Chhor district.  She is a 40-year-old mother of four children, one of whom is in school.  To support her family, Norm and her husband have been farming rice for sixteen years and supplement their income by working for others.  Together, they can earn about 16,000 KHR per day and can save about 10,000 KHR each day for their future needs.

Norm has been with VisionFund for one cycle and has fully repaid the loan.  She has used it to better support her living.  Now she is applying for another loan of 2,400,000 KHR to buy pesticides, fertilizer, and seeds for her farmland.  She hopes to make more income from her paddy business so as to improve her family’s living condition.

loans.use: to buy pesticides, fertilizer, and seeds for her farmland.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Prey Chhor district

loans.name: Gladis Seneida

texts.es:
Gladis tiene 47 años de edad, esta acompañada y tiene cuatro hijas de 30, 25,21 y 20 años de edad respectivamente. Vive junto a tres hijas, su padre y tres nietos. Ella es una mujer emprendedora que ha tenido que luchar por su familia; debido a que se separo del padre de sus hijas hace más de 15 años y enfrento la situación sola para mantener a sus hijas; pero hace un año ella volvió a rehacer su vida y se acompaño. Durante 15 años trabajo en la capital del país en un restaurante y vendió ropa en las diferentes colonias de la capital; fue así como poco a poco fue ahorrando para construir una casa muy humilde. Luego, regreso a la comunidad y con mucho esfuerzo instalo una tienda de productos básicos, como arroz, aceite, frijoles, azúcar, verduras, entre otros. La tienda esta abierta al público todos los días desde muy temprano hasta las 8:00 p.m. 

Los productos para la tienda los compra cada ocho y otros cada 22 días. Para irlos a comprar tiene que abordar un autobús que tarda veinte minutos en llegar a la ciudad y lo hace en compañía de una de sus hijas. 

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para comprar arena, cemento, hierro, piedra y pago de mano de obra; para construir un muro de contención en su casa y una cocina; pues su casa solo tiene dos habitaciones y la sala. El crédito le servirá de mucho, ya que la casa es muy pequeña y el humo que genera la leña causa malestar en la familia y con la construcción del muro evitara que se lave el terreno ya que la temporada lluviosa esta por comenzar.  Así, su familia vivirá mejor más cómoda y sin enfermedades respiratorias.
texts.en:
Gladis is 47 years old, is in a relationship, and has four children, ages 30, 25, 21, and 20.  She lives with three of her daughters, her father, and three grandchildren.  She is an enterprising woman who has had to struggle for her family, given that she has separated from the father of her children more than 15 years ago, and she faced a situation where she has had to support her daughters.  It's been a year since she rebuilt her life and started a relationship.  During 15 years of work at a restaurant in the nation's capital, and selling clothing in different neighborhoods in the capital, she saved up little by little to build a humble home.  Later she returned to the community and with great effort opened a store to sell basic products such as rice, cooking oil, beans, sugar, vegetables, and other things.  The store is open to the public everyday from early morning to 8:00 pm.

She buys her merchandise every week and some of it every three weeks.  She has to board a bus for a 20 minute ride to the city to buy her merchandise, and she goes with her daughters.

She will use the money from this loan, through Fundación Campo, to buy sand, cement, iron bars, stone and to pay for labor to build a retaining wall in her home and also a kitchen.  Her house only has two bedrooms and a living room.  This loan will be very helpful since her house is small and the smoke from the wood fire causes harm to her family.  The wall will prevent her house from flooding, now that the rainy season is beginning.  This way her family will be more comfortable and not have any respiratory ailments.

loans.use: to buy building materials.

loans.name: Roman

texts.es: Don Roman de 53 años de edad es un hombre muy responsable con sus obligaciones de hogar, ya que siempre se ha caracterizado por brindarles lo mejor a sus hijos. Actualmente vive junto a su esposa y sus 7 hijos es muy trabajador, siempre lo ha realizado con alegría y entusiasmo, se dedica a ser agricultor siembra todos loa años los principales granos básicos de la zona como lo son: maíz y frijol. Don Roman desea incrementar sus ventas por eso solicita un crédito el cual le permita comprar: semillas, abonos, fertilizantes, pesticidas entre otros y mejorar el terreno que muestra la fotografia que es donde siembra sus cultivos. Desea contar con la ayuda solicitada puesto que no tiene otros ingresos monetarios, y así el seguirá llevando el pan de cada día a su hogar sin limitación alguna.
texts.en: Roman is 53 years old and is very responsible with his household obligations.  He is known for having provided the best for his children.  He currently lives with his wife and seven children and is very hardworking.  He has always worked with happiness and enthusiasm.  He is a farmer and raises corn and beans.  Ramon wants to increase his sales and is asking for a loan so he can buy seeds, compost, fertilizer, pesticides, and other things so he can improve his land shown in the photograph, where he plants his crops.  He would like help because he doesn't have another source of income and he would like to be able to continue providing for his family.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies.

loans.name: Ana Julia

texts.es: Gracias por apoyar a Ana en la compra de telas, pues con ello fabricó vestidos que vendió. Hoy nuevamente está aplicando a un credikiva con el cual comprará telas para fabricar uniformes encargados y con ello generará un nuevo ingreso. Ella envía un mensaje de agradecimientos a los financiadores de Kiva por su colaboración y pide que la sigan apoyando, para lograr crecer rápidamente.
texts.en: Thanks for supporting Ana in her purchase of fabric. She used it to make dresses that she sold. Now she is applying for another Kiva loan that she will use to buy fabric to make uniforms that have been ordered from her and which will give her new income. She sent a message of gratitude to the Kiva lenders for their collaboration and asks that they continue supporting her so that she can grow her business quickly.

loans.use: to buy fabric to make uniforms.

loans.name: Yesaria

texts.es: Yesaria  tiene  53  años de edad, esta casada y vive con el esposo y un hijo actualmente. Ella con crédito pretende comprar mercadería para el negocio y así aumentar las ventas. Ella piensa tener más variedad de cosas  para así tener más ganancia con las ventas y así con su proyecto de ventas de abarrotes  poder generar más ganancias para contribuir con su familia, ella no cuenta con el capital necesario para dicha compra, ya que es de bajos recursos y no tiene como adquirir el dinero necesario para esto, por lo que el solicito un crédito, y es el primer  préstamo que ha  recibido de FUDECOSUR. Ella no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja……
texts.en: Yesaria is 53 years old, married, and lives with her husband and son.  She will use the money from this loan to buy merchandise for her business and increase her sales.  She plans to have a greater variety of items so that she can have greater earnings to share with her family.  She doesn't have the money for said purchase so she is asking for a loan.  This will be her first loan through FUDECOSUR. She has not had other loans in state banks before, but FUDECOSUR has provided a loan easily and with a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to stock her store.

loans.name: Mutimumwe Group

texts.fr:
Pili fait partie du groupe  Mutimumwe  et habite à Bujumbura. C’est une veuve de 61 ans .
Elle a sous sa charge 3 petits enfants dont 2 étudient. 

Elle fait le commerce des pagnes et des assiettes  depuis  20 ans. 

Elle est à son cinquième crédit  à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’elle  obtient, elle va  augmenter son capital et acheter  beaucoup de pagnes et d’assiettes, à  revendre pour gagner plus.
 
Dans les prochaines années, elle voudrait  devenir riche et acheter un véhicule.
texts.en:
Pili is a member of the Mutimumwe group and she lives in Bujumbura.  She is a 61-year-old widow.  She takes care of three grandchildren, two of whom go to school.

She has been selling "pagnes" (West African colorful fabrics) and plates for 20 years.

She is on her fifth loan with Turame.  With the loan that she is receiving from KIVA, she will increase her capital and buy many pagnes and plates for resale, in order to make more money.

In the coming years, she would like to become rich and buy a vehicle.

loans.use: to buy many "pagnes" and plates for resale.

loans.name: Phon

texts.en:
Phon is a 58-year-old married mother of four children.  She lives in a rural village of Ou Reang Ov district, Kampong Cham province.  She is a hardworking farmer who grows cassava and rice on four hectares of farmland.  Together, with hard work, they can earn about 35,000 KHR per day and save about 20,000 KHR each day for their future needs.

Phon has been a member of VisionFund for one cycle already.  She has completely paid back the past loan which has helped her to better support her paddy business.  Now she is applying for another loan with VisionFund, in the amount of 2,000,000 KHR.  She will use this to buy fertilizer for her farmland and to pay for laborers plowing the field.  She hopes this loan will enable her to timely plant her cassava and rice so as to sell it for a good price.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and to pay for laborers plowing her paddy field.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ou Reang Ov district

loans.name: 3 De Abril Group

texts.es: El Banco de Emprendimiento 3 DE ABRIL está compuesto por ocho integrantes de los cuales siete son mujeres y un varón que se dedican a distintas actividades, la presidenta del banco es la Sra. Maribel en la foto es la de polera rosada, la que está sentada, la Sra. Maribel  tiene 37 años y cuatro hijos que se encuentran en edad escolar, ella es estilista, visita domicilios para realizar su trabajo ya que todavía no tiene su propio salón, pero ya le conocen y no le falta trabajo, ya que según sus clientas su trabajo es de buena calidad, solicita el crédito para la compra de material de peluquería como cremas para cabello y tintes , etc. para la realización de su trabajo, la Sra. Maribel es un apersona muy trabajadora, su deseo es poder tener un salón de belleza para así incrementar su clientela y brindar mayor comodidad a sus clientes, se siente feliz y agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en: The Entrepreneurial Bank Third of April is made up of 8 members, 7 women and 1 man, who work performing different activities. The president of the bank is Maribel, who is  seated and wearing the pink t-shirt in the photo. Maribel is 37 years old and she has three children who are in school. She is a stylist. She visits homes to complete her work because she still does not have her own salon. Her clients know her and she is not lacking work because her work is high quality. She seeks the loan to buy hairstyling materials such as creams for hair, dyes, etc. to perform her work. Maribel is a very hardworking person. Her wish is to have her own beauty salon in order to increase her quantity of clients and to provide improved comfort to her clients. She is happy and thankful to the bank for the support it is providing to her.

loans.use: to buy materials for a salon.

loans.name: Rodita

texts.en:
This is Rodita, 41, a resident of Silang, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Fernandico, an agent, and she is a mother to her child. She, together with her husband, manages their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.
  
Rodita is a chicken dealer. She buys chickens in bulk and then sells them per kilo. There are many patrons who prefer her products since they are assured of its freshness and cleanliness.  Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of PHP 6,000 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 11,000 loan. She will be using the loan to buy more chicken needed in her business. 

Rodita dreams that her business will expand and hopes that her child will finish his studies. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for more stocks of chicken needed in her business.

loans.name: Walter

texts.en:
Walter is 62 years old, married, and a father of six children. For the last two years, he has earned a living by selling farm produce in Mpeketoni, Lamu. He earns a monthly profit of KES 12,000. 

Walter was introduced to KADET LTD by our credit officer and is applying for his third loan of KES 25,000 to buy seeds, fertilizer, and other farm inputs needed for his business. He will use the profits made possible by this loan to pay school fees for two of his youngest children who are still in school.

His goal for the future is to venture into mixed farming with a hope of increasing his income so as to improve his financial stability.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizer, and other farm inputs for his business.

loans.name: Tarpanga Group

texts.fr:
Mme  PAULINE est responsable du groupe  TARPANGA. Mariée, elle est mère de 05 enfants. Le plus âgé a 23 ans et le moins âgés à 04 ans. 03 va  à l’école et elle a 06 personnes  en charge.
Mme vend des condiments depuis 03ans.  Elle s’approvisionne dans les villages environnants. Ses clients sont les  femmes, les hommes.
Elle veut s’acheter  02sacs de néré et des condiments secs.	
Elle  veut épargner  ses bénéfices . Mme  ambitionne agrandir son activité et améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Pauline is the leader of the TARPANGA group.  She is married and the mother of five children.  Her oldest child is 23 years old, the youngest is 4.  Three of her children go to school.  Pauline supports six additional persons.

Pauline has been selling condiments for three years.  She buys her supplies in surrounding villages and sells to both men and women.

She wants to buy two bags of néré fruits as well as dry condiments.

Pauline wants to save her profits.  Her ambition is to increase her activity and to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy two bags of néré fruits and dry condiments.

loans.name: Cirila

texts.en:
Cirila is a single, 65-year-old woman who lives in San Apolinario, Tangub City, Misamis Occidental.  Cirila sells snack foods to earn a living and has had this business for 6 years.  She has requested a loan to buy ingredients for the snack vending business.

Cirila has been a member of PMPC for 3 years.  In the future, Cirila hopes to improve her living conditions by using the profits of the business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her snack vending business.

location.town: Tangub - San Apolinario, Tangub City, Misamis Occi

loans.name: Maria Soccoro

texts.en:
Maria Soccoro is 47 years old, married, and blessed with eight children.  They are currently residing in a rural community where they can grow vegetables and maintain a livestock business.  Due to the increasing price of commodities, Soccoro runs a small variety store to generate additional income.  She aims to improve the business and become more profitable.  

She is now asking for the support of Kiva lenders, through ASKI, to borrow 13,000 PHP for more stocks of feeds for her hogs and different commodities for her store (i.e. canned goods, snack foods, beverages, detergent soaps, noodles, candies, seasoning, and soft drinks).  Being a hardworking mother, she believes that someday she will become successful in her small businesses.

loans.use: to buy more items for her store.

loans.name: Rustam

texts.ru: Рустам женат и отец троих детей. Ему 29 лет. Он со своей семьей проживает в столице Таджикистана в городе Душанбе. Его жена домохозяйка. Рустам имеет среднее техническое образование. Он по специальности экономист, но он не работал в этой сфере. Он трудолюбивый и предприимчивый человек. У Рустама имеется грузовая машина ЗИЛ, на котором он перевозит товары в крупном размере. Рустам берет кредит на ремонт грузовой машины и на покупку шин. Рустам 9 лет работает в этой области, и он специалист в своем деле. В будущем он хочет купить легковую машину за счет дохода от деятельности и сдать в аренду.
texts.en: \Rustam is married and has three children. He is 29 years old. He lives with his family in Dushanbe, the capital of Tajikistan. His wife is a homemaker. Rustam has graduated from a technical college. He is an accountant by education, but he did not work in this field. He is a hard-working and enterprising person. Rustam has a ZIL [a Russian car brand] truck  which he uses to transport cargo. He is taking out a loan in order to repair his truck and buy new tires. Rustam has been working in this business for nine years and master it well. In the future he would like to use his revenues to purchase a passenger car and offer it for lease.

loans.use: to repair his truck and buy new tires.

loans.name: Adelina

texts.en:
Adelina is a married woman with four children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. She is 54 years old and has one child who is in school.

She has a buy-and-sell livestock business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 17,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase additional livestock to sell.

Adelina has been in this business for 6 years. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional livestock to sell.

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en: Myrna is 57 years old and married with four children. She lives in Tukuran, Zamboanga Del Sur. She owns and operates a food vending business in the local community to earn a living. She has been in her business for over eight years and earns 7,000 PHP every month. She joined GDMPC in 2011, and now she has requested a loan of 10,000 PHP to purchase additional products to sell. Her hopes and dreams are to have a better future and improve her living situation.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Melinda

texts.en: Melinda is 25 years old, married and has one school-age child. She and her husband are both farmers residing in a rural community. Despite the hardships of living, they have the determination to uplift their status of living. Aside from farming, Melinda runs a small variety store in her village to generate additional income. She aims to improve and strengthen the business to make it profitable.  Lack of capital motivates her to borrow a loan of PHP 7,000 from KIVA lenders through ASKI.  This will be used to buy soft drinks, noodles, canned goods, sugar, detergent soaps, snack foods, beverages and seasonings to sell. She is hoping that someday her business will grow.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks, noodles, canned goods, sugar, detergent soaps, snack foods, beverages and seasonings to sell

loans.name: Ren's Group

texts.en:
Ren, 58, lives with her three children in a rural village of the Tbaung Khmum district of Kampong Cham province, and she is a widowed mother. For the last 28 years, she has been struggling to feed the family by farming rice and planting cassava as the primary source of the family’s income. The current business earns her about 13,000 KHR per day, and she can save about 5,000 KHR each day for future needs.

Ren’s group consists of four members who live in the same village, and she is leading her group to request a loan. As the leader, Ren will use her portion to buy fertilizer for her farmland and to rent more farmland for growing rice and cassava. She hopes to get a high crop yield from her farming business so as to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and to rent more farmland.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Rael

texts.en:
Rael, 30 years old, is from Kakamega county. She is married to Mukala who is a taxi driver and supports the family financially. They are blessed with two children who are 10 and 4 years old.

She has a beauty salon and boutique in the same building. She has been doing these businesses for the last 13 years and makes a monthly income of KES 15,000.  She is taking her third loan with KADET LTD, which she will use to purchase clothing, curtains, a dryer and shoes for both her boutique and beauty salon. 

She will use the anticipated profit to expand the volume of the business. She has a dream of running a big business and building a home for her family.

loans.use: to purchase a hairdryer, new clothes, shoes and curtains.

loans.name: Nazrbibi

texts.ru: Назрбиби замужняя женщина. Ей 53 года. У нее двое взрослых дочерей. Старшая дочь обзаведена семьей и живет отдельно. Назрбиби имеет среднее образование. Она по характеру добрая и ответственная женщина. Назрбиби умеет вышивать национальные женские платья и намерена открыть свое дело в этой сфере. Чтобы реализовать свою цель Назрбиби обратилась за кредитом. Она просит кредит для приобретения компьютерной швейной машинки. Назрбиби планирует в день вышивать одно простое платье и одно платье с вышивкой. Она очень надеется на вашу поддержку.
texts.en:
Nazrbibi is 53 years old, married, and the mother of two adult daughters.  Her oldest daughter already has her own family and lives independently.  

Nazrbibi has a high school education.  By nature, she is a kind and responsible woman.  She knows how to make women's traditional Tajik dresses and she would like to start her own sewing business.  In order to reach this goal, she has requested a loan.  She will use her loan to buy an electronic sewing machine.  She plans to sew one simple dress and one embroidered dress per day.

Nazrbibi is looking forward to your support.

loans.use: to buy an electronic sewing machine.

loans.name: Emprendedoras Valientes Group

texts.es: El Banco de Emprendimiento EMPRENDEDORAS VALIENTES  está compuesto por ocho integrantes de los cuales seis  son mujeres y dos varones que se dedican a distintas actividades, la presidenta del banco es la Sra. Verónica tiene 34 años y es soltera con 2 hijos que tiene la edades de 17 y 7 años, ella se dedica a la venta  de pollos en su puesto de venta se encuentran en uno de los mercados de la localidad de El Torno. Este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución la Sra. Verónica va a usar este préstamo para la compra de un Frízer que le hace falta para conservar la carne de pollo,  su razón para solicitar este préstamo es la falta de capital para la compra frizer, la Sra. Verónica enfrenta retos en su negocio que son crecer en clientela y va a utilizar los beneficios mejorar  la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Emprendedoras Valientes Communal Bank is made up of eight members, six women and two men who work in various jobs.

The president of the bank is Verónica, 34.  She's single and has two children, ages 17 and 7.  She makes a living selling chicken in her sales stall in one of the markets in the town of El Torno.

This is Verónica's first loan sequence with the institution.  She's going to use this loan to buy a freezer she needs to store her chicken.  Her reason for requesting this loan is she lacks the capital to buy the freezer.

In her business Verónica faces the challenge of expanding her clientele.  She's going to use the profits to improve her family's quality of life.

loans.use: to buy a freezer

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en: Erlinda is 56 years old and married with four children. She lives in Tukuran, Zamboanga Del Sur. She owns and operates a fish vending business to earn a living. She has been in this business for over eight years and earns 4,000 PHP every month. She has been with GDMPC since 2008, and now she has requested a loan of 6,000 PHP to purchase fishing materials.
