She is very grateful to Kiva investors because, thanks to such loans, she has maintained her business for all these years, allowing her to educate her only daughter for a profession.

loans.use: purchase rice, sugar, beans, sweets and soap to sell.

loans.name: Maichata

texts.fr:
Née en AOUT 1974 à SANZANA, MAICHATA vit avec ses 2enfants et son époux dans une  famille monogame dans le quartier  BINKO de la ville de SELINGUE. 
Enseignante de profession, MAICHATA  intéresse également aux activités génératrices de revenus notamment, à la fabrication vente de jus gingembre et du lait.  Après avoir correctement remboursé les prêts précédents, MAICHATA est à son troisième  prêt avec Soro Yiriwaso qui sera utilisé pour acheter,  150 kilos  de gingembre  et  5  sacs de sucre auprès des  grossistes. Elle effectue ses ventes au comptant, en détail, à domicile, dans le marché DALABALA à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
MAICHATA espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 70.000FCFA qui sera utilisé pour   aider son mari à subvenir aux besoins de la famille, rembourser le prêt et réinvestir dans les activités.
texts.en:
Maichata was born in Sanzana in August 1974 and lives with her two children and husband in a monogamous family in the Binko district of the town of Selingue. She is a teacher by trade but also has an interest in income-generating activities, notably the sale of ginger juice and milk. Having repaid her previous loans in full, Maichata is on her third loan with Soro Yiriwaso, which will be used to buy 150 kilos of ginger and five sacks of sugar from wholesalers. She sells for cash, on a retail basis, from home and in the market at Dalabala to a customer base made up of men and women.

Maichata hopes to make a monthly profit of 70,000FCFA, which will be used to help her husband provide for the family's needs, repay her loan and reinvest in her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for making juice.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy groceries in a larger quantity, for her son's grocery-selling business

loans.name: Mande

texts.en:
Mande has a retail shop at Kawempe Ttula. He also deals in coffee. He started the retail shop to create employment for his wife, and also to diversify the sources of income for the family.

He is applying for 1,500,000 UGX. He will use the loan to restock the retail shop by buying the items that are out of stock, like rice, sugar and cooking oil. He will use the profits generated from the loan to pay back the loan installments. He hopes the loan will help him expand his shop, and he wants to turn it into a big supermarket in future.

loans.use: to buy items for the shop's inventory, like rice, sugar and cooking oil

loans.name: Mgele

texts.en: Mgele is a single man who lives in a rental house that has neither electricity nor piped-in water. His greatest monthly expenses are food and rent. For over one year, he has operated a barber shop, with neighbors and passersby as potential customers. His major challenge is seasonality in his business. He is requesting a loan for Kshs 30,000 to buy a shaving machine. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his small company.

loans.use: to buy a shaving machine for his business.

loans.name: Jorge Egas

texts.es:
El cliente JORGE vive en playas. El tiene la profesión de cerrajero hace 22 años atras. En la actualidad tiene su negocio en el centro de playas donde hay mucha recurrencia de turistas, trabaja de lunes a sábado de 9h00 a 17h00.

No tiene ninguna dificultad, es casado la esposa está en la casa tiene 2 hijos pequeños aun no van a la escuela.

El tiene muchas aspiraciones con su negocio ya que le ayuda a sustentar los agstos de su familia. El tiene pensado realizar otros proyectos para mejorar sus ingresos por eso quiere comenzar con el negocio de la pesca. Con el préstamo va a comprar maquinas para pescar ya que donde el vive hay mucha afluencia de pescadores. Su sueño es mejorar su negocio
texts.en:
Jorge lives in Playas.  He’s been a locksmith for the last 22 years.  His business is located in downtown Playas where there are many tourists.  He works Monday to Saturday from 9am until 5pm.  He has no difficulty. He’s married and his wife stays at home; they have two small children who don’t attend school yet.

He has many hopes for his business because it helps him support his family.  He’s thinking about starting some other projects to improve his income which is why he wants to start a fishing business.  He will use the loan to buy fishing equipment because fishing is a very popular activity where he lives.  His dream is to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy fishing equipment.

loans.name: Bendera

texts.en:
Bendera, 25 years old, is a married woman, with six children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past five years, Bendera has operated a local brew-selling business. She sells at the market to her neighbors and passersby. Her major challenge in the business is the high cost of transportation.

With the loan of KES 20,000 that she is requesting, she wants to purchase more local brew for resale. She decided to join Yehu Microfinance Trust to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase more local brew for resale.

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David is a Kiva borrower. He has nine children, with ages ranging from 3 years to 23 years. He describes himself as being focused. 

David operates a farm where he grows potatoes, wheat, and cabbages for sale. His business is located in an area with high production and his primary customers are locals. 

He will use the KES 20,000 loan to to buy farm inputs to grow cabbages, potatoes, wheat, and other crops. This is his first loan with SMEP Deposit Taking Microfinance Limited (SMEP DTM). He will use the profits to buy a cow.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs to grow cabbages, potatoes, wheat, and other crops.

loans.name: Mwavadu

texts.en:
Mwavadu, aged 35 years, is a married man with three children, all of whom attend school. They live at a rental house that has neither electricity nor piped water. 

For years, he has operated a food stall business, selling from home to his neighbors and passersby. He faces a major challenge of seasonality in his place of operation. Mwavadu dreams of establishing a hotel and hiring one employee in the future. 

With the KES 10,000 loan, he wants to purchase three bundles of wheat flour, cooking fat and charcoal. He decided to join Yehu to access loans, to boost his business.

loans.use: to purchase three bundles of wheat flour, cooking fat and charcoal.

loans.name: Carlos Guillermo

texts.es: Don Carlos de 39 años de edad vive con su esposa y sus dos hijas en casa propia, el se dedica a vender huevos de forma ambulante en las diferentes colonias que estan cerca de su lugar de residencia desde hace 2 años, con las ganancias que obtiene de sus ventas logar solventar los gastos de su hogar, tiene mucha clientela pues su producto es muy vendible y lo da aun precio muy accesible, el quiere acrecentar su negocio comprando huevos al por mayor por eso solicita un credito que le permita comprar lo antes mencionado y asi obtener mejores ganancias y poderle dar a su familia una mejor estabiliadad economica.
texts.en: Don Carlos is 39 years old and lives with his wife and two children in his own home.  He has worked selling eggs door-to-door around the different neighborhoods which are close to his own home for the past two years.  With his profits from his sales, he is able to cover the household expenses.  He has a large clientele because his product is very widely desired and he sells at a good price.  He wants to expand his business by buying his eggs in bulk.  therefore, he is asking for a loan which would permit him to buy the aforementioned product and thereby receive a better income to give his family more economic stability.

loans.use: to buy eggs in bulk.

loans.name: Thu

texts.en:
Thu was born in 1982. She is a single mom. She has two children who are learning at primary school and kindergarten. She sells frozen seafood to earn a living. Thu’s income is about 3,500,000 VND. She has done this work for one year. Her family’s total earnings are about 3,500,000 VND per month.
 
She has participated in SEDA's credit program since 2012. In the last loan cycle she borrowed 5,152,000 VND, and she repaid the loan on time. In this loan cycle, she would like to borrow 6,496,000 VND, in order to supply more frozen seafood. She always wants to raise her children up well and have more money for business.

loans.use: to supply more frozen seafood.

loans.name: Francis

texts.en:
Francis is 50 years old and married to Rose. They have ten children. He is from Naivasha and has been in the farming business for the past 23 years.

He has applied for his second loan from KADET LTD, which he will use to buy fertilizer and seeds for his farm. He paid his previous loan on time. He hopes to be among the top farmers in Naivasha, in the near future.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and seedlings.

loans.name: Yvonne

texts.en: Yvonne is 49 years old and lives in the Gatsibo District of the Eastern Province of Rwanda. She is seeking a loan for RWF 60,000 ($100) to buy 20 rechargeable LED lights, which she will resell to people in her village who don't have electricity. Every week or so, these customers will return to her to have their lights recharged for just RWF 100.  She is also a farmer and will reinvest the money she makes in expanding her other business to earn more money for herself and her husband.

loans.use: to buy 20 low-cost LED lights to resell to rural households which lack electricity.

loans.name: Jinson Alberto

texts.es:
El cliente Jinson vive en playas. Comenzó hace 15 años con la venta de un solar en progreso. Le ayudo el dinero del solar y por eso decidió establecer su propio negocio de ventas de carnes, chuzos, choclos asados. En la actualidad  posee una carreta con la cual vende chuzos (carnes en palitos), choclos asados poco a poco creció y ahora posee una buena clientela. 

Trabaja en su negocio desde las 18h30 hasta las 24h30. No tiene dificultad. Si es casada su esposo trabaja en el comercio de corviches fuera de su casa. Tiene 3 hijos pero ya mayores de edad y viven independientes.

Con el préstamo quiere comprar embutidos, carnes, bebidas. Su sueño es poder comprar cemento arena y piedra para poder terminar de construir su casa.
texts.en:
Jinson lives in Playas.  Fifteen years ago he started out by selling a plot of land that was in development.  The money from the lot helped him and he decided to start his own business selling grilled meats, kebabs and corn on the cob.  He currently owns a cart he uses to sell ‘chuzos’ (skewered meat) and grilled corn on the cob and he’s gradually grown; today he has a good clientele.

He works at his business from 6:30pm until 12:30 at night.  He has no difficulties.  He’s married and his wife works selling ‘corviches’ [deep-fried, filled plantain balls] outside their house.  He has three children but they are all adults now living independently.

He wants to use the loan to buy cured meats, meats and beverages.  His dream is to be able to buy cement, sand and stone to finish building his house.

loans.use: to buy cured meats, meats and beverages.

loans.name: Dulce María

texts.es:
La señora Dulce María vive en la ciudad de Managua Nicaragua, es una persona trabajadora que lucha por el bienestar y el futuro de su familia, es casada y labora en una empresa del estado desde hace diecisiete años desempeñándose como jefe de sección.
  
Esta solicitando un crédito a CEPRODEL para  gasto  de  universidad para su hija, la razón de este crédito es para realizar trámite de viaje, ya que su hija realiza deporte de la universidad.

Con este  financiamiento que Kiva-Ceprodel le  brindaría es para apoyar a su hija en su carrera profesional, agradece de antemano la ayuda que le puedan brindar.
texts.en:
Dulce María lives in the city of Managua, Nicaragua.  She is a hard-working person who fights for the future and well-being of her family.  She is married and has been working in a state-run enterprise as a section head for the past 17 years.

She is applying for a loan from CEPRODEL for university expenses for her daughter.  The reason for this loan is to pay for travel expenses, since her daughter participates in college sports.  The financing that Kiva-CEPRODEL would provide is to support her daughter in her professional degree.  She appreciates in advance the help that you are able to provide her.

loans.use: to pay for university expenses.

loans.name: Mariam

texts.fr:
Née vers 1963 à BAMAKO, MARIAM vit avec ses 6 enfants et son époux dans une  famille monogame dans le quartier KANGARE de la ville de SELINGUE. 
Infirmière de profession,  MARIAM mène également des activités génératrices de revenus notamment l’achat vente d’habits, de gingembre, d’encens et de savons. Après avoir correctement remboursé les prêts précédents, MARIAM est à son cinquième  prêt avec Soro Yiriwaso qui sera utilisé pour acheter,  8 sacs  de gingembre,  5 douzaines d’habillements, 3 cartons de savons, auprès des  grossistes. Elle effectue ses ventes au comptant, à crédit et en détail, à domicile, dans le marché DALABALA à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
MARIAM espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 75.000FCFA qui sera utilisé pour   aider son mari à subvenir aux besoins de la famille, rembourser le prêt et réinvestir dans les activités.
texts.en:
Mariam was born around 1963 in Bamako and lives with her six children and husband in a monogamous family in the Kangare district of the town of Selingue. She is a nurse by trade and also has several income-generating activities, notably the purchase and sale of clothing, ginger, incense and soaps. Having repaid in full her previous loans, Mariam is now on her fifth loan with Soro Yiriwaso, which will be used to buy eight sacks of ginger, five dozen sets of clothing, three cartons of soap, all from wholesalers. She sells for cash and on credit, on a retail basis, from home and in the market at Dalabala to a customer base made up of men and women. 

Mariam hopes to make a monthly profit of 75,000FCFA which will be used to help her husband provide for the family's needs, repay her loan and reinvest in her activities.

loans.use: to buy various items.

loans.name: Abdul

texts.en: Abdul is a 39-year-old male who works at a sugar company in the town of Magburaka in the northern province of Sierra Leone. While doing that, he has also been a farmer for the past 5 years. Abdul and his wife have three children, all of whom are in primary schools. The family’s livelihood depends on generating income through the efforts of both his wife and himself, and Abdul is requesting a loan for SLL 2,000,000 from Salone Microfinance Trust, a Kiva partner in Sierra Leone. Abdul will buy more agricultural seeds and hire workers. Abdul will be able to repay his loan through automatic payroll deductions, a service provided through SMT’s partnership with his employer, the sugar company.

loans.use: to buy seeds and hire workers.

loans.name: Maria  Victoria

texts.es: Fuimos a visitar a Maria y ella nos dijo “estoy muy agradecida con Kiva y con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo,  por la manera de asertiva de recibir a las personas de escasos recursos como  clientes de estas prestigiosas organizaciones.” Ella con su credikiva anterior hizo una buena inversión en insumos con los que aumentó su producción de artesanías y le fue muy bien. En la actualidad está aplicando a un nuevo credikiva pues tiene nuevos pedidos y una vez mas inyectará capital de trabajo para ganar un poco más y esto se lo debe a su credikiva.
texts.en:
We went to visit Maria and she told us, "I am very grateful to Kiva and to the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo for the assertive way in which they receive people with scarce resources as clients of these prestigious organizations."

With her previous Kiva loan, she made a good investment in supplies, with which she increased her production of handicrafts, and things went very well for her.  She is now applying for a new Kiva loan because she has new orders, and she will once again inject working capital to earn a little more.  She owes this to her Kiva loan.

loans.use: to buy yarn.

loans.name: Phanuel

texts.en:
Phanuel lives in the Kitale area of Kenya, which is an area with high poultry production and consumption. He has three children and has been a farmer for eight years.  His primary income sources are milk, eggs, crops, transportation services, and personal business.

He stated what is most enjoyable about farming:  'Feeding dairy cows and milking them.' His biggest business challenge is:  'Animal diseases and shortage of animal pasture during dry seasons.' Animals on the farm have been given the names of Maua and Lelmet.

Phanuel was asked why he chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan, to which he replied: 'Because Juhudi Kilimo finances farmers with assets.'  This client was also asked what was learned during Juhudi's required microfinance training session: 'They are short-term loans.'

His highest monthly expense is school fees. When asked how this loan will benefit his family, Phanuel replied:  'Milk from the cow will help me feed my family, and the milk that I will sell will help to educate my children.'

As part of Juhudi's loan appraisal process, each borrower's assets are evaluated. Phanuel owns the following: cow, poultry, motorcycle, but he does not own a pig, pump, bicycle, or automobile. Juhudi Kilimo also tries to measure any change in living standards based on this loan. This borrower has in the household:  mosquito net, but he does not have electricity, solar power, running water, sewing machine, TV, or DVD.

Note: To create this loan profile, Juhudi Kilimo used a mobile device to gather information in the field and send the data to a central online repository, thus reducing paper use, making the process more efficient, and keeping costs down.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow

loans.name: Kalo Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe   KALO  est constitué de 2 femmes  mariées ,1 veuve et 1 divorcée ayant une moyenne d’âge de 36 ans et 3 enfants. Elles vivent  dans des  familles traditionnelles élargies dans le quartier NIEBALA  de la ville de Bougouni. 
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, d’amitié et de commerce. Pour renforcer leur capacité financière afin de mieux faire leur commerce, elles adhérent à l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso avec laquelle elles sont à leur premier prêt. Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce de  divers produits de consommation tels les légumes à l’image  de BINTOU, qui est la femme assise dans la photo. Elle compte acheter avec son  prêt, 5 paniers  de concombre avec les jardiniers des villages voisins. Elle effectue ses ventes au marché  et à domicile, en détail au comptant et à crédit  à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 40.000FCFA qui sera  investi dans les activités et rembourser le prêt.
texts.en:
Kalo group is made up of four women. Two are married, one is widowed and the other is divorced. On average, they are 36 years old and have three children. They lived in traditional extended families in the Niebala neighbourhood of Bougouni. 

The members of the group know each other through being neighbours, friends and business associates. In the interest of increasing their capital and improving their businesses, they are members of the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution. This is their first loan. 

These women trade various food products such as vegetables, like Bintou, who is shown sitting down in the photo. With her loan, Bintou is going to buy five baskets of cucumbers from gardeners in neighbouring villages. She sells to individuals at the market and from home, both for cash and on credit. The majority of her customers are women. 

Bintou expects to make an average of 40,000 CFA francs per month, which will be re-invested in the business and used to repay the loan.

loans.use: to buy vegetables.

loans.name: Morris

texts.en:
Morris is a single man who lives at his own house, which has neither electricity nor piped water. His greatest monthly expense is food.

For the past two years, he has operated a retail shop business, selling from home to his neighbors and passersby. He faces a major challenge of seasonality in his business. Morris dreams of establishing a wholesale business in the future. With the loan that he is requesting of KES 30,000, he wants to purchase a stock of wheat flour, maize flour, and beans. He decided to join Yehu to access loans. to boost his business.

loans.use: to purchase a stock of wheat flour, maize flour, and beans

loans.name: Baya

texts.en:
Baya, age 29, is married and has been blessed with two children. He owns a house that has electricity but not piped water. He cites the cost of food and electricity bills as his major challenge.

Baya operates a utensils selling business, and he sells at the market to his neighbors and town dwellers. He faces a major challenge of lack of enough capital to expand his business.

With the requested 20,000 KES he wants to purchase household utensils, cups, and basins for resale. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: to purchase household utensils, cups, and basins for resale.

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice is married and has five children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past three years, she has owned a food stall business, in which neighbors and town-dwellers are her potential customers. She faces a major challenge of high costs of transportation to her business.

With the KES 15,000 loan, she wants to purchase stocks of goods, like sugar, rice, maize, wheat flour, and cooking fat. She dreams of expanding her business into a modern café.

loans.use: to purchase stock of goods like sugar, rice, maize, wheat flour, and cooking fat.

loans.name: Zénaba

texts.fr: Zénaba  est une jeune femme de 27ans. Elle a pour conjoint un menuisier et maman d’01 enfant de 07ans qui va à l’école. Pour prêter main forte à son mari dans les charges du foyer, elle revend des œufs et des produits d’alimentation générale de façon ambulante. Afin de mieux servir ses derniers, elle sollicite un second crédit à WAGES pour acheter des marchandises (œufs et produits alimentaires). Elle espère agrandir l’activité et assurer les besoins vitaux de la famille.
texts.en:
Zénaba is a young woman aged 27. Her husband is a carpenter and they have one child, who is seven years old and goes to school.

In order to help her husband with the household expenses, Zénaba works as a travelling vendor, selling eggs and general food products. In order to better serve her customers, she is requesting a second loan from WAGES to buy supplies (eggs and other food products). 

She hopes to expand her business and provide for her family’s needs.

loans.use: to buy eggs and other food products.

loans.name: Nazo

texts.en:
Nazo is a 33-year-old woman, who is living in Rawalpindi, Pakistan, with her husband and seven children. Her husband is a heart patient and she always worries about his health. For 15 years her husband has been running a wood shop, which is the only source of income for their family. He is an excellent carpenter and he has good skills to make quality furniture. 

Nazo has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan to help her husband in his business.  Her husband would purchase a wood cutting machine and some tools such as a hammer, nails and wooden sheets for his shop.  As they have no other source of income, with the help of this loan, her husband will be able to continue his business, and with the net profit he will open a new shop for his son. 

Nazo dreams for her children's bright future and prays for her husband's good health.

loans.use: to purchase carpentry tools.

loans.name: Odeth

texts.en: Odeth is a 42 year old woman from Gatsibo District in the Eastern Province of Rwanda. She is seeking a loan of RWF 60,000 to purchase 20 rechargeable LED lights, which she will resell to people without electricity in her village. Every week or so, these customers will return to her to have their lights recharged for just RWF 100.  She is also a farmer and will reinvest the money she makes into expanding her other business to earn more money for herself and her husband .

loans.use: to pay for 20 low-cost LED lights to resell to rural households without electricity.

loans.name: Marciane

texts.en: Marciane is a 49-year-old woman from Gatsibo District in the Eastern Province of Rwanda. She is seeking a loan of RWF 60,000 to purchase 20 rechargeable LED lights, which she will resell to people without electricity in her village. Every week or so, these customers will return to her to have their lights recharged for just RWF 100.  She is also a farmer and will reinvest the money she makes into expanding her other business to earn more money for herself and her husband .

loans.use: to pay for 20 low-cost LED lights to resell to rural households without electricity.

loans.name: Benkan Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe   BENKAN   est constitué de 6 femmes toutes mariées ayant une moyenne d’âge de 30 ans et.4 enfants. Elles vivent  dans des  familles traditionnelles élargies avec leurs maris, coépouses, frères et fils dans le quartier  MASSABLACOURA de la ville de Bougouni. 
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, d’amitié et de commerce. Pour renforcer leurs capacités financières afin de mieux faire leur commerce, elles ont adhéré à l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso avec laquelle elles sont à leur quatrième prêt. Les 3 précédents prêts ont été correctement remboursés. Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce de céréales à  l’image de ROKIA, qui est la première de la gauche vers la droite Elle compte acheter avec son  prêt, 900 kg de maïs avec les paysans. Elle effectue ses ventes au marché  et à domicile, en détail au comptant et à crédit  à une clientèle composée essentiellement de femmes. 
Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 30.000FCFA qui sera  investi dans les activités et rembourser le prêt.
texts.en:
The Benkan group is made up of six women, who are all married. On average they are 30 years old and have four children. They live in traditional extended families with their husbands, co-wives, brothers and sons in the Massablacoura neighbourhood of Bougouni. 

They know each other through being neighbours, friends and business associates. They joined the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution in order to increase their capital and improve their businesses, and this is their fourth loan. The three previous loans were all paid in full. 

These women are involved in trading cereals, like Rokia, who is pictured on the far left. With her loan, she will buy 900kg of maize from farmers. She sells to individuals at the market and from home, both for cash and on credit. Most of her customers are women. 

Rokia is expecting to make an average of 30,000 CFA francs per month, which will be re-invested in the business and used to repay the loan.

loans.use: to buy cereals.

loans.name: Lennox

texts.en:
Lennox is the owner of a store where he sells all kinds of agricultural products. He has worked in this business for more than ten years and so he already has a loyal customer base that always buys products from him. Lennox is a very hard-working and entrepreneurial person with great hopes of progressing and getting ahead.

He is requesting the loan to buy plants, vegetables and more supplies to stock his store and to be able to offer good quality products to his customers.

loans.use: to buy plants, vegetables and more supplies to stock his store.

loans.name: Mwanasha

texts.en: Mwanasha is a hardworking woman who supports her family by spending many hours at her business. She attributes much of her success to support from Yehu and Kiva. She is requesting a new loan, this time for Kshs 20,000, to expand her business and buy a variety of products which will attract many customers. She plans to use this loan to buy sugar, salt, maize flour, wheat flour and rice to sell to her customers.

loans.use: to buy sugar, salt, maize and wheat flour and rice to resell.

loans.name: Ayesha

texts.en:
Ayesha is 29 years old, young, energetic and hard-working. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan along with her husband and one son. Her husband is an auto mechanic by profession and his monthly income is not enough to meet the household expenses.
 
Ayesha wants to educate her son at a good school so that he can have a bright future. Currently she cannot send him to a good school due to the financial constraints so she is worried about his future. She has requested a loan from Kiva’s partner BRAC Pakistan. 

Ayesha is a very skilled woman and wants to open a beauty parlour in her house to generate an alternative source of income for her family. She would purchase cosmetic products like lipsticks, creams, facials scrubs, and make-up kits and would also purchase some chairs for her salon. She is very hopeful for this loan as she could start her business with it.  She would spend her profits on the education of her son and repay her installments.

loans.use: to open a beauty parlour business.

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
Mercy is married and a mother of two children, all of whom attend school. They live in their own house that neither has electricity nor piped water. 

For years, she has operated a retail shop business, selling from home to her neighbours and passers-by. She faces a major challenge in price fluctuation of products in her business. Mercy dreams of establishing a wholesale shop in the future. 

With the Kshs 40,000 loan Mercy wants to purchase three bundles of wheat flour, cooking fat and sugar. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase three bundles of wheat flour, cooking fat and sugar.

loans.name: Micheal

texts.en:
Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), a partner of Kiva in Sierra Leone, is very pleased to present to you Micheal, an employee at a sugar company in Magburaka. Through partnering with local companies, SMT is able to provide borrowers like Micheal with micro-loans that are repaid through payroll deduction.

Micheal is a 36-year-old man who is married and has five children. Two of his children attend primary school while the other three are not of school age yet. Micheal has been working at the sugar company for eight years. In addition to his work at the sugar company, Micheal is also a rice farmer. Micheal has requested a loan of SLL 2,500,000 in order to buy rice seeds to plant in his farm.

loans.use: to buy rice seeds to plant in his farm.

loans.name: Nadia

texts.en:
Nadia is a 28-year-old, hard-working housewife. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan with her husband. Her husband has been driving a taxi for eight years and this is the only source of income for her family. 

Right now there is a lot of repairing and tuning work required in the engine of the taxi because of which it’s almost impossible for him to get earnings from it. Nadia has requested a loan from Kiva’s partner BRAC Pakistan to meet the amount of repairing the engine of her husband's taxi so that he can drive it properly. With the profits her husband would buy one more taxi in future. 

Nadia desires to provide a quality education for her children and she prays for the good health of her family and for the growth of her husband's business.

She is very much thankful to BRAC Pakistan and Kiva.

loans.use: to meet the costs of taxi repairs.

loans.name: Rut Marina

texts.es:
Rut Marina es una joven de 35 años, soltera, originaria del municipio de El Sauce, estudió la carrera de magisterio porque toda su vida soñó con ser maestra y enseñar a leer y escribir a los niños de primaria.

Ejerce su profesión en una escuela de la comarca La Palma a 10 km del municipio donde todos los días viaja en bicicleta para estar puntual en su centro de trabajo.

 A pesar de este sacrificio que hace todos los días para llegar a la escuela debajo de sol y a veces lluvias ejerce su profesión con esmero y entusiasmo.

En este momento tiene la necesidad de un crédito por tal motivo se presentó a Ceprodel con el objetivo de solicitarlo para pagar los módulos de un curso universitario sobre psicología que le ayudará en un futuro en su trabajo.

Espera que Kiva apruebe su solicitud para poder cumplir su objetivo donde le agradecerá este apoyo incondicional sobre todo a las personas de bajo recursos.
texts.en:
Rut Marina is a 35-year old youth, single, and hailing from the municipality of El Sauce.  She studied for a degree in education, because her whole life she dreamed about being a teacher and teaching primary school children to read and write.

She practices her profession in a school in the rural community of La Palma, 10 km from the municipality.  Everyday she travels on bicycle in order to be on time to work.  In spite of this sacrifice that she makes everyday in order to arrive at school in the sun and sometimes in the rain, she performs her work with care and enthusiasm.

At this time, she needs a loan for the reason she gave Ceprodel -- to pay for the modules for a university course on psychology that would help her in her work in the future.  She hopes that Kiva approves her application so that she can meet her goal, and she will be grateful for this unconditional support, above all for people with few resources.

loans.use: to pay for modules for a university course.

loans.name: Malek

texts.en:
Malek is married with three children. At 27, he is considered a youth client. He is his family’s only provider.

Malek is a mechanic and owns a small garage. He has been in this field since 2003. He gained much experience through practising his trade as an employee at a similar garage. He now has his own business and his own employee and is gaining an excellent reputation in his neighborhood, thanks to his competitive prices and on-time delivery.

Malek is requesting a youth loan of $2,400 (US). He will use this loan to renovate his garage to attract more customers. He believes the loan will improve his living standards, change his current financial conditions and give him the ability to grant his children a bright future.

loans.use: to renovate his garage

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy clothing for her clothes selling business.

loans.name: Zarqa

texts.en: Zarqa is a 49-year-old housewife. She lives with her husband and four children in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Since 2006, her husband has been running a general store, and he works very hard to meet his family's needs. He needs additional capital for the growth of his business, as the demand of his customers are increasing day by day. Therefore his wife, Zarqa, has requested a loan from Kiva's partner, BRAC Pakistan, for her husband's store. He will purchase a variety of products, including flour, milk packs, eggs, pulses, detergents and oils, to keep up with the increased demand of customers. Zarqa and her husband are very hopeful that the loan will be lucky and a productive one for their family.

loans.use: To purchase goods for a general store

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
Ahmad is a youth client from Iraq. He is 24 years old and lives with his family, which is comprised of 10 members. Five family members assist each other in providing the family living.

Ahmad owns a small shop, where he sells tools and supplies. He has been in this field since 2007 and has been gradually growing, as he gains experience and fame in his neighborhood. Ahmad is requesting a youth loan of 3,000 USD. He will use it to renovate his shop and to install an external ceiling. He is aiming to grow his business, so that he may provide himself a better living standard.

loans.use: to renovate his shop and to install an external ceiling

loans.name: Eya

texts.fr: Eya est une jeune femme de 35ans. Mariée à un soudeur, ils ont 01 enfant de 02ans en charge. Pour aider son conjoint dans les charges du foyer, elle revend des produits d’alimentation générale à domicile. Elle a une  ancienneté de 13ans, et dispose des clients de part et d’autres de la ville de Lomé. N’arrivant plus à les satisfaire, à cause de manque de marchandises, elle fait son premier crédit à WAGES pour acheter des marchandises. Comme perspectives d’avenir, elle espère acheter des produits d’alimentation générale et assurer aux besoins vitaux de la famille.
texts.en:
Eya is a young woman aged 35. She is married to a welder and they have one child, who is two years old. 

In order to help her husband with their household expenses, Eya sells general food products from home. She has been doing this for 13 years, and has customers from both sides of Lomé. As she can no longer meet customer demand due to a lack of supplies, she is requesting her first loan from WAGES in order to buy goods. 

In the future, she hopes to be able to buy general food products and meet the needs of her family.

loans.use: to buy general food products.

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice is a married woman; she owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

Alice has operated a firewood selling business, selling from home to her neighbours and passers-by. She faces a stiff competition from other charcoal operators in her business.
 
With the Kshs 25,000 loan she wants to purchase sacks of firewood for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of firewood for resale.

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en: Patrick is a 44-year-old, married man, who has five children. He describes himself as a trustworthy and credible father. He is applying for a loan of KES 100,000, which he will use to purchase buckets, blankets, and water tanks for his business. This will help him to increase the stock at his store. The intended profits will be used to improve his family's welfare. This is his third loan through SMEP DTM. His previous loans were repaid successfully.

loans.use: To purchase buckets, blankets, and water tanks for his business

loans.name: Moyesso

texts.fr: Moyosso est une femme de 36ans. Elle est mariée à un revendeur et mère de famille. En 2005, Moyosso a démarré l’activité de la vente de miel et du mais. Elle le vend à la maison et les distribue aux clients en cas de besoin. Elle est à son troisième crédit de WAGES et sollicite ce prêt pour acheter du miel et du maïs. Elle veut épargner les profits, agrandir l’activité et assurer les besoins vitaux de la famille.
texts.en:
Moyesso is 36 years old and married to a trader. She has children.

In 2005, Moyesso began a business selling honey and maize. She sells it from home and delivers to customers if necessary. 

This is Moyesso's third loan from WAGES and she will use it to buy honey and maize. She hopes to save money, expand her business and provide for her family’s needs.

loans.use: to buy honey and maize.

loans.name: Risper

texts.en: Risper is 37 years old, married and the mother of six children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped-in water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for her family. For more than one year, she has operated a firewood-selling business, which she operates out of her home. Most of her customers are neighbors and passersby. Her main challenge is the high cost of transportation in area. She plans to use this new loan, for Kshs 15,000, to buy additional bundles of firewood to sell. She joined Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to buy bundles of firewood to resell.

loans.name: Mohamed M.

texts.en:
Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), a partner of Kiva in Sierra Leone, is very pleased to present to you Mohamed, a 30-year-old resourceful husband and father working hard to provide for his family.

Mohamed has been working at a local sugar company for the past 9 years. At the same time, Mohamed invests in agriculture and grows rice. He is requesting a loan of 2,500,000 SSL from SMT to pay laborers to prepare his land for planting. With the approaching rainy season, now is the perfect time to plow the land and prepare the planting fields. Not only is Mohamed creating jobs in his local community, but he is also continuing to strive for a better life for his wife and 5 children.

Through partnering with local companies, SMT is able to provide borrowers like Mohamed with microloans that are repaid through payroll deduction.

loans.use: to pay laborers to prepare his land for planting.

loans.name: Lawrence

texts.en: Lawrence is a 31-year-old, married man with a child. He describes himself as an honest father and is keen on providing an improved living standard for his family. He is applying for a loan of KES 100,000 that will be used to purchase a car for his taxi business. The anticipated profits made from the business will be used to purchase another taxi. Challenges he faces include inflation of gas price . This is his third successive loan through SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to purchase a car for his taxi business.

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is a single mother with two children, who attend school. 

Her major monthly expenses include rent. She rents a house with access to both electricity and piped water. She is not looking after additional family members.

She has been operating a retail stationery shop for five years, working six days a week. She has no additional source of income. Her challenges include seasonality and defaulters.

Alice has requested a loan of 400,000 Ugandan shillings from Micro Credit for Development and Transformation SACCO. This loan will enable her to stock more reams of paper for sale. 

Her dream is to expand her business to a big stationery shop and to employ people in different outlets. She joined MCDT because of the convenience in transacting.

loans.use: To buy more reams of paper to sell

loans.name: Venantie

texts.en: Venantie is a 36-year-old woman from Gatsibo District in the Eastern Province of Rwanda. She is seeking a loan of RWF 60,000 ($100) to purchase 20 rechargeable LED lights, which she will resell to people without electricity in her village. Every week or so, these customers will return to her to have their lights recharged for just RWF 100. She is also a farmer and will reinvest the money she makes into expanding her other business to earn more money for herself and her husband.

loans.use: to pay for 20 low-cost LED lights to resell to rural households without electricity.

loans.name: Tahsin

texts.en:
Tahsin is a married youth client from Iraq. He is 29 years old and has two children. Tahsin lives with his family, consisting of eight members, two of whom assist Tahsin in providing the family's living.

Tahsin is a barber. He has gained his long experience in this field by previously working at a barber shop as an employee. After gaining sufficient experience, Tahsin established his own business in 2008 and he has been gaining good fame, thanks to his clean work and the unique respect and behavior that he shows to his customers.

Tahsin is requesting a youth loan of USD 3,000. He will use this loan to renovate his shop and to buy a motor generator. Tahsin aims to grow his business and increase his profits, so that he will be able to provide better living conditions for his children.

loans.use: to renovate his shop and to buy a motor generator.

loans.name: Nazakat

texts.en:
Nazakat, 29, is a hardworking, diligent woman. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. 

Her husband has run a barber shop for 15 years. Due to an increase in customers, he wants to expand his business. For that purpose, Nazakat has requested a loan of 20,000 Pakistani rupee from Kiva's partner, BRAC Pakistan. 

With this loan, Nazakat’s husband would purchase new chairs for his shop. The investment would increase his earnings and net income. 

Nazakat is very grateful to Kiva and BRAC.

loans.use: to purchase additional chairs for her husband's barber shop

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy is a 54 year-old widow with two children. She has operated her farming business for the past 20 years. 

She is applying for a loan of 20,000 Kenyan shillings to purchase seeds to grow carrots and cabbages. She describes the climate in her area as favourable for farming and she anticipates boosting her production with her profits from the business. 

This is Lucy's first loan with SMEP-Deposit Taking Microfinance Limited.

loans.use: To purchase seeds to grow carrots and cabbages.

loans.name: Irene

texts.en: Irene is a 54-year-old mother. She is applying for a KES 20,000 loan, which she will use to purchase cabbage and tomato seeds for planting. She describes the area as a favorable climate for plantation. Challenges she faces include inadequate land and finances to cultivate a large area of land. Profits from the business will be used to purchase a dairy cow. This is her 1st loan through SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to purchase cabbage and tomato seeds for planting.

loans.name: Gregoria

texts.es:
La socia se sigue dedicando al negocio de venta d ejugos,la socia vende jugos de papaya,naranja,paltano entre otras frutas,la socia vende sus jugos en el mercado,la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m,la ya tiene 7 años en este negocio y le va muy bien,el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de venta de jugos.La socia solicita el credito para comprar frutas para los jugos como manzanas,naranjas,platanos y uvas.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
This member is continuing with her business selling juices.  She sells papaya, orange, banana and other juices.  She makes her sales in the local market.  The member works from 8:00a.m. until 6:00p.m.  She has had her business for seven years, and it has been going very well for her.  The member's dream is to expand her juice business.  She is requesting the loan to purchase fruits for her juices, like apples, oranges, bananas and grapes. 

The member is happy about the loan and promises to comply with her repayment plan.

loans.use: with the purchase of fruit for her juices, like apples, oranges, bananas and grapes.

loans.name: Alawiya

texts.en:
Alawiya, 51, is married with one child. Seventeen years ago, she started working in cleaning services at a school to help her husband make a living and cover their family's expenses. She works as hard as she can to support her family, especially since she and her husband work in very low-income businesses. 

Alawiya has applied for a loan of $1,500 (US) from Kiva's partner, Al Majmoua, to make necessary maintenances to her house to maintain it as a healthy place to live. 

She hopes to have a peaceful future and wishes to reach a time when she can rest and stop working in the cleaning business.

loans.use: To make necessary maintenances to her house

loans.name: Saiqa

texts.en:
Saiqa is a 32-year-old hardworking and diligent women. She is living in Rawalpindi Pakistan with her husband and 5 sons. Her husband and all of her sons are running a car decoration and accessories shop. This is the only source of income for her family. Currently they are facing many problems in the business, as the current stock of car accessories is almost depleted and they have no funds available to purchase more stock. Saiqa has requested a loan from Kiva’s partner BRAC Pakistan so that her husband can continue his business and purchase more variety of car accessories and decoration kits like car chargers, fog lights, seat covers, neon lights etc. With the profit amount she is going to make arrangements for the marriage of her son and for the expansion of their business.

She is very hopeful that the loan will be a productive one for them, and she is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan for their help.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of car accessories to sell.

loans.name: Kadzo

texts.en:
Kadzo, age 43, is a married woman and lives with her husband in their own house, which has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. 

Kadzo has operated a firewood and charcoal selling business for the past two years. She sells from home to her neighbors and passersby. In addition, she also farms, which earns her another source of livelihood. She mentioned high cost of transportation in her business as a challenge.

With the 30,000 KES she wants to purchase more stock of firewood and charcoal for resale. She dreams of expanding her business to earn more income in the future.

loans.use: to purchase stock of firewood and charcoal for resale.

loans.name: Susana

texts.en:
Susana is 44 years old, married, and a mother of four children. For the last four years, she has earned a living by operating a poultry business in Malindi. She earns a monthly profit of KES 6,500. 

Susana was introduced to Kenya Agency for Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) by our credit officer and she is applying for her third loan of KES 40,000 to buy poultry feed, together with medicine for poultry. She will use the profits made possible by this loan to pay school fees for her children as well as to expand her farming activities. 


Susana's goal for the future is to venture into mixed farming, with a view of increasing her income, so as to help improve her family's living standards.

loans.use: to purchase poultry feed and poultry medicine.

loans.name: Aba

texts.en: Although she has received no formal education, Aba is an entrepreneur. She specializes in selling used clothing in Domenase (near Cape Coast). She has been involved in this enterprise for 15 years. Aba is married and has 5 children. Her husband works as a mason. The proceeds from her business normally go towards helping her husband cover the family’s general expenses and paying their children’s school fees. Aba wants to use her loan to increase her current inventory levels. This will allow her to sell greater quantities of used clothing. In the long term, Aba plans to reinvest future profits into her business, thus helping her expand and meet the needs of rising customer demands.

loans.use: to increase her current inventory levels

loans.name: Hilda María

texts.es:
La señora Hilda maría vive en la cuidad de Managua trabaja   como asistente en un recinto universitario.
Doña Hilda está solicitando un crédito a kiva para gastos médico  y compra de medicamento.

espera que le pueden apoyar porque sin la ayuda de este crédito no podría mejorar su salud.
texts.en:
Hilda María lives in the city of Managua and works as an assistant on a university campus.

Hilda is applying for a Kiva loan to cover medical costs and to buy medication.

She hopes you can support her as, without the help of a loan, her health will not improve.

loans.use: to pay medical expenses.

loans.name: Minerva Rosa

texts.es: Minerva está muy agradecida con Kiva y la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo y espera seguir creciendo de sus manos. Ella con su anterior credikiva mejoró sus condiciones habitacionales y trabaja hoy mucho mas cómoda. En la actualidad teniendo un espacio apropiado necesita adquirir una máquina fileteadora que le agilizará el proceso productivo y podrá comprometerse  aun mas con los pedidos que hace su clientela y también podrá ofrecer trabajo a otros que lo necesitan y esto es justamente la razón de éxito de su inversión
texts.en: Minerva is very grateful to Kiva and the Mario Santo Domingo foundation and hopes to continue growing.  With her previous Kiva loan, Minerva improved her living conditions and now works much more comfortably.  She currently has an appropriate working space but needs to buy an overlock sewing machine which will speed up her production process and allow her to take on more orders from customers.  She will also be able to offer work to others who need it and this is exactly why her investment has been successful.

loans.use: to buy an overlock sewing machine.

loans.name: Hussain

texts.en:
Hussain is a married Iraqi youth client, who is 28 years old and is a father of a single child. Hussain works hard to generate his family’s income by working in his garage, while his wife takes care of their child. In his garage, Hussain specializes in fixing electrical problems in all types of automobiles. He established his business in 2009 and has gained good experience in this field. Now Hussain has an employee hired, and thanks to his good service to his clients, he gained a good reputation and is well known in his neighborhood.

Hussain is requesting a youth loan of 2,100 USD. He will use this loan to install a rolling shutter and an external ceiling for his garage. Hussain aims to grow his business and increase his profits so that he will be able to provide his family better living standards.

loans.use: to install a rolling shutter and an external ceiling for his garage.

loans.name: Abbas

texts.en:
Abbas is a Lebanese engaged man; he’s 22 years old and is really attached to his parents and siblings. 

Working together, Abbas and his father were able to cover their heavy expenses in order to live a respectable life. Abbas started his business at an early age. He had to work really hard to prove that he’s a necessary support for his family. Abbas has been working in repairing the wheels of cars in his own garage, and has gained a fair number of customers asking for his services. 

Today, he’s asking for a youth loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l to buy new mechanic tools and machines for his business so he can respond rapidly to his clients’ problems. 

He believes that acting properly is really essential to attract more customers. 

In the future, he plans to sell cars spare parts as well.

loans.use: to buy new mechanic tools and machines for his business

loans.name: Claudia

texts.en:
Claudia and Daniel are good friends and have shared many personal experiences.  They also share a passion for style and cosmetics and each has 15 years of experience in the fashion industry.  

Their new business venture, Chic and Cheek Boutique, offers an array of clothing, accessories, makeup selections and an exclusive personal style and makeup service.  Employees at the boutique assist clients in choosing the perfect ensemble tailored to their needs and budget.  The boutique attracts a prestigious clientele, including many Laredo socialites. Chic and Cheek also offers free professional makeup application training to clients.  Whether you are wearing makeup for the first time or interested in learning the latest trend, Daniel can help.

Daniel has positioned himself as the preferred makeup artist in Laredo, thanks to his expertise and professionalism.  He is requested for many events, including the nationally recognized George Washington Birthday Celebration, held each winter in Laredo.     
 
Since the long-time friends discovered Accion Texas Inc., they have taken advantage of the organization’s varied education services to stay current in their business.  The Accion loan provided them with the capital they needed to boost inventory and to compete successfully in their diverse and affluent market.

loans.use: to purchase inventory

loans.name: Shameem

texts.en:
Shameem is a 41-year-old responsible and hardworking housewife. She is a mother of 8 children, and her husband is currently working as an auto mechanic. Shameem and her husband have been saving money for many years to purchase a van. Her husband wants to start his own transport business. 

For that purpose, Shameem has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan. They would purchase the van and be able to start their own business. This could solve many of their financial problems. Shameem is very much thankful to Kiva.

loans.use: to purchase a van to start a transportation business.

loans.name: Mai

texts.en: Mai is 23 years old and a single lady. She is the oldest sister for four siblings. Mai is a university student, majoring in Arabic language and literature. She had to go to a private university that costs more than the governmental ones. Now she is applying for an education loan, to pay her next semester's fees.

loans.use: To pay her next semester's fees

loans.name: Nasreen

texts.en:
Nasreen is 32 years old, a hardworking and diligent woman. She has three children, and her husband has been running a butcher shop for four years. He sells fresh meat, and his clients are very satisfied with his services which is increasing his customer base with the passage of time. 

He wants to renovate his butcher shop to attract more customers. He would build one more room in his shop to add more space, as the current space is too congested. Therefore, Nasreen has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan. 

As this business is the only source of income for her family, this loan is very important to them. Nasreen would spend the profit on the education of her children, and would make them good, responsible citizens of Pakistan.

loans.use: to expand the butcher shop

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth is 33 years old, married and the mother of five children. She operates a cafe in Malindi town and has been in the business for two years. She earns a monthly profit of KES.5,000. 

She was introduced to KADET LTD by a credit officer, and she is applying for her first loan of KES.10,000. Ruth intends to use the loan to add food stuff such as cooking flour, cooking oil, and cereals, and items such as plates, tea cups, and spoons. 

She will save the anticipated profit and help pay school fees for her children. 

In the future, Ruth hopes to grow her cafe with a goal of owning a well-set up hotel in the area.

loans.use: To purchase additional food stuff and items for her cafe business

loans.name: Betty

texts.en:
Betty lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is single with five children, three of whom attend school. She is also looking after her father. She has been selling second hand clothes at retail in a rented shop for eight years, working six days a week. She also earns additional income from a motorcycle she hires out.

She has requested a loan of UGX 1,000,000 from MCDT- SACCO to enable her to buy more bales of skirts, shirts, trousers, blouses and bed sheets for sale. Her challenge includes seasonality. Her dream is to have a big store with all kinds of garments. She joined MCDT because of the relatively low interest charged on loans. She stays in her house with access to both electricity and piped water. Her major monthly expenses include school fees.

loans.use: To buy more bales of used clothing

loans.name: Juana Vilma

texts.es:
La socia continua dedicandose al negocio de venta de comida,la socia lleva años en este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada dia a su negocio,la socia erlabora diferentes tipos de platos como estofados de pollo,saltado,sopas entre otros,la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.

La socia solicita el credito para la compra de insumos como aceite,carne,arroz enter otros.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Juana Vilma continues to make a living selling meals, having had this business for some years.  The work is going well thanks to her determination every day.  Juana makes different dishes such as chicken stews, stir fries, soups and more.  She hopes to be able to continue working so as to keep supporting her family.

Juana is applying for a loan in order to buy supplies such as oil, meat, rice and more.

Juana is happy with the loan and promises to make her repayments.

loans.use: to buy supplies such as oil, meat and rice.

loans.name: Arifa

texts.en: Arifa is a 52-year-old mother of three sons. Her husband works in the tailoring business, while she sells clothing items at home. She is applying for a loan to increase the quantity of clothes she has and to bring in more types of clothing items like casual clothing and evening dresses.

loans.use: to buy more types of clothing items like casual clothing and evening dresses.

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam is 40 years old, married, and a mother of seven children. For the past 11 years, she has earned a living by selling fruits and vegetables from her food kiosk in Malindi. She earns a monthly income of about KES 8,450 from the business. 

Mariam was introduced to KADET LTD by our credit officer. She is applying for her second loan, in the amount of KES 25,000. She will use it to buy additional stock to resell to her customers, including tomatoes, pineapples, oranges, and onions. She will use the profits made possible by this loan, to pay school fees for her children and to continue expanding the business. Her goal for the future is to continue growing the business, so that she may help uplift her family's financial stability.

loans.use: To purchase additional fruits and vegetables for her business

loans.name: Salam

texts.en: Salam is 19 years old and a single lady. She has six older brothers. Salam goes to the university, working toward her bachelor degree.  She is applying for an education loan, to enable her to pay her next semester's fees.

loans.use: to pay her next semester's fees

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with four children, and three of them attend school. She is not looking after any other members of the family. She has been operating a retail shop for five years, working six days a week. She also sells piped water for additional income.

She has requested a loan of 500,000 UGX from MCDT- SACCO to enable her to purchase sugar, cooking oil, flour, rice, dry beans, groundnuts, peas, and soda for resale. Her challenges include seasonality and transportation. Her dream is to be able to own a big wholesale shop. She joined MCDT because her friends told her about the timely loans. She lives in her husband`s house with access to both electricity and piped water. Her major monthly expenses include school fees.

loans.use: to buy more sugar, cooking oil, dry beans, ground nuts, peas, and soda for resale.

loans.name: Omar

texts.en:
Omar is a Lebanese, single man. He’s 19 years old. He lives with his working sibling. Cooperating together, Omar and his brother are capable of covering their heavy expenses in order to live a respectable life. 

Omar started his business at an early age, where he gained the needed experience to open his own garage. He’s a car blacksmith specialist and he has his loyal customers who visit him from all over the neighboring areas.  

Today, Omar is asking for a youth loan from kiva partner, Vitas. s.a.l., to buy the needed materials for his business, such as metal and many other items, in order to respond rapidly to his clients’ problems. 

Omar believes that acting properly is really essential to attracting more customers. In the future, he plans to expand his business and to employ people to work with him.

loans.use: to buy the needed materials for his business, such as metal and many other items.

loans.name: Fayzullo

texts.ru: Файзулло женатый молодой мужчина. Ему 24 года. Он является отцом одного ребёнка. Файзулло вместе с семьей проживает в районе Джиликуль на юге страны. Его жена работает в дехканском хозяйстве (это индивидуальное или коллективное частное хозяйство в котором выращивают сельхозкультуру). Файзулло имеет высшее педагогическое образование. Он в течение двух лет работал учителем в средней школе. В данный момент он занимается растениеводством. Файзулло уже год как выращивает рис и кукурузу. Одновременно он работает и таксистом. Файзулло запрашивает кредит для закупа минерального удобрения для урожая риса и кукурузы. На оставшуюся часть кредита он хочет отремонтировать свою автомашину.
texts.en: Fayzullo is a married young man of 24, and the father of one young child. He lives with his family the the Jilikul district in southern Tajikistan. His wife works on a "dekhan" farm (an individual or collectively-operated private agricultural farm). Fayzullo has extensive experience as a teacher, having worked as a middle school teacher for two years. Currently he is engaged in farming; for more than a year, he has been growing rice and corn. At the same time, he has has also been working as a taxi driver. Fayzullo is requesting a loan to buy mineral fertilizer for the rice and corn crops. He wants to use whatever is left over from the loan to repair his car.

loans.use: to buy mineral fertilizer for crops of rice and corn.

loans.name: Nuha

texts.en:
Nuha is a 35-year-old married woman. Her husband started working as a security man at a university after his retirement from the military service. They have four children to support. 

Nuha is an artistic woman who makes mosaic paintings at home and sells them in bazaars to bring in additional income for the family. She is applying for a loan to buy more stones and a new tool for making the mosaic stones in order to create more decoration pieces.

loans.use: to buy more stones and a new tool for making mosaic stones.

loans.name: Dominic

texts.en: Dominic is a farmer based in Rutooma, a village in Mbarara district. He grew up with his grandparents, who were pastoralists. Because of a love for cattle, he started cattle farming at a very young age, with cows that he got as gifts from relatives. This project has grown, due to the ever-increasing demand for milk and beef in neighboring institutions like schools, health centers, and shops.  However, his farm is not cleared, which puts his animals at risk of catching diseases from ticks. He has therefore decided to request a loan of 3,000,000 shillings (UGX), which he will use to clear his farm, so that his animals may not contract diseases from pests.

loans.use: To pay for labour to clear the bushes around his cattle farm

loans.name: Kisakye

texts.en:
Kisakye lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is single and has four children, and all of them attend school. She is also looking after two brothers. She stays in her house, with access to electricity but not piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include school fees.

She has been selling charcoal from home, at retail, for six years. She works six days a week. She does not have any additional source of income. She has requested a loan of UGX 400,000 from MCDT-SACCO. The loan would enable her to stock more charcoal to resell. Her challenges include seasonality and transportation. Her dream is to expand her business up to wholesale. She joined MCDT in order to get more capital for her business.

loans.use: To buy more bags of charcoal to resell.

loans.name: Norma Estanislada

texts.es:
Doña Norma es una señora de 65 años, casada, comerciante, madre de ocho hijos todos independientes, solamente tiene a cargo tres nietos de una de sus hijas que se fue a trabajar a España.

Es una señora trabajadora que a pesar de su edad le gusta ganarse la vida en su negocio de manera independiente.
Hace 15 años inició su negocio con capital obsequiado por su esposo cuando se trasladaron a vivir de una comarca al municipio de El Sauce. 

Este negocio consiste en la venta de medicina natural el cual es muy concurrido por los pobladores y sus visitantes ya que es el único que hay en el poblado.

Con el fin de surtir dicho negocio y satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes está solicitando un crédito en Ceprodel para comprar champoo, pomadas, jarabes, fibras, adelgazantes y vitaminas.

Confía en Dios que los inversionistas de Kiva le financiarán este préstamo para poder desarrollar su plan de inversión y así poder ir creciendo como pequeña empresaria.
texts.en:
Norma is 65 years old and married, a businesswoman who is also the mother of eight adult children. She is only financially responsible for three grandchildren since her daughter went to Spain to find work.
She is a hardworking woman, and despite her age she likes to earn money in her business and be independent. She started the business 15 years ago with money that her husband provided when they moved to the town of El Sauce.
She has a natural health store and is quite successful because hers is the only business of the kind in the community.
She would like to stock her business and meet her customers’ demands, so she is requesting a credit from Ceprodel to buy shampoo, hair-styling products, cough syrups, fiber and slimming products, and vitamins.
She trusts in God that Kiva’s investors will give her this loan to develop her business plan and continue to grow as a small business.

loans.use: to buy shampoo, hair-styling products, cough syrups, fiber and slimming products, and vitamins.

loans.name: Asmahan

texts.en: Asmahan is a 57-year-old mother for one daughter and one son. She is married to an accountant. Asmahan does clothing embroidery, for a living. She often gets fabric to make clothes, or people bring blank clothing items to have her put an embroidery art on it. She is applying for a loan to obtain new embroidery tools and more fabric.

loans.use: to buy new embroidery tools and more fabric.

loans.name: Maria Elena

texts.es:
La socia Maria Elena continua dedicandose al negocio de venta de productos de belleza como cremas, perfumes, colonias entre otros, a la vez la socia continua dedicandose al negocio de venta de sombrillas y banquitos,la socia lleva años con su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada dia a su negocio ,la socia desea pode seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
 La socia solicita el credito para comprar mercaderia como perfumes para damas.
La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en: María Elena sells beauty products such as moisturizing creams, perfumes, colognes, and so on. She also sells sun umbrellas and stools. She has had her business for several years, and it’s going very well thanks to the effort she puts into her work every day. She hopes to continue working in this business so she can support her family. She is requesting a loan in order to buy merchandise such as women’s perfumes. María Elena is very happy about this loan and is committed to paying it off in full.

loans.use: to buy merchandise such as women’s perfumes.

loans.name: Nelly Concepcion

texts.es: Doña nelly de 50 años de edad vive en casa propia con sus 4 hijos de 28, 25, 21 y 10 años de edad, los dos hijos mayores trabajan uno de agricultor y la otra de domestica en una casa que esta cerca de su residencia, ella se dedica a la venta de tortillas en su casa desde hace varios años trabaja de lunes a domingo, tiene mucha clientela pues es una persona muy trabajadora y amable, con las ganancias que obtiene y la ayuda de sus dos hijos logran solventar los gastos de us hogar. Doña Nelly solicta un credito para comprar maiz por quintales para seguir elaborando las tortillas y asi obtener mejores ganancias para tener una mejor estabilidad economica con su familia.
texts.en: Nelly is 50 years old. She lives in her own home with her four children, who are 28, 25, 21, and 10 years old. Her two eldest children are working, one as a farm laborer and the other in domestic service in a house near their home. Nelly has been selling tortillas from her home for several years. She works every day of the week. She has a lot of customers because of her hardworking and friendly nature. With her income and the help of her two children, they are able to cover their household expenses. Nelly is requesting a loan to buy corn in bulk so she can keep making tortillas and earn a better income to ensure her family’s economic stability.

loans.use: to buy corn to make tortillas.

loans.name: Nedaa

texts.en: Nedaa is a 32-year-old married woman. She is a mother of four children. Nedaa’s husband is a governmental employee who is trying hard to provide his children with everything they want. On the other hand, Nedaa is helping her husband by selling baby Pampers (diapers) and some cleaning products at home. Now, she is applying for a loan to bring in more types of home detergents to increase her profits.

loans.use: to buy more types of home detergents to sell

loans.name: Annah

texts.en:
Annah is a resident of Mbarara municipality, with five children, all of whom go to school. She got married to a man she loved, when she was 17 years old. But later, the man deserted the family and married another wife. Unfortunately, her family was left with no income-generating business and Annah started to struggle for her children. 

That is when Annah got to know about the institution (UGAFODE Microfinance Limited) and she acquired a loan of UGX 2,000,000, which helped her to start a small business in ladies clothes and second-hand bags. Because of her hard work, the business has developed and she has managed to support her family as well as pay school fees for the children. 

Annah is requesting a loan UGX 2,000,000 to purchase more materials; the balance will be used to clear school fees.

loans.use: to pay for school fees for her children and purchase cloth for her shop.

loans.name: Aba

texts.en: After graduating from middle school, Aba decided to set up her own ‘Banku’-selling business (Banku is a traditional Ghanaian dish made using fermented corn/cassava dough that is mixed proportionally and cooked in hot water into a smooth white consistent paste). She prepares her ‘Banku’ on her own and proceeds to sell it in Domenase (near Cape Coast). With over 16 years worth of experience, she is currently looking to expand her enterprise further. Unfortunately, she is limited due to a lack of funding. As a result, this loan will be used to help her purchase more maize and cassava, thus enabling her to prepare and sell more of her tasty ‘Banku’. She aims at using the profits from her business to help support her husband (who is a farmer) with the upkeep of their house while ensuring that their eight children are able to experience a better life.

loans.use: to purchase more maize and cassava to make banku to sell

loans.name: Bether

texts.en:
Bether, 52 years old, is from Homabay County. She is married to Abonyo who is a farmer. She has six children who are grown up.

She has a food kiosk within the town, which she has been operating for the last 10 years and makes a monthly income of KES. 20,000. She is taking her first loan from KADET LTD, which she will use to purchase plastic seats for her food kiosk. She will use the anticipated profit to grow the business.

Her dreams are to have a bright future and a stable family.

loans.use: To purchase more plastic seats for her food kiosk

loans.name: Maysaa

texts.en: Maysaa is a 24-year-old mother of two girls. Her husband works in a media company while she sells blankets and clothes from home. Maysaa is now applying for a youth loan to buy more bed covers for summer use and a new summer collection of clothes.

loans.use: to buy more bed covers for summer use and a new summer collection of clothes.

loans.name: Rawan

texts.en: Rawan is a 26-year-old conservative woman. She asked her brother to take her place in the photo.  Rawan is the oldest sister of two brothers. She has applied for this educational loan to help her brother pay for his semester fees.

loans.use: to pay for her brother's semester fees

loans.name: Efua

texts.en:
Due to difficult circumstances, Efua did not have access to any form of formal education, yet this has not stopped her from achieving her dream of becoming an entrepreneur. Currently, Efua sells watermelon in Domenase (near Cape Coast). She has been doing so for about three years. 

As a single mother with 3 children, Efua uses all her income to feed and provide for her family. Efua will use the loan to purchase an increased amount of watermelon, which will aid in improving her overall sales. Efua wants to use the future profits from her expanded business to ensure that all her children are able to receive an education.

loans.use: to purchase an increased amount of watermelon, which will aid in improving her overall sales.

loans.name: Zeinab

texts.en: This is Zeinab, a 44-year-old Lebanese woman. She’s married, living with her husband, and has three children attending school. She’s cooperating with her husband who works as a car painter and has many years of experience, in order to satisfy their family needs and pay their children's study fees. As for her, she started her own home business as a tailor. She’s stylish, fashionable and seeks to please her customers as much as she can. This is why she’s looking today to borrow a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l to purchase a wide variety of textiles and a new tailoring machine in order to improve her business and, therefore, increase her productivity. Zeinab has big responsibilities to care for and this is the perfect time to better develop her work and augment her earnings.  She’s planning to open her own tailoring shop soonest.

loans.use: to purchase a wide variety of textiles and a new tailoring machine

loans.name: Immaculate

texts.en: Immaculate lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with four children, three of whom attend school. She does not look after any additional family members. She has been operating a retail shop in a rented premise for the last five years, working seven days a week. She has applied for a loan of 500,000 UGX to enable her to purchase rice, flour, sugar, soap, cartons of salt and crates of soda for sale. She has no other source of income. She joined MCDT to expand her business by opening a second shop. Her main challenges include seasonality and transportation. She would like to have a big shop stocked with all the basic commodities and accumulate profits to buy land. She is renting a house with electricity but no piped water. Her monthly expenses include rent and school fees.

loans.use: To buy more sugar, rice, flour, cartons of salt and crates of soda to sell

loans.name: Vera Group

texts.en:
Randa is the featured borrower from Vera Group.  She got together with the other group members in order to apply for a loan from Kiva's partner Al Majmoua because they have always been neighbors and friends.

Randa is a 53-year-old married woman and the mother of four children.  She has been working as a hairdresser for 13 years to help her husband earn a living and increase their income.  She is applying for a loan from Kiva's partner Al Majmoua to complete necessary maintenance on her house in order to keep it in very good condition for customers and family members.  She is the one pictured in the middle.

Grace is pictured on the right.  She is a 37-year-old married woman and the mother of three children.  She has been working as a teacher for 13 years.  The applied for loan will be invested in doing necessary maintenance on her house in order to keep it a healthy living place after the hard winter season they faced.

Sanaa is a 51-year-old married woman and the mother of three children.  She has worked in handmade souvenirs and crocheted work for 30 years.  She is an expert in her domain and well known in her region.  The applied for loan will be invested in buying necessary household appliances for her house.
