loans.use: to conduct necessary maintenance on her house in order to keep it in a very good condition for customers and family members.

loans.name: Atta

texts.en:
After graduating from junior high school, Atta decided to set up her own grocery store in Domenase, which is near Cape Coast.  With one year of experience, she is currently looking to expand her enterprise further.  Unfortunately, she is limited due to a lack of funding.  As a result, this loan will be used to help her purchase more groceries for resale. 

She aims to use the profits from her business to help support her husband (who is a mobile phone operator) with the upkeep of their house and also to ensure that their two children experience a better life.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries for resale.

loans.name: Marry

texts.en:
This is a 29-year-old mother, married to Paul who is a a businessman; she has two children aged four and one year old.

She has a green grocery store which has been operating for the last two years and makes a monthly income of Kes 8,200. She is applying for her second loan with KADET LTD, which she will use to purchase more fruits and vegetables for resale. She will use the anticipated profit to grow the current business.

Her dream is to run a successful business and support her family.

loans.use: to purchase more fruits and vegetables for resale.

loans.name: Taghreed

texts.en: Taghreed is a 44-year-old mother of four. To help in supporting the family, Taghreed makes handmade accessories and sells clothes at home. She is applying for a loan to buy more beads and increase her inventory of women's clothing items.

loans.use: to purchase more beads for making accessories and increase her inventory of women's clothing items

loans.name: Parveen

texts.en:
Ms. Parveen is a 37-year-old married woman. She has been successfully running a small general store at the corner of her house. She has gained years of experience in this field. Her husband also assists her by purchasing stock of goods from the market and dealing with customers at the store. She is a mother of six children and is motivated to provide her family with good quality food, clothing and health.

 In order to make her store fully stocked, she wants to grow her business so she requested a loan of Rs. 35,000 to buy packs of salt, biscuits, oil, sugar and beverages to meet the demand of her customers time after time. She intends to utilize earned profits on the expansion of her business.

loans.use: to buy packs of salt, biscuits, oil, sugar and beverages to meet the demand of her customers time after time.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
After graduating middle school, Esther decided to set up her own ‘kenkey’ selling business. (Kenkey is a traditional Ghanaian staple dish that is made from corn dough and is wrapped in banana leaves.)  She prepares her ‘kenkey’ on her own and proceeds to sell it in Adentem (near Cape Coast). With over 12 years' worth of experience, she is currently looking to expand her enterprise further. Unfortunately, she is limited due to a lack of funding. 

As a result, this loan will be used to help her purchase more maize, thus enabling her to prepare and sell more of her tasty ‘kenkey’. She aims at using the profits from her business to help her husband (who is a mechanic) with the upkeep of their house whilst ensuring that their four children are able to experience a better life.

loans.use: to purchase more maize, thus enabling her to prepare and sell more of her tasty ‘kenkey’

loans.name: Ahlam

texts.en: Ahlam is a 41-year-old mother of two boys and two girls. Her husband works as a security guard while she is working in the tailoring business from home to help in supporting the family. Now, Ahlam is applying for a loan to buy more threads and new sewing tools. She hopes that she can open her own tailoring workshop in the future.

loans.use: to buy more threads and new sewing tools

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en: Mohammad is a 24-year-old single man who has three siblings. Mohammad studies at the university. He is now in his third year of getting a bachelor's degree. He is applying for an educational loan to pay his next semester fees.

loans.use: to pay his semester fees

loans.name: Uzama

texts.en:
Ms. Uzama is 23 years old and a married woman, running her business selling clothes for the last five years. She has three children. Her husband purchases  clothes of good quality fabric from the market and she sells them in her community. She has different varieties of clothes for ladies but now she needs to purchase summer season clothes to keep running her business smoothly and provide the latest variety to customers at their living place. 

Uzama has good credit behavior with Kashf and now she has applied for a loan of Rs.30,000 to purchase the new summer season’s clothes to meet the demand of her community and expand her business. She is hopeful to get an increase in her net income and wishes to spend part of the profits on the expansion of her business.

loans.use: to purchase new summer season’s clothes to meet the demands of her community and expand her business.

loans.name: Sajida

texts.en:
Ms. Sajida is 31 years old and married woman and mother of four children. She has been running a business of animal sales and purchase for a period of about 10 years. She buys animals (baby goats & baby cows) at low prices, brings them up, then her husband sells them out in the market at higher prices. 

Sajida has gradually improved her business with the support of Kashf Foundation; currently she has requested a loan of Rs. 50,000 to purchase two more goats. She is in her 7th loan cycle with a good repayment history.  She hopes to grow her business and dreams of giving a good and quality education to her children through all her hard work in her business.

loans.use: to purchase two more goats.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a single mother hailing from Mbarara municipality. She dropped out of school after getting pregnant at a very early age. After that incident, her parents were so disappointed in her that they stopped paying for her school fees, so that was the end of  school for her. she didn’t get married to the father of the baby and so had to bring up the child on her own. 

Mary later got help from her aunt and started a restaurant business in the nearby market to cater for herself and her child. She is requesting for a loan of 2,000,000 UGX to buy more saucepans and a fridge for  the restaurant.

loans.use: To buy saucepans and a fridge

loans.name: Isabel Leopoldina

texts.es:
La clienta Isabel vive en Guayaquil. Comenzó su tienda desde agosto del 2011 comenzó, vendiendo a sus clientes arroz por libra, aceite, atún poco a poco a mejorado sus ingresos.  En la actualidad trabaja en su tienda de víveres desde las 06h00am y cierra a las 21h00pm.

Su dificultad es la delincuencia que hay en el sector donde ella tiene su negocio. Esta casada su esposo trabaja como chofer de un bus de pasajeros. Tiene 3 hijos los cuales no estudian porque son pequeños.

Con el préstamo quiere comprar arroz, aceite, atún. Su sueño es superar su casa y su negocio y que sus hijos terminen sus estudios.
texts.en:
Isabel lives in Guayaquil. She opened her store in August 2011 and began selling products such as rice by the pound, oil, and tuna to her customers. Gradually she was able to improve her income. Isabel currently works in her grocery store from 6:00 A.M. to 9:00 P.M.

Her difficulty is dealing with the crime that exists in the area where she has her business. Isabel is married and her husband works as a bus driver. They have three children, but they are not in school since they are small.

With this loan, Isabel will buy rice, oil, and tuna. Her dream is to excel at home and with her business, as well as help her children finish their studies.

loans.use: to buy rice, oil, and tuna.

loans.name: Haleema

texts.en:
Ms. Haleema is 50-year-old married woman and is a dedicated mother of two children. She has been efficiently doing a business of milk selling and cattle rearing for many years now. She has one buffalo and two calves. She also purchases small calves and sells them near the Eid-ul-Azha (a religious event in Muslim countries like Pakistan). She earns a good profit from her business. 

In order to grow her sales, she needs to purchase another buffalo. For this reason she contacted Kashf Foundation and applied for a loan of Rs. 30,000. It will ultimately help in increasing production of milk.  She is in her 5th loan cycle with a good repayment history.

loans.use: to purchase another buffalo.

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Samuel is a 39-year-old man from Migori County.  He is married to Caroline who is a business lady.  They have three children who are aged 15, 12 and seven years.

He sells groceries within the Migori Market, a business he has been doing for the last 13 years, and earns a monthly income of 10,000 KES.  He has applied for his first loan from KADET LTD, which he will use to purchase cereals for resale. 

He will use the anticipated profit to reinvest into the business.  His dream is to see his business stabilize so that he can support his family.

loans.use: to purchase more of maize, beans and millet for sale.

loans.name: Zainab

texts.en:
Ms Zainab is a 42-year-old, vigorous lady. She has been stitching clothes for ten years. She stitches for the people of her community and uses the income to support her entire family. However, due to lack of availability of funds, she is unable to meet the daily demands of her customers. 

For this reason, she requested a loan of PKR 20,000 from Kashf Foundation. She intends to use this loan to buy more spools of thread in different colors, along with packs of laces, zippers, and buttons, to create a means of increasing revenue, so she may able to generate a healthier source of income. She is thankful to Kashf Foundation for its tremendous support.

loans.use: to buy more spools of thread in different colors, along with packs of laces, zippers, and buttons.

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en: Catherine operates a retail shop which sells household consumables, such as wheat flour, maize flour, and sugar. Her major challenge is creditors who take too long to pay for goods purchased with credit. With this loan, she wants to purchase more stock for her shop, such as sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour. Catherine decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase stock for her food stall, such as sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour.

loans.name: Alcides

texts.es:
Don Alcides es un señor de 59 años, padre de familia de tres hijos de los cuales dos a su cargo, habita en el municipio de El sauce donde ha vivido toda su vida. Se dedica a laborar como jardinero en una Institución de dicho municipio donde tiene varios años de laborar.

A pesar de su edad se siente muy contento con su trabajo y siente que todavía puede dar más ya que su oficio es lo que más le gusta hacer, cuidar de las plantas y las flores.

Últimamente se ha sentido mal de salud pero debido a su bajo salario no ha podido adquirir la medicina adecuada que le recetó el médico, por lo que se presentó a Ceprodel a solicitar un crédito para la compra de medicamentos y realización de exámenes médicos, con el fin de mejorar y rendir más en su trabajo.

 De su salario depende el pan de cada de su hogar por eso lo ejerce de la mejor manera posible.
Agradece a los inversionistas de Kiva y Ceprodel por el apoyo que le han brindado durante estos años que han ayudado a su familia la cual es muy pobre como muchas que hay en Nicaragua y que necesitan de la mano ayuda de estas personas de buen corazón.
texts.en:
Don Alcides is a 59-year old man, and the father of three children, two of whom are still in his care.  He lives in the municipality of El Sauce, where he has lived all his life.  He makes his living working as a gardener in a city institution.  He has worked there for quite a few years. 

Despite his age, Don Alcides feels very happy with his work.  He feels that he can still give more to his trade, as it is what he likes to do best: take care of the plants and flowers. 

Lately, Don Alcides has been feeling ill, but due to his low salary, he has not been able to get the medicine the doctor prescribe for him.  And so he came to Ceprodel to request a loan so he can purchase the medications and have some medical exams done.  He wants to get better and do more at work.  

Don Alcides's household depends on his salary for their basic sustenance. That is why he does his work as well as possible. 
He is grateful to the Kiva lenders and to Ceprodel for the help they have offered him during these years.  They have helped his family, who are very poor, as are many in Nicaragua.  They really need the helping hand of these good-hearted people.

loans.use: to purchase some medication and have some medical exams done.

loans.name: Rebeca

texts.es:
Rebeca tiene 36 años y esta casada con Raúl de 39 años con quien tiene varios hijos .Tiene una casa hecha de adobe en el cual alberga a toda su familia.Se dedica al cultivo y cosecha de cacao orgánico en una parcela de 3 hectáreas que compro con el resultado de muchos años de trabajo y ayuda de su esposo.
Lleva ya 15 años trabajando al lado de sus hijos mayores con quienes viene desempeñando las constantes tareas como son el retiro de maleza entre los árboles y otros.Cuenta que al adquirir su parcela años atrás fue necesario remover gran parte del terreno para mejorar los nutrientes que posee.Actualmente para llevar a cabo una buena campaña productiva debe contar con capital necesario para el pago a trabajadores del lugar logrando realizar las tareas correspondientes en menos tiempo.A manera de mejorar sus ingresos su esposo Raúl alquilaba un vehiculo mototaxi aprovechando los días donde no realizan actividades en el campo generando ingresos para el bienestar de su familia.Tiene en mente construir su casa a base de material noble para así mejorar su calidad de vida.Este es su segundo préstamo otorgado por Kiva motivo por el cual agradece la oportunidad brindada y espera contar con el apoyo financiero brindado para seguir adelante.En esta oportunidad requiere de 2,000 nuevos soles para comprar abono orgánico y poner en mantenimiento su mototaxi.
texts.en:
Rebeca is 36 years old and married to 39 year old Raul.  They have several children and she has an adobe house where she shelters her family.  She raises and harvests organic cacao on a thee hectare parcel of land that she bought with the proceeds from many years of working and with help from her husband.

She has been working for 15 years alongside her oldest children who have been performing the constant tasks such as weeding and other things.  She says that she needed to turn over a large part of the soil when she first acquired her land, in order to make better use of the nutrients it contains.  She now needs capital to pay local workers to perform the farm tasks in less time and improve production.

In order to improve her income, her husband Raul rented a motorcycle taxi to take advantage of the days when they don't work in the fields. This generates additional income for the family's wellbeing.  She wants to build a house out of solid materials in order to improve her quality of life.  This will be her second loan through Kiva.  She is grateful for the opportunity and she hopes to get this loan so that she can continue ahead.  She is asking for 2,000 PEN so she can buy compost and also perform maintenance on her taxi.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and maintain her taxi.

loans.name: Souleymane

texts.fr:
Monsieur SOULEYMANE est âgé de 33 ans et vit avec son  enfant et son épouse dans une famille traditionnelle à N’TENTOU, dans la sous préfecture  Ouelessebougou, Région de Koulikoro.
Souleymane est enseignant de profession et en plus, mène des activités génératrices de revenus notamment  l’achat vente des petits ruminants. Il a appris cette activité auprès de son oncle maternel, qui  fut jadis un grand commerçant de petits ruminants (moutons et chèvres). 
Dans le souci de satisfaire sa clientèle en nette croissance, il décide de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso, avec qui, il est à son premier prêt individuel  qui servira à acheter,  10 moutons et 5 chèvres auprès des éleveurs des villages environs les jours de foires  qu’il revendra  aux  grossistes venants des grandes villes au comptant à une clientèle mixte.
Il espère réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 80.000 FCFA qui sera utilisé pour rembourser le prêt et  être réinvestir le reste dans les activités.
texts.en:
Mr. Souleymane is 33 years old and lives with his wife and child in a traditional family in N’tentou, in the subprefecture of Oulessebougo, Koulikoro region.
Souleymane is a teacher; in addition, he also earns income in other ways, such as buying and reselling small lovestock. He has learned this trade from his maternal uncle, who used to be a well-known vendor of small livestock (sheep and goats).

With the goal of  meeting the growing customer demand, he has decided to collaborate with Soro Yiriwaso and is now on his first individual loan intended for buying 10 sheep and five goats from farmers in the nearby villages on market days. He will then resell to diverse  wholesalers coming from big cities, for cash. He hopes to earn an average monthly income of 80,000 West African francs, which will be used to repay the loan and reinvest in his business.

loans.use: to buy sheep and goats.

loans.name: Anne

texts.en:
Anne is a married woman with two children who attends school.  She lives in her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. 

For over one year, she has operated a salon business rendering services to her neighbors, friends and passersby.  She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business.  With the loan that she is requesting she wants to purchase hair weaves, hair braids as well as manicure and pedicure kits for resale. 

She decided to join Yehu in order to access loans to increase her business.

loans.use: to purchase hair weaves, hair braids as well as manicure and pedicure kits.

loans.name: Adel

texts.en: Adel is a 54-year-old father of three sons. He is the only supporter of the family. He has a small shop where he re-upholsters and fixes used furniture by adding new padding and then resells it. Adel is applying for a loan to buy new tools for the business and a new collection of fabric to increase his profits.

loans.use: to buy new tools for the business and a new collection of fabrics for re-upholstery of furniture

loans.name: Santos  Antonio

texts.es: Don Santos de 63 años de edad, habita en casa de su propiedad junto con su esposa y su hijo. Él se dedica al cultivo de cafe desde hace 35 años. De esta forma es como se gana la vida y puede llevar el pan de cada día a su hogar. La actividad del cultivo la realiza año con año, y es la única forma que conoce de como ganarse la vida. Es un hombre muy trabajador, honrado y responsable. Ha tomado la decisión de solicitar un crédito para comprar los principales insumos agrícolas: abonos, venenos para plagas, fertilizantes etc. y mejorar el terreno donde siembra que es el que muestra la fotografia. Confía que logrará obtener una cosecha abundante la cual le permitirá seguir llevando el pan de cada día a su hogar.
texts.en: Don Santos is 63 years old and lives in his own home along with his wife and son.  He has worked cultivating coffee for the past 35 years.  In this way he earns his living and supports his family.  The process of farming is what he does year after year, and it is the only way he knows to make a living.  He is a very hard working man, honorable and responsible.  He has made the decision to ask for a loan in order to buy basic agricultural products: fertilizers, insecticides, etc.  He will use these items to improve the land that he plants, which is what you can see behind him in the photograph.  He is confident that he will get an abundant harvest which will allow him to continue providing for his family.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers and pesticides in order to improve his crops.

loans.name: Mirian Isabel

texts.es:
Mirian tiene 26 años de edad, esta acompañada y tiene dos hijos. Desde hace 5 años administra su propia tienda de productos básicos. Los productos para su tienda los compra cada fin de semana en la ciudad que esta a 28 kilómetros de su casa; las compras as hace al por mayor. 

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para comprar mayor cantidad de productos; ya que la demanda esta aumentando, debido a que la población del lugar en donde vive esta incrementado y los productos que tiene disponibles no son suficientes. Y lo que pretende es brindar un mejor servicio y satisfacer a sus clientes. Asi ella, ayudara a su compañero de vida con los gastos del hogar como la salud, educación, alimentación, seguridad etc. Para su familia. Con las ganancias espera ahorrar para mejorar la vivienda ya que no esta en muy buenas condiciones.
texts.en:
Mirian is 26 years old, married, and has two children.  She has been running her own basic products store for five years and buys her products in bulk in the city, 28km from her home, every weekend.

She is asking for this loan through Fundación Campo in order to buy products in quantity, since demand has increased due to the fact that the population in the local area has increased and the products she has on hand are not enough.  She wants to provide better service to her customers.  In this way she can help her life's partner with the household expenses such as health, education, feeding, security, etc. for the family.  She expects to be able to save up some some of her earnings so she can make improvements to her home, which is not currently in good condition.

loans.use: to stock her store.

loans.name: Georgina

texts.en:
Due to difficult circumstances, Georgina did not have access to any form of formal education, yet this has not stopped her from achieving her dream of becoming an entrepreneur. For about three years now, she has been selling onions in Adentem, near Cape Coast. Married to a constructor and the mother of three, Georgina uses all of her income to feed and provide for her family.

Georgina will use this loan to purchase an increased amount of onions, which will aid her in improving her overall sales. She wants to use the future profits from her expanded business to ensure that all her children are able to receive an education.

loans.use: to purchase more onions.

loans.name: Safia

texts.en:
Ms Safia, a 41-year-old married woman, lives with her husband and four children in Punjab, Pakistan. For about two years she is been involved in hand embroidery. Making beautiful patterns for the people of her community, her designs are much in demand and she has managed to consolidate a clientele that allows her to contribute to the expenses of her home.

To continue her operation, Safia has requested a loan of Rs. 30,000 to buy reels of threads in various colors and packs of beads, sequins and stones to embellish her products. She will thereby be able to cater more consistently to her customers and thus increase her income by attracting even more customers.

Safia dreams of a bright future for her children and desires to have more rooms in her house. She is very much thankful to Kashf for its tremendous support.

loans.use: to buy reels of threads in various colors and packs of beads, sequins and stones.

loans.name: Regino Francisco

texts.es:
El señor Regino Francisco es casado dos hijos a su cargo, trabaja de lunes a domingo en su triciclo brindándoles servicios a la población en general, su servicios los presta en los barrios de la florida, san agustín, el rosario repartos aledaños  al mayoreo el bisne donde el tiene mas clientela,  el señor se esfuerza por sacar adelante a sus hijos.

 su trabajo lo empieza desde las cinco de la mañana hasta las cinco de la tarde, se dedica a esta actividad desde hace 7 años, solicita el financiamiento para reparar el triciclo y brindarle mejor servicios  a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Mr. Regina Francisco is married with two children in his care.  He works from Monday to Sunday driving his motorcycle taxi.  He offers his services to the public at large, providing rides in the neighborhoods of La Florida, San Agustín, El Rosario and in surrounding areas, which is where he finds the most clients.  He works hard in order to help his children get ahead.

He begins work at 5am and works until 5pm.  He has been working in this field for the past seven years.  He is asking for a loan in order to repair his motorcycle and in order to offer better service to his customers.

loans.use: To purchase tires and paint in order to remodel his taxi.

loans.name: Hameeda

texts.en:
Ms Hameeda is a 48-year-old, married woman. She has been successfully running a small general store with her husband, at the corner of her house. She has gained five years of experience in this field.  Her husband also assists her by purchasing goods for their inventory from the market, as he has maintained many contacts there, for years.

Hameeda is a mother of six children and is motivated to provide her family with good-quality food, clothing and health care. She wants to grow her business, so she requested a loan of PKR 20,000. She will use it to buy packs of salt, biscuits and beverages, to meet the increasing demand at her store. She is expecting a boost in her earnings and dreams of expanding her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy packs of salt, biscuits and beverages, to meet the increasing demand at her store.

loans.name: Mahmadsharif

texts.ru: Махмадшариф 39-летний женатый мужчина. У него сын и дочь. Он со своей семьей и матерью проживает в городе Душанбе. Его жена работает швеей. Сам Махмадшариф в течение 5 лет работал в парикмахерской. Однако после смерти отца, он  приостановил свою деятельность, истратил свои сбережения и уехал на заработки в Россию. Сейчас по прошествии нескольких лет, Махмадшариф хочет работать в своей родине и заново начать свою прежнюю деятельность. Он уже нашел хорошее помещение для салона. Чтобы начать дело, ему необходимо еще преобрести принадлежности салона. С этим намерением он запрашивает кредит для закупа большого настенного зеркала и кресла для парикмахерской.
texts.en: Mahmadsharif is a 39 year-old married man.  He has a son and a daughter.  He, his family and his mother live in the city of Dushanbe.  His wife works as seamstress.  Mahmadsharif spent 5 years working at a hair salon; however, he slowed down his business after his father's death, spent his savings and went to work in Russia.  Now after several years have passed, Mahmadsharif wants to work in his homeland and start his former business again.  He already found a good location for the salon.  He needs to also purchase all of the equipment for the salon in order to start his business.  With this goal in mind, he is requesting this loan to purchase a large wall mirror and a chair for the hair salon.

loans.use: to purchase a large wall mirror and a chair for the hair salon

loans.name: Jangil

texts.ru: Жангилу 43 года, она замужняя женщина. Жангил заботливая мать, у нее трое детей. Она вместе с семьей живет в районе Шахритус в Хатлонской области. У Жангила  имеется  2 гектара земли, в котором она занимается земледелием уже несколько лет. Жангил хочет начать бизнес в сфере животноводства. Она имеет все условия для разведения скота. Жангил накопила деньги для начала деятельности, а остальную часть запрашивает в кредит. Она берет кредит для закупа крупно-рогатого скота с целью дальнейшего откорма и перепродажи.
texts.en: Jangil is 43 years old. She is married and the caring mother of three. She lives with her familyin the Shahrituz region in Khatlon district. She has 2 ha [about 5 acres] of land and has been growing produce for some years now. Jangil would like to launch a business raising livestock. She has access to everything needed to do this. Jangil has been saving money to launch her business and is requesting a loan for the  remaining funds still needed. She is taking out a loan to buy cattle for fattening and resale.

loans.use: to buy cattle for fattening and resale.

loans.name: Purity

texts.en:
Purity is 42 years old and married to Peter. They have three children, who are in school. She has an Agrovet business in Nakuru, which she has operated for the past four years.

She has applied for her second loan from KADET LTD, which will enable her to buy animal feeds for resale. She repaid her previous loan on time. She hopes to expand her business by opening several branches of animal feed sales places, in the near future.

loans.use: To buy animal feeds for resale.

loans.name: Parveen

texts.en:
Ms Parveen has expertise in embroidery, and she has been using her skill to provide for her family for many years. She started this line of work at a very young age. During the initial years of her business, she barely made enough money to purchase the required materials. Today, she is proud to be famous in her community, and known to be the best at making beautiful patterns with thread and beads.

Five years ago, when she borrowed from Kashf for the first time, she purchased required raw materials. Now she has requested another loan, worth PKR 35,000. She will use it to purchase the latest beads, pearls and sequins, with spools of thread in various colors. She says that the females in her community are becoming demanding with the passage of time, and satisfying them is a challenge that Parveen has taken up. She has six children, and her daughters help her to complete orders in less time, and her other children are going to school. She wants good-quality education for her children.

loans.use: to purchase the latest beads, pearls and sequins, with spools of thread in various colors.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah lives in the Eldoret area of Kenya, which is home to the main campus of Moi University. She has three children and has been involved in farming for two years. Her primary income sources are milk, eggs, tea. Her biggest monthly expenses derive from farming costs, and her biggest challenge is the control of parasites.

Sarah chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan because of the the training it offers farmers. During the required micro-finance training session, she learned the techniques involved in credit management.

As part of Juhudi's loan appraisal process, each borrower's assets are evaluated. Sarah owns the following: 'cow, poultry' but does not own 'pig, pump, bicycle, motorcycle, automobile'. Juhudi Kilimo also tries to measure any change in living standards based on this loan. This borrower has in the household 'mosquito net, electricity, TV, DVD' but does not have 'solar power, running water, sewing machine'.

Note: To create this loan profile, Juhudi Kilimo used a mobile device to gather information in the field and send the data to a central online repository, thus reducing paper use, making the process more efficient, and keeping costs down."

loans.use: To purchase dairy cows

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: la clienta vive con su esposo y sus hijos en casa propia; ella posee una tienda donde vende artículos de primera necesidad, frijoles, leche, huevos, pan, entre otros, tiene muchos años con su negocio y eso le ha regalado experiencia en las ventas que le permite obtener las mejores ganancias, esta ubicada en su lugar de residencia, es muy reconocida por los vecinos de la zona , se ha hecho de mucha clientela, pues tiene la tienda surtida, la clienta quiere acrecentar el negocio y realizar una nueva inversión pero necesita de capital por eso solicita un crédito que le permita comprar lo necesario para su tienda, asegura que cancelara la deuda y a la vez confía en que le dará a su familia una mejor calidad de vida
texts.en:
This client lives with her husband and children in her own house.  She has a store where she sells basic staple items like beans, milk, eggs and bread, among others.  She’s been in business for many years and this has led to her gaining much sales experience that makes it possible for her to earn the best profits.  

Her store is located at home and is very well-known among local residents.  She’s acquired a large clientele because the store is well-stocked.  She wants to increase business and make a new investment in it but needs capital to do so which is why she’s requesting a loan that will make it possible for her to buy everything necessary for her store.  She assures that she’ll repay the loan while at the same time is confident that she’ll give her family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for the store.

loans.name: Gulruhsor

texts.ru: Гулрухсор молодая и целеустремленная женщина. Ей 27 лет. Она замужем и на воспитании имеет 3 детей. Дети не совершеннолетние. Ее муж трудовой мигрант в Российской Федерации. Гулрухсор очень умелая портниха и она занимается шитьем и продажей мужских национальных халатов (чапан). Она продает свою продукцию на местном рынке и имеет своих постоянных клиентов. Она сама справляется с бизнесом. Она дополнительно занимается переработкой косточки абрикоса. Она имеет хороший статус на местном рынке и является сильным конкурентом для других бизнесменов. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 3000 сомони для покупки авиабилета для брата, так как ее брат попросил ему помочь. Ее брат не имеет постоянную работу на родине и поэтому планирует уехать за рубеж с целью найти подходящею работу. Она ждет вашу доброту и надеется на ваше милосердие.
texts.en: Gulruhsor is a young and driven woman.  She is 27 years old, married and raising three children, all of whom are not of age yet.  Her husband is a migrant worker in the Russian Federation.  Gulruhsor is a very skilled seamstress and is involved in sewing and selling men's national robes (chapan).  She sells her goods at a local market and has regular customers.  She is able to handle the business by herself.  Additionally, she is involved in processing apricot seeds.  She has a good reputation at the local market and is a strong competitor for other businessmen.  Gulruhsor is requesting a loan in the amount of 3000 somoni to purchase an airline ticket for her brother because he asked her to help him.  Her brother does not have a permanent job in his native country and this is why he plans to travel abroad to find suitable work.  She relies on your kindness and hopes for your mercy.

loans.use: to purchase an airline ticket for her brother, so that he could find work abroad

loans.name: Efua

texts.en:
Efua is married to a builder and has two children. She has had a primary school education.

For the past three years Efua has sold cutlery and bowls in Adentem, a city near Cape Coast. She uses her income to help pay the household expenses as well as save for a rainy day. She would like an opportunity to expand her enterprise, she doesn’t have the money to do so.

Efua is applying for a 300 GHS loan through CRAN to buy more cutlery and bowls to sell so as to make her business self-sustainable as soon as possible. She plans to channel all new profits back into her kitchen supplies business.

loans.use: to buy more cutlery and bowls to sell.

loans.name: Nyanityobora Youth Development Group

texts.en:
Gerards, aged 40, is a resident of Nyanityobora, a suburb of Mbarara Municipality. He dropped out of school after senior four, because his parents failed to raise the fees. He started up the small business of tailoring in order to survive, and also to care for his children. This business has grown and helps him to   pay fees for his younger brothers.

He first took a loan of 500,000 from UGAFODE, and that loan helped him to do well. With his share of this new, group loan, Gerards wants to buy cloth for his tailoring business. He thus felt motivated to mobilize his colleagues, to form a development group called Nyanityobora Youth Development Association. They accepted the idea, and now the group has also succeeded in other development projects. They are requesting a loan, to help them by increasing their working capital for their different businesses.

loans.use: To buy cloth for his tailoring business

loans.name: Jose Napoleon

texts.es: Don jose de 50 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposa y su hijo el se dedica hacer viajes en su pick up desde hace varios con las ganancias que le quedan de su trabajo logra cubrir algunos gastos de su casa, don jose quiere mejorar su vivienda construyendo unos cuartos pero con lo que gana no le alcanza para cubrir esos gastos por eso solicita un credito para poder comprar los materiales de construccion como cemento, ladrillos, arena,mano de obra, etc. para construir su casa y asi el y su familia puedan vivir mejor y mas seguros.
texts.en: José is 50 years old and lives in his own home with his wife and his son.   He works making trips in his pick-up from various locales.  With his earnings from work his is able to cover household expenses.  José wants to improve his home by building some rooms, but with what he makes he is not able to cover those expenses.  For that reason he is asking for a loan in order to be able to buy construction materials like cement, bricks, sand and labor in order to build his home and thus provide a better and safer life for his family.

loans.use: to purchase materials like sand, cement, bricks, etc. in order to improve his home.

loans.name: Julia Saturnina

texts.es:
La señora Julia vende refrescos y jugos ambulante en el mercado desde hace 5 años es soltera trabaja para ella, para mejorar su calidad de vida,  empezó con su negocio con aporte propio, ella decidió ahorrar para hacer su propio negocio, vende de lunes a domingo, desde las diez de la mañana hasta las dos de la tarde.

 la señora solicita el financiamiento para comprar un balde que necesita y azúcar por quintal  para su negocio.
texts.en:
Señora Julia has sold soft drinks and juice in a stall in the market for five years. She is single and works for herself in order to improve her quality of life. She started her business on her own initiative; she decided to save up to start her own business. She sells every day of the week from 10:00 am to 2:00 pm.
She is requesting a loan for the purchase of a bucket that she needs, as well as sugar by the quintal for her business.

loans.use: to buy basic supplies such as sugar by the quintal, as well as a larger bucket for her drinks.

loans.name: Heithel Santiago

texts.es: El señor Heithel es habitante del municipio de Ticuantepe, casado padre de 2 niños, los trabajan en una Funeraria y luchan dia a dia para poder mejorar sus condiciones de vida ya que sus planes a futuro es terminar de construir su casa, los  materiales a comprar son: Bloques, Cemento, Zinc, Hierro etc. con esto realizara un anexo en la parte trasera de su casa para poder tener mayor espacio  y  mejores condiciones, Agradece el apoyo que Afodenic y Fondos Kiva  le estan brindado.
texts.en: Señor Heithel is a resident of the Ticuantepe municipality. He is a married father of two children. They work at a funeral home and fight every day to improve their living conditions. Their plans for the future are to finish building their home. They need to buy blocks, cement, zinc, iron, etc. With this, Heithel will build an addition on the back of the house in order to have more space and better conditions. He is grateful for the support of Afodenic and Kiva.

loans.use: to buy construction materials.

loans.name: Milagro Del Carmen

texts.es: Doña Milagro de 47 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposo y sus dos hijos de 26 y 11 años de edad, ella tiene un puesto de venta de ropa: blusas, calcetines, ropa interior para damas y caballeros, etc. desde hace varios años en el mercado que esta cerca de su lugar de residencia, con las ganancias que obtiene de sus ventas y con la ayuda de su esposo logran cubrir algunos gastos de su hogar. Doña Milagro solicita un credito para la compra de mas mercaderia para surtir su negocio y asi obtener mejores ganancias y poder seguirle dando a su familia una mejor estabailidad economica.
texts.en: Milagro is 47 years old and lives in her own home with her husband and her two children ages 26 and 11.  She has a stall where she sells clothing: blouses, socks, men's and women's underwear, etc.  She has been working for several years in the market close to her home.  With her earnings from sales and with help from her husband they are able to cover household expenses.  Milagro is asking for a loan in order to purchase more merchandise to supply her business and thus obtain better earnings and be able to continue giving her family better economic stability.

loans.use: To purchase blouses, underwear, socks, etc.

loans.name: Limpai

texts.en:
Limpai is 43 years old and married to Clementine. Together they support nine people in their family.

For the last seven years Limpai has been a farmer and makes 20,000 KES monthly. He is applying for a 50,000 KES loan through KADET LTD to buy fertilizers and seed.

Limpai will use his anticipated profits to buy more land for farming plus goats and cows. His hopes and dreams are to see his family thrive and educate his children to a higher level.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seed.

loans.name: Maama

texts.en:
Maama is married and has ten children. Her husband is a farmer.

Although she never had a formal education, Maama is an entrepreneur. For the past seven years she has sold vegetables and fish in Adentem near Cape Coast. The money she makes normally goes towards helping to cover the family’s general expenses and pay her children’s school fees.

Maama is applying for a 500 GHS loan through CRAN to buy greater quantities of vegetables and fish to sell. She plans to reinvest her profits in her business so she can expand it and meet rising customer demands.

loans.use: to buy greater quantities of vegetables and fish to sell.

loans.name: Augustina

texts.en:
Due to difficult circumstances, Augustina did not have access to any form of formal education. Yet, this has not stopped her from achieving her dream of becoming an entrepreneur. Currently, Augustina sells fish in Adentem (near Cape Coast). She has been doing so for about four years. She is married to a farmer, and together they have four children. Augustina uses all her income to feed and provide for her family.

She will use the loan to purchase an increased amount of fish, which will aid her in improving her overall sales. Augustina wants to use the future profits from her expanded business to ensure that all her children are able to receive an education.

loans.use: to purchase an increased amount of fish

loans.name: Nidia Elizabeth

texts.es: Nidia se dedica a la venta de ropa ineterio para damas y caballeros dedes hace 5 años ejerce este oficio y cuenta con muchos clientes fijos con lo que puede mantener su negocio a flote. con las ganancias que obtiene de sus ventas logar cubrir algunos gastos de su hogar ,ella vive con su compañero de vida y su hijo,  Nidia  solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda comprar mayor cantidad de ropa interior ya que posee gran demanda por parte de muchas personas, con lo que podrá adquirir en diferentes precios, estilos y colores y de esta forma contar con más clientes y así mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Nidia earns her living selling men’s and women’s underwear, a job she’s had for five years. She has many regular customers who help keep her business going. With the money she earns she manages to pay for household expenses. She lives with her husband and son. 

Nidia is seeking a loan to buy more underwear for which there is a great demand. She will be able to buy it at different prices, styles, and colours and so attract more customers and improve her standard of living.

loans.use: buy men's and women's underwear

loans.name: Rukhsana

texts.en:
Mrs. Rukhsana is a 27-year-old married woman and a mother of four. She has been doing a business of tailoring for 12 years to support her husband. She accepted the fact that if her husband alone works for their family, they will not be able to meet the expenses of the household along with the educational needs of her children. That is why she started tailoring at home to support her family as well.

She, together with her husband, manages their household while operating a business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses. Now she requested a loan of 15,000 Pakistan Rupees (PKR) to purchase more spools of thread, along with packs of buttons, laces, etc. In this way, she will be able to meet the increasing demand. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. 

Rukhsana hopes to grow her business and dreams of giving a good quality education to her children through all her hard work in her business.

loans.use: To purchase more spools of thread, along with packs of buttons, laces, etc.

loans.name: Naseem

texts.en:
Ms Naseem is 43 years old and a married woman; she has been successfully running a business of milk sales, with the support of her husband.  She has two buffaloes in milk. She sells their milk to many people of her vicinity, along with butter and cheese that she makes from the milk.  She looks after the buffaloes and performs the task of collecting milk from them, while her husband sells milk to different places, on a daily basis.

Naseem is a mother of five -- two daughters and three sons.  She needs to earn much more, to meet their everyday expenditures, including food, clothing and education. She has gradually improved her business with the support of Kashf Foundation. Now she has requested a loan of PKR 25,000. She will use the loan to purchase another buffalo. She dreams of providing quality education to her children.

loans.use: to purchase another buffalo.

loans.name: Philis Wanjiru

texts.en:
Philis is a farmer from Ndunyu Njeru. She has applied for her fourth loan from KADET LTD to enable her buy fertilizer, seeds, chemicals and pay for labour. She paid her previous loan on time.

She hopes to expand her farming and educate her children.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, seeds, and chemicals and pay for labour

loans.name: Yareisi Maria

texts.es:
Yareysi es una joven comerciante que reside en el  Municipio de Condega desde hace 22 años, ubicado a unos 35 km al norte de la ciudad de Estelí. Esta joven de que esta felizmente casada y sin hijos vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo que se dedica  a la producción de hortalizas.

Esta joven es comerciante y tiene un negocio en su casa de habitación las que es la venta de ropa americana de segunda la que es ofrecida al público en general. Ella vende ropa variada para niños adultos, damas y caballeros, ella tiene su negocio desde hace más de 4 años por lo que es un negocio reconocido lo que le ayuda en la demanda del producto que ofrece.

Esta clienta se presento a las oficinas de Ceprodel para solicitar un financiamiento para la compra de pacas de ropa americana de segunda al por mayor a un buen precio para después ser revendidas en su negocio a un buen precio y obtener ganancias de ella.

 Esta es la quinta ves que ella solicita un financiamiento en Ceprodel con el objetivo de aumentar el inventario de mercadería que ella ofrece y por ende aumentar sus ingresos.

Ella solicita el financiamiento ya que los ingresos que ella capta no son lo suficiente como para poder comprar el producto por cuenta propia. 

En ocasiones anteriores ella a optado a créditos en Ceprodel para asistir este mismo rubro y ella se muestra agradecida ya que le a ayudado a crecer en su negocio e ir ampliando. El impacto a sido positivo y espera que este próximo crédito le sea aprobado y así seguir mejorando su negocio y sus ingresos también.
texts.en:
Yareysi is a young merchant who has lived in the Condega municipality for 22 years. Condega is located 35 km to the north of the city of Estelí. This young woman is happily married and has no children. She lives in her own home with her husband, who grows vegetables.
She is a merchant and has a business in her home selling second-hand American clothing to the general public. She sells varied clothing for men, women, and children. She has had her business for over four years, so it is well-known. This helps with demand.
This client came to Ceprodel's offices to request a loan for the wholesale purchase of packs of used American clothing; it will be bought at a good price. She will then re-sell it in her business at a good price and make more money from it.
This is the fifth time that she has requested a loan from Ceprodel with the goal of increasing her inventory of merchandise and, as a result, increasing her income.
She is requesting a loan because her income is not sufficient to buy the products on her own.
She has previously chosen Ceprodel loans for her business. She is grateful because they have helped her business to grow and expand. The impact has been positive and she hopes that this next loan will be approved and her business and income will improve.

loans.use: to buy packs of second-hand clothing for resale.

loans.name: Najama

texts.en:
Najama is a 29-year-old married woman. Her husband is employed in a textile mill, but his income is not sufficient to meet the needs of their family members.

To help cover their expenses Najama has sold milk for the past thirteen years. Her customers are the people in her community and she has a good clientele.

Najama is in her sixth loan cycle with CRAN and has repaid her previous loans in a timely manner. She is now applying for a 20,000 PKR loan through Kashf Foundation to buy another buffalo. She is hopeful that she will realize a boost in her earnings and plans to reinvest her profits in her business.

loans.use: to buy another buffalo.

loans.name: Norma Luz

texts.es: Norma 43 años de edad, es una madre soltera, la cual es muy responsable y quien tiene como prioridad principal sacar adelante a sus dos hijas. Ella posee una venta de tortillas, en la cual se encarga de elaborar cada mediodía y cada noche. Su negocio esta ubicado en su casa de habitación lugar en el cual sus hijas le ayudan a repartir las tortillas, sobretodo en los fines de semana. Norma desea mucho poder mejorar su negocio, ya que este brinda ganancias muy estables, lo cual le permite sostener a su familia, es por esto que solicita un préstamo por medio del cual pueda comprar maíz por mayor y cal, esto para elaborar mayor cantidad de tortillas, sobretodo los fines de semana que su demanda se incrementa debido a que muchas otras tortillerías están cerradas y asi ella pueda obtener mayores ganancias las cuales le permitan mejorar su estabilidad economica.
texts.en:
43-year old Norma is a single mother. She is a very responsible woman whose main priority is to see her two children do well in life. She has a business selling the tortillas she has made between midday and the evening. Her business is located in her house, and her daughters help her distribute the tortillas especially at weekends.

Norma really wants to improve her business because it provides a stable income that allows her to support her family. For this reason she is seeking a loan to buy corn in bulk and lime so she can make a greater quantity of tortillas especially on weekends when demand increases because many other tortilla makers close their businesses. In this way she will be able to earn more money allowing her to have more financial stability.

loans.use: buy corn to make tortillas

loans.name: Zulema

texts.es:
Zulema es soltera y no tiene hijos, vive en la casa de sus papas donde cuenta con un ambiente y se encuentra el dormitorio y una cocina, la  habitación es de adobe y el piso de cemento, la casa se encuentra ubicada en la zona Senkata de la ciudad del Alto, estudió en la universidad la carrera de bioquimica-farmaceutica, .
Actualmente trabaja en la farmacia de un centro de salud ubicada en la ciudad de La Paz,  Zulema trabaja todos los días de la semana y también  colabora en el pago de los servicios, comida y vestimenta.
El crédito lo requiere para compra y venta de medicamentos que no hay en farmacia del mismo centro de salud, para ayudar a las personas que lo necesitan.
El sueño de Zulema es poder contar con capital de trabajo y poder contar con los medicamentos para hacer llegar a las personas que más lo necesitan y Zulema pueda sentirse mejor con estas obras.
Es la primera vez que solicita crédito junto a IMPRO Y KIVA.
texts.en:
Zulema is single and has no children. She lives at her parents’ house where it has a good atmosphere. The house is made of adobe and has cement floors, a bedroom, and a kitchen. Her home is located in the District of Senkata of the city of El Alto. Zulema is studying at the university for a degree in biochemistry and pharmacology.

She currently works at a pharmacy at a health center in the city of La Paz. Zulema works every day of the week and also contributes to the payment for services, food, and clothing. The loan she is requesting will be used for buying and selling medicines that are not stocked in the health center pharmacy. Zulema will be able to help the people who need these medicines.

Zulema’s dream is to have operating capital so that she can have enough medicines for the people who need them the most. She can then feel better about her work. This is the first time she has requested a loan from IMPRO and Kiva.

loans.use: to buy medicines.

loans.name: Maame

texts.en:
Maame is married and has two children. Her husband works as a mechanic.

Although she has received no prior formal education, Maame is an entrepreneur. For the past three years she has sold different kinds of foods from her stall in Adentem near Cape Coast. The proceeds from her sales normally go towards helping to cover the family’s general expenses and pay the children’s school fees.

Maame is applying for a 500 GHS loan through CRAN to buy more stock for her stall and so improve her overall sales. With her anticipated profits Maame plans to further diversify the types of products that she sells so she can adapt to changing customer demand.

loans.use: o buy more stock for her stall.

loans.name: Elsy Guadalupe

texts.es: Elsy de 45 años de edad vive con sus dos hijos y una nuera el menor de sus hijos de pende de ella, hace unos años elsy decidió abrir su propio negocio de venta de artículos de alimentación básicos necesarios en su vecindario como huevos, cafe, azucar, leche, golosinas, etc. con las ganancias que obtiene de sus ventas y la ayuda que le da su hijo mayor logran solventar los gastos de su hogar. Doña Elsy quiere acrecentar su negocio por eso solicita un credito que le permita surtir mas su negocio con golosinas, huevos, aceite, azucar, entre otros y asi asegurar un mejor bienestar para su familia.
texts.en:
45-year old Elsy lives with her two children and a daughter-in-law. She still supports her younger son. A few years ago Elsy decided to open her own business selling basic foods such as eggs, coffee, sugar, milk, candy etc. With the money she earns and help from her older son, she manages to pay for household expenses.

Sra. Elsy now wishes to expand her business so she is seeking a loan to buy more stock such as candy, eggs, oil, sugar etc. and thus ensure a better standard of living for her family.

loans.use: buy eggs, sugar, milk, candy, basic grains etc.

loans.name: Bushra

texts.en:
Bushra is a 27-year-old married woman. For the past five years she has sold milk to make money. She has become famous in her neighborhood for her good-quality milk. She has a good client list and makes enough money to help cover her family’s expenses.

Bushra has been in association with Kashf Foundation for five years. She is applying for a 30,000 PKR loan to buy another buffalo. She expects a boost in her earnings from doing so and plans to reinvest her profits in her business.

loans.use: to buy another buffalo.

loans.name: Odai

texts.en: Odai is a 22-year-old single guy. He has three siblings. Odai is a university student majoring in Arabic literature and language. He is applying for an educational loan to pay for his next semester's fees.

loans.use: To pay for his next semester's fees

loans.name: Jose Daniel

texts.es: don jose de 45 años de edad, vive con esposa y sus dos hijos en casa propia, el es un hombre trabajador, responsable .desde hace 23 años se dedica a la  producción y venta de productos lácteos en la zona donde reside. Tiene muy buena clientela ya que ha sabido ganarse la confianza de sus clientes. Ofrece calidad y buenos precios en sus productos, ha decidido invertir en el cuidado de sus ganados ya que de eso depende su negocio. Por eso ha solicitado un crédito para poder comprar vitaminas y concentrado para el ganado. Con esto espera obtener resultados favorables y continuar brindando la ayuda económica a su hogar que tanto lo necesita
texts.en: Jose is 45 years old and lives with his wife in a home of his own.  He is a hardworking, responsible man who has been producing and selling dairy products for 23 years.  He has good customers since he has earned their confidence.  He offers good quality products at good prices and he has decided to invest in the care of his livestock because his business depends on it.  He is asking for a loan so he can buy vitamins and feed for his livestock.  With this he expects to obtain favorable results and continue to help his family out financially with what they need.

loans.use: to buy vitamins and feed.

loans.name: Betty Mirella

texts.es:
La clienta Betty vive en Guayaquil. Ella empezó por falta de empleo ya que tenía que  encontrar la forma de generar ingresos para su casa. Con el bono que da el Gobierno de Ecuador se puso la tienda comprando ciertos víveres.

La dificultad que ella tiene en el negocio es la delincuencia que hay en  las noches en el sector donde ella tiene la tienda.

Con el préstamo quiere comprar más mercadería para su tienda como arroz, enlatados, bebidas, granos. Su sueño es poder tener su tienda grande y en un sector tranquilo.
texts.en:
Betty lives in Guayaquil. She started off without a job, so she had to find a way to generate income for her household. With a grant she received from the Ecuadorian government, Betty was able to open a store by purchasing certain grocery items.

Her difficulty is dealing with the crime that exists at night in the area where she has her shop. With this loan, Betty will buy more merchandise for her store such as rice, canned goods, beverages, and grains. Her dream is to have a large store in a peaceful area.

loans.use: to buy rice, canned goods, beverages, and grains.

loans.name: Luis Alberto

texts.es:
El cliente Luis vive Quevedo. Sus padres comenzaron el negocio de ventas de frutas y le enseñaron como manejar el negocio. En la actualidad tiene un puesto de sandias y frutas y trabaja desde las 8h00 hasta las 18h00.

No tiene ninguna dificultad, es soltero, no tiene hijos. Con el préstamo quiere comprar frutas, sandias. Su sueño es completar sus estudios y ser dueño de una escuela, tener su hogar y salud para cumplir sus sueños.
texts.en:
Luis lives in Quevedo.  His parents started the business of selling fruit, and they taught him how to run the business.  He now has a watermelon and fruit stand.  He works from 8:00 a.m. until 6:00 p.m.

He does not have any difficulty.  His is single, and he does not have children.

He wants to use the loan to buy fruit and watermelons.

His dream is to finish his education, to own a school, to have a home, and to be healthy in order to fulfill his dreams.

loans.use: to buy fruit.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice has a retail shop in Ndunyu Njeru. She has applied for her third loan from KADET LTD to enable her to buy more inventory of sugar, maize flour, and detergents for sale. She paid her previous loan on time. 

She hopes to expand her business and buy dairy cows in the near future.

loans.use: to buy more sugar, maize flour, and detergents

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay final registration fees.

loans.name: Rogelio Antonio

texts.es:
Rogelio es un hombre dedicado a la actividad comercial que recibió anteriormente un credikiva con el que compró chancletas, juegos de cubiertos, camisas, gafas, paraguas, ropa interior y como todo esto lo habían encargado sus clientes, por eso lo vendió rápidamente. Su crédito ha contribuido con el crecimiento de su negocio pues ahora maneja mejor sus inventarios y responde mas oportunamente a sus clientes, incrementando su volumen de ventas. Y adquiriendo precios de oportunidad y todo esto gracias a Kiva. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva con el cual comprará artículos para el hogar electrodomésticos menores, que son regalos muy usuales para atender la demanda del día de las madres, día que hace del mes de junio, la primera temporada del semestre mas comercial del año. 
Rogelio envía un mensaje a los financiadores de Kiva: “Su apoyo es muy importante ya que con este he podido hacer crecer mas mi negocio. “
texts.en:
Rogelio operates a store for which he previously received a Kiva loan. He used that loan to buy flip-flops, cutlery sets, shirts, glasses, umbrellas and underwear. All of these items had been previously ordered by his customers, so he sold them very quickly. Rogelio’s previous loan helped him grow his business so that he can now better manage his inventory, respond more appropriately to his customers and increase his sales volume. He is also now able to buy inventory at good prices when opportunities arise – all, he says, thanks to Kiva.

Rogelio is now requesting a Kiva loan to buy items for the home such as small appliances that are customary gifts for Mother’s Day, which is his busiest time during the first half of the year.

Rogelio sends this message to Kiva lenders: “Your support is very important because with it I have been able to grow my business.”

loans.use: to buy items for the home such as small appliances that are customary gifts for Mother’s Day.

loans.name: Shareefan

texts.en:
Ms Shareefan is a 52-year-old, married woman, running a business of milk-selling with her husband for ten years. The man shown in the photo is Shareefan’s husband. 

They have two buffaloes in milk and they sell their milk to many of their neighbors, along with butter and cheese that they make from the milk. They are happily doing it together to support their family. 

Shareefan is a mother of two daughters and one son. She needs to earn much more money to meet their everyday expenditures, including food, clothing, and education. She is in her second loan cycle. 

In order to make huge profits, she requested a loan of PKR 30,000/- to buy one more buffalo to cater to more customers. In this way, she would be able to increase her sales. She hopes to get an increase in her net income and wishes to spend it on the betterment of her family members.

loans.use: to buy one more buffalo to cater to more customers.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is a married mother of one child, who attends school. She owns a house that has electricity, but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees and household consumables.

For over eight years, she has operated a tailoring business, sewing her clients' clothes from home. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her place of business. 

With the KES 20,000 loan, she wants to purchase cloth materials, needles, and sewing threads. She decided to join Yehu Microfinance Trust to access loans, to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase cloth materials, needles, and sewing threads for her business.

loans.name: Rabiatu

texts.en:
After graduating primary school, Rabiatu decided to set up her own vegetable business in Adentem (near Cape Coast). With over two years of experience, she is currently looking to expand her enterprise further. Unfortunately, she is limited, due to a lack of funding. 

As a result, this loan will be used to help her to purchase more vegetables for resale. She aims to use the profits from her business to help support her husband, who is a driver, with the upkeep of their house, while ensuring that their three children are able to experience a better life.

loans.use: to purchase more vegetables for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy cement, blocks, purlins and zinc.

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
Ahmad is a 20-year-old single man; he has two older brothers. Ahmad studies medical laboratory sciences at the University. 

Ahmad is applying for an educational loan to pay for his next semester fees so he can graduate and start working in the field.

loans.use: to pay for his next semester fees

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice is 27 years old, married and a mother of three children. For the last two years, Beatrice has earned a living by selling milk in Malindi. She now earns a monthly profit of KES. 17,000, and her business is doing well. 

Beatrice was introduced to KADET LTD by a credit officer, and is applying for her second loan of KES 30,000 to buy additional items for her business like milk cans, milking gloves, water cans for the cows to drink from and so on. She will use the profits made possible by this loan to pay school fees for her children as well as to expand her farming activities. 

Her goal for the future is to venture into mixed farming with a goal of increasing her income so as to help improve her family's living standards.

loans.use: to buy milk cans, milking gloves and water cans

loans.name: Karen Raquel

texts.es: Karen de 26 años de edad, es soltera en la actualidad no está trabajando, ella tiene muchos  deseos de superación y busca como lograrlo estudiando una carrera universitaria en contabilidad pública y finanzas, por medio a una beca gracias a sus buenas calificaciones, ella en más de una ocasión ha tenido que dejar de estudiar por falta de ingresos para movilizarse. Solicita este crédito para pagar el curso de titulación, lo que le permitirá aspirar a un buen empleo para ayudar a sus padres quienes son de escasos recursos.
texts.en: Karen is 26 years old, she is single and she is currently unemployed. She has a great desire to succeed in life and she is trying to do it by attending university thanks to a scholarship and studying Public and Financial Accountancy. More than once she has been obliged to abandon her studies for lack of economic resources to reach university. She is requesting a loan to pay for her university fees, as this will help her aspire to the good job she wants to support her parents who are not very rich.

loans.use: To pay for university fees.

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en:
Emmanuel is a 27-year-old man from Bugesera district in the Eastern province of Rwanda. 

He is seeking a loan of RWF 30,000.00 to purchase 10 rechargeable LED lights, which he will resell to people without electricity in his village. Every week or so, these customers will return to him to have their lights recharged for just RWF 100. 

Emmanuel started selling lights in May, 2012, and he has sold 160 lights to date, providing clean energy to 800 people. He is also a shopkeeper and will reinvest the money he makes into expanding his other business to earn more money for himself, his wife Speciose, and their child.

loans.use: To pay for 10 low-cost LED lights to resell to rural households without electricity.

loans.name: Xaverina

texts.en: Xaverina is a 48-year-old woman from Gicumbi District, in the Northern Province of Rwanda. She is seeking a loan of RWF 30,000.00 to purchase 10 rechargeable LED lights, which she will resell to people who are without electricity in her village. Every week or so, these customers will return to her, to have their lights recharged for just $0.20. Xaverina started selling lights in December, 2012, and she has sold 20 lights to date, providing clean energy to 100 people. She is also a farmer and will reinvest the money she earns into expanding her other business, to earn more money for herself, her husband, Straton, and their children.

loans.use: To pay for 10 low-cost, LED lights, which she will resell to rural households that are without electricity.

loans.name: Faustin

texts.en:
Faustin is a 40-year-old man from Rwamagana District in the Eastern Province of Rwanda. He is seeking a loan of RWF 30,000.00 to purchase 10 rechargeable LED lights, which he will resell to people without electricity in his village. Every week or so, these customers will return to him to have their lights recharged for just $0.20. 

Faustin  tarted selling lights in April 2012, and he has sold 40 lights to date, providing clean energy to 200 people. With the money he makes from selling and recharging lights, he will pay for the school fees of his five children (Denise, Dieudonne, Hoziana, Claude, and Pacifique).

loans.use: To pay for 10 low-cost LED lights to resell to rural households without electricity.

loans.name: Vincent

texts.en:
Vincent is making progress toward repaying his first Kiva loan. He states that the support given by Kiva has enabled him expand his business beyond his village and has increased his business income. He is seeking a top-up loan of RWF 30,000.00 to buy 10 more rechargeable LED lights, which he will resell to people without electricity in his village. 

Every week or so, these customers will return to him to have their lights recharged for just RWF 100. He is also a shopkeeper and is reinvesting the money he makes into expanding his other business, to earn more money for himself, his wife Grace, and their two children.

loans.use: to pay for 10 low-cost LED lights to resell to rural households without electricity.

loans.name: Bernadette

texts.en:
Bernadette is a 47-year-old woman from Rulindo District in the Northern Province of Rwanda. 

She is seeking a loan of RWF 30,000.00 to purchase 10 rechargeable LED lights, which she will resell to people without electricity in her village. Every week or so, these customers will return to her to have their lights recharged for just RWF 100.00. Bernadette started selling lights in July 2012 and she has sold 60 lights to date, providing clean energy to 300 people. 

She is also a farmer and will reinvest the money she makes into expanding her other business to earn more money for herself and her husband and grandchildren.

loans.use: to pay for 10 low-cost LED lights to resell to rural households without electricity.

loans.name: Felecien

texts.en:
Felecien is a 46-year-old man from  Rulindo District in the Northern Province of Rwanda. 

He is seeking a loan of RWF 30,000.00 to purchase 10 rechargeable LED lights, which he will resell to people without electricity in his village. Every week or so, these customers will return to him to have their lights recharged for just RWF 100.00. Felecien started selling lights in October 2012 and he has sold 20 lights to date, providing clean energy to 100 people. 

He is also a shopkeeper and will reinvest the money he makes into expanding his other business to earn more money for himself, his wife Patricia, and their 6 children.

loans.use: to pay for 10 low-cost LED lights to resell to rural households without electricity.

loans.name: Clementine

texts.en:
Clementine is a 35-year-old woman from Rwamagana District in the Eastern Province of Rwanda. 

She is seeking a loan of RWF 30,000.00 to purchase 10 rechargeable LED lights, which she will resell to people without electricity in her village. Every week or so, these customers will return to her to have their lights recharged for just RWF 100.00. 

Clementine started selling lights in May 2012 and has sold 80 lights to date, providing clean energy to 400 people. She is also a shopkeeper and will reinvest the money she makes into expanding her other business to earn more money for herself, her husband, Evaliste, and their three children.

loans.use: To pay for 10 low-cost LED lights to resell to rural households without electricity.

loans.name: Warah

texts.en:
Greetings from Sierra Leone! This is 32-year-old Warah from Tombo Western rural area. She is married with two children aged of 3 and 8. One of her children attends school.

Warah runs a food stand business. She sells onions, tomato paste, Maggi, and cooking seasoning. She has been running this business since 2005. She works at the business 10 hours per day and 7 days per week. Warah says that the main challenge to her business is low purchasing power of customers.

Warah has requested a loan in order to purchase onions, tomato paste, Maggi, and cooking seasoning. The extra income from this loan will allow her to take good care of her children. In the future, she plans to buy a piece of land. She thanks you for your support!

loans.use: to purchase onions, tomato paste, Maggi, and cooking seasoning.
